column4: >As the vision for our project has evolved so have the the lives being touched! On this year's International Women's Day, we couldn't be more excited to celebrate the success of the 20 women that have been involved with Glorious Women's Empowerment Network - our micro-lending project. At the same time, we are asking you help us extend this opportunity to 10 new women in the Tanzanian community.

column1: Each of the women in our program has paid back her loan in full, and continues to impress us with the progress they are making to run a successful business and improve the lives for their children and family.

column1:
What We Need - $5000 

$5000 will allow us to provide $500 loans to ten women entrepreneurs and launch their new businesses and transform their lives, the lives of their children and send endless ripples into their society.
A MicroLoan Meeting led by Alice

column5: line-height: 30px
column7: >Meet Some of the Glorious Leaders - Success Stories

column5: line-height: 30px

column1: Meet some of our #GloriousWomen --
Mama Zaisha
column5: >had been struggling to support herself and her family ever since her husband left her and her children years ago. Because of the loan, she was able to start two business: one selling milk and the other selling t-shirts in her local market. As a result, she was able to enroll her daughter in school and construct a house for her family.  She is now the sole provider for her family.

column1: Talk about impact! The loan equipped Mama Maliki with all of the tools for her and her family to thrive.

Mama Suleiman, who joined our micro-finance program last year is now selling a yogurt drink (pictured on the below) which has become a hot breakfast item in the community! Each morning she sells out of the drink, which she sells for 2,500 shillings (about $1.50) She also takes the drink to a nearby market, and in total sells around 100L every 3 days. With the proceeds, this widow is able to support her four children and her mother.

Meet Mama Jennifer! A few years ago her husband was in an accident and was critically disabled. Today, she supports her family (her husband, 4 children and 1 grandchild) and maintains an undying smile. The microloan has allowed her to sell produce in the local market and work towards her dream of creating a house where she and all her family can live together.

We hope to continue investing in women entrepreneurs around the globe, they are a powerful, positive force -- and you can help! Join us in celebrating the successes of these women leaders and welcoming many more #PowerWomen into Glorious' community. Donate today, lets #MakeitHappen!
","#MakeItHappen #PowerWomen
Our Vision
Our vision at Glorious has always been to empower local leaders (like Alice) to transform their lives and communities.
Empowering Women through Investing in their Business

As the vision for our project has evolved so have the the lives being touched! On this year's International Women's Day, we couldn't be more excited to celebrate the success of the 20 women that have been involved with Glorious Women's Empowerment Network - our micro-lending project. At the same time, we are asking you help us extend this opportunity to 10 new women in the Tanzanian community.

Each of the women in our program has paid back her loan in full, and continues to impress us with the progress they are making to run a successful business and improve the lives for their children and family.

What We Need - $5000 $5000 will allow us to provide $500 loans to ten women entrepreneurs and launch their new businesses and transform their lives, the lives of their children and send endless ripples into their society.
A MicroLoan Meeting led by Alice
Meet Some of the Glorious Leaders - Success Stories
Meet some of our #GloriousWomen --

Mama Zaisha had been struggling to support herself and her family ever since her husband left her and her children years ago. Because of the loan, she was able to start two business: one selling milk and the other selling t-shirts in her local market. As a result, she was able to enroll her daughter in school and construct a house for her family.  She is now the sole provider for her family.
Talk about impact! The loan equipped Mama Maliki with all of the tools for her and her family to thrive.

Mama Suleiman, who joined our micro-finance program last year is now selling a yogurt drink (pictured on the below) which has become a hot breakfast item in the community! Each morning she sells out of the drink, which she sells for 2,500 shillings (about $1.50) She also takes the drink to a nearby market, and in total sells around 100L every 3 days. With the proceeds, this widow is able to support her four children and her mother.

Meet Mama Jennifer! A few years ago her husband was in an accident and was critically disabled. Today, she supports her family (her husband, 4 children and 1 grandchild) and maintains an undying smile. The microloan has allowed her to sell produce in the local market and work towards her dream of creating a house where she and all her family can live together.
Do something Glorious! Join us.

We hope to continue investing in women entrepreneurs around the globe, they are a powerful, positive force -- and you can help! Join us in celebrating the successes of these women leaders and welcoming many more #PowerWomen into Glorious' community. Donate today, lets #MakeitHappen!",7.0,0,"1 Campaign

Check out the inspiration for AshNetwork here.

AshNetwork - created by a 17 year old after witnessing the travails of his lower middle class family trying to earn a decent living.

Made for anyone anywhere in the world.

100 ASH = $----  <
column2:
---- Click link to go to updates ----

**Note: Our rewards are inclusive (i.e. You make the $50 pledge, and you get the $50, $20, and $1 rewards, see below for more details.

Current ways to earn AshCash:

Shop Online:

We have partnered up with over 200 different online retailers, big and small (see video), to allow our users to earn by simply shopping on these websites. The amount of AshCash users receive is calculated using the total amount spent. For example, you go to site XYZ and make a $65 purchase. In our database, we have the percentage return for site XYZ, which in this example is 4%. 4% of $65 is $2.60, and based on our exchange rate at the time, the user will receive that $2.60 in AshCash.

column1: <figure style=""margin: 0px
column2: >
column5: fit=max&amp
column8: s=1bfef633906e0f93e05b1378ecfcf5b5"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: Play Games:
Many teens and desk workers use online games to refresh their mind. They get really good at these games, and have nothing to show for it except a few high scores. AshNetwork has changed all that.

Our buy-in tournaments have small entry fees but allow you to win big! Enter with a fee from 1- 100 ASH, and win 1,000 to 100,000 ASH. Second and third place also win AshCash and some tournaments even have participation prizes. We have many fun games to choose from, and our platform has an API to allow interested game developers to connect their games to the AshNetwork database.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
column2: >
column5: fit=max&amp
column8: s=3b9b0d98b2e0d10c29441600bdd85c9d"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: Tasks, Offers, and Surveys:
You might have seen this around the web. Sign up for an account on a site, and earn. Buy a subscription or product, and earn. Get a insurance quote, and earn. Complete a survey, and earn.

These are not the favorite of many online users because they ask for credit cards and lots of personal information. We have picked the most trustworthy companies to partner with, so for those of you that like this kind of thing, we got you covered.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
column2: >
column5: fit=max&amp
column8: s=a2f4981e0006c86b6953619880de030e"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: Buy Entertainment Media:

Songs, movies, TV shows, eBooks, and apps are costing more and more these days. To amass a small library of 200 songs, you could pay anywhere from $180 to $258. Movies can cost up to $9.99 just for renting. TV shows are up to $3.99 on demand PER EPISODE.

We have found a way to give back to the users. Through our partnership with iTunes®, users can now use our specially generated links which direct you straight to the iTunes application on either your computer or portable device. From there you can buy your media directly off iTunes and earn AshCash every time you make a purchase.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
column2: >
column5: fit=max&amp
column8: s=4c2e0f9a4dec39d759ab64849bc557a2"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: Trade Ins:

Trade ins have been offered on the web for a while now. You can sell phones, books, and more. But you always see sites offering you less money than you would get if you sold it in online auction. But you don't want to deal with the hassle of online auction.

We decided to bridge the gap by removing the hassle and getting users more bang for your buck. Through our trade in system, users ship directly to us, and they get more than they would on other sites because we don't have to deal with the fees involving cash payouts to users. We just pay our users through AshCash!
Refer others:

Users can pick up a referral link on their profile page. Rather than have the simple 100 point per referral system, we decided on an exciting new referral system: percentage referrals. Users refer others using their link, and if a user signs up, then every time the new users earns, the user that referred gets a randomly generated 1 - 15% of the AshCash amount the new user earned. This happens on every positive transaction the new user has FOR LIFE.
Watch Videos:
Users can watch videos to earn marginal AshCash. Our video selection is small, but growing. And our video section is part of one of our stretch goals.
Spend AshCash through...
<ul>

• Our rewards store. Currently has gift cards which allows users to receive rewards quick and easy. Our systems allows us to send gift cards automatically without someone having to send all the codes manually through email. We will be adding more products to our store, some virtual and some physical. AshCash is not simply a tool to get gift cards!

• Our lotteries and giveaways. Spend AshCash on our Pick 'em lottery system, which lets users win even more AshCash. Or spend AshCash to enter in giveaways. Giveaway prizes could be as small as gift cards to as large as TVs and even the occasional cruise!
<figure style=""margin: 0px
column5: fit=max&amp
column8: s=a2db5e8bc6a94c811b12370f03c7284b"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: We Need You....
Our site is currently running locally, and sometimes we have it open on the web. We'll be able to share our URL with you shortly.
We have our SSL certificate already as well as our domain, so all transactions with AshCash are encrypted.

We need to move to a faster, dedicated server. We are currently running on shared hosting for development and testing and it frustrates us sometimes how slow the server is. Sometimes our database is so overloaded that our site is inaccessible. We definitely cannot launch on this hosting. As soon as we reach our goal, we are moving servers and will have the website live for everyone to see the homepage (sign up will still be disabled).

We need to get partners with us because currently the company is two people, me and my mom. And my mom doesn't even do anything. I need a designer because my Photoshop skills are very basic. A fellow PHP and/or HTML5/CSS coder is also necessary.
We have other ideas that will allow users to earn more ""lucratively"", but they require certain assets that we do not have.

Rewards: New accounts on our site are automatically awarded 100 ASH. If you pledge at least $20, we will make you an account with your desired username. The account will be credited with the amount list in the reward description.
On top of the account, we want to offer inclusive rewards. For example, say you make a $100 pledge.
The rewards you receive are:
<ul>
• Contributor Listing
• Be a Beta Tester
• Verified Account Status
• Account with 42,500 ASH
We feel this is the best way to add a lot of value to your contribution. Let us know if you have any further questions regarding rewards, or anything else.

Risks and challenges

First of all, we will have a small budget for advertising even after all of your contributions. Marketing our website and spreading the word will be hard. But we have a strategy in place, and we hope that you guys can help us out on social media to help spread the word.

None of our services can be patented, which means these methods can (and have been) replicated. We know there are other sites out there with similar services. But at AshNetwork we feel we have the greatest collection of services, and the best ideas for new services that will allow our users to earn.

Ashwin Rajgopal, the majority owner, is still in high school (class of 2016). He has certain priorities that come before the business, such as college admissions (hopefully you understand). That is one reason why we are trying to bring in more people. The admissions process for Ashwin could be done as early as January, which in that case Ashwin will be back to the business almost full time.

Other Notes to Consider:

The basic process on AshNetwork:

AshNetwork is the place to earn rewards while surfing the internet. We're working hard to bring you many different ways to earn so you no longer have to deal with annoying internet quirks without being compensated for your troubles. And best of all, AshNetwork provides a 256 bit encryption so your account is safe. AND WE NEVER ASK FOR OR STORE CREDIT CARD NUMBERS ON OUR SITE.


We are also NOT competitors with your favorite miles-earning credit card or cash back credit card. Use those in tandem with our shopping section!

We have many ideas on how to expand the business. We don't want to share these ideas, since they may be stolen, but they could very likely be stretch goals. Fund us to let AshNetwork reach its true potential.

Many current rewards program users deal with expiring points, small selections of rewards, and points dispersed over various accounts. It is unfair to those users who earn so many points to be ill-treated by companies they are buying goods and services from. 

AshNetwork will bring the fairness back to rewards programs by never expiring points, continually adding rewards, and keeping users' hard-earned points in one spot. AshNetwork is always working to bring the next big way for its users to earn, so we are always expanding our market so more consumers can benefit.

Note about AshCash: AshCash is a virtual currency created by us. AshCash has no monetary value and cannot currently be exchanged for any real currency (USD, GBP, CAN, etc.) legally. The exchange rate between AshCash and USD is recalculated consistently using a formula we created based on the laws of supply and demand. We're giving you AshCash as a reward, and since gift cards cannot be rewards on Indiegogo, we'll also have some limited edition AshNetwork merchandise and other famous Indiegogo products for backers to redeem with their starter AshCash.

Hello, my name is Joe, and I'd like to thank you for taking a moment to dream with me...

From an early age I have always dreamed of having my own business. Many times that dream changed, but it always circled back around to what I feel my calling is....a Motel owner. But not just any Motel owner. I have always had an extreme love of the unknown, the unexplained, basically all things that go “bump” in the night. This has pretty much made me the Griswalds of Halloween, and this is where you can help. ￼
I crossed off a haunting item on my bucket list in May, 2017 when I stayed at the Clown Motel. I enjoyed it, but must admit, it needs some updating. I hear my calling getting louder, my time is now &
column2: I need your help. The infamously mysterious landmark, The Clown Motel has become available. Funds are needed to not only purchase the property, but also do an overhaul to bring it up to date with a bit more wonder around each corner that you won't want to miss.

column1: However I need to move fast, before my dream turns into a nightmare. If I don't move and act now, there's the chance a big corporate chain could buy it, and dissolve all of it's luster. Let's not allow this iconic haunting landmark slip into the hands of a huge corporation and be turned into a bland, white walled, ordinary Motel 6, Holiday Inn or Best Western. Help me preserve this uniquely haunting hotel for generations to come.
Where will your support go you ask? Updates and renovations would include creating a website to allow online booking &
column2: let you know about all haunting events to come. New carpeting, beds, linens, and upgrading to a new key card system. Major sponsor's will receive a haunting surprise!

column1: ￼    If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still help out by getting the word out there. Share this campaign with all of your friends and family on your Social Media pages using the Indiegogo sharing options and tools.

Supporting my dream you get to be part of a haunting history and ensuring that the Clown Motel is around for years to come. Thank you again from the bottom of my heart, I truly hope WE can make this dream a reality. Hope to see you soon at The Clown Motel￼!
","Hello, my name is Joe, and I'd like to thank you for taking a moment to dream with me...

From an early age I have always dreamed of having my own business. Many times that dream changed, but it always circled back around to what I feel my calling is....a Motel owner. But not just any Motel owner. I have always had an extreme love of the unknown, the unexplained, basically all things that go “bump” in the night. This has pretty much made me the Griswalds of Halloween, and this is where you can help. ￼

I crossed off a haunting item on my bucket list in May, 2017 when I stayed at the Clown Motel. I enjoyed it, but must admit, it needs some updating. I hear my calling getting louder, my time is now & I need your help. The infamously mysterious landmark, The Clown Motel has become available. Funds are needed to not only purchase the property, but also do an overhaul to bring it up to date with a bit more wonder around each corner that you won't want to miss.

However I need to move fast, before my dream turns into a nightmare. If I don't move and act now, there's the chance a big corporate chain could buy it, and dissolve all of it's luster. Let's not allow this iconic haunting landmark slip into the hands of a huge corporation and be turned into a bland, white walled, ordinary Motel 6, Holiday Inn or Best Western. Help me preserve this uniquely haunting hotel for generations to come.

Where will your support go you ask? Updates and renovations would include creating a website to allow online booking & let you know about all haunting events to come. New carpeting, beds, linens, and upgrading to a new key card system. Major sponsor's will receive a haunting surprise!

￼    If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still help out by getting the word out there. Share this campaign with all of your friends and family on your Social Media pages using the Indiegogo sharing options and tools.

Supporting my dream you get to be part of a haunting history and ensuring that the Clown Motel is around for years to come. Thank you again from the bottom of my heart, I truly hope WE can make this dream a reality. Hope to see you soon at The Clown Motel￼!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

About Us

The New York Musician's Center (NYMC) was launched with the fundamental goal of providing kids with a place to develop their love of music, and grow as both musicians and leaders within their community.  We teach private music lessons to over 500 kids each week but want to spread the music to deserving kids who simply lack the finances and resources. That's where our Keys for Kids Program and you can help!
<ul>
• This campaign is to provide 100 at-risk kids with private music instruction, instruments, and performance opportunities.
• Having as many contributions as possible will help us teach 100 or more kids within the tri-state area of New York and provide them with the resources to learn, play and thrive in their community!

The Keys for Kids project is a challenge to the lack of access to music education that children around the United States face everyday.  100 kids will be accepted into the program based on demonstration of financial need, or recommendation from their school or church.
<h3>What We Need &amp

The funds will be used in 3 ways:

1) BRING MUSIC INSTRUCTION TO 100 AT-RISK CHILDREN

$54k would be used to pay instructional staff for a total of 4,800 lessons taught throughout the year. We hope to enroll 100 students in the New York Musician’s Center's Keys 4 Kids program so that kids from around New York's tri-state area can take lessons at our studio or through online instruction. Students who live outside of our area will be able to take weekly lessons and even participate in our performance experiences through online streaming!

2) PROVIDE INSTRUMENTS 

$13,000 will be dedicated to providing instruments to all participants.  We plan to use the funds to put instruments in the hands of each of these at-risk children who are taking lessons so that they may use it during their lesson and to practice on their own.  Instruments that we will be providing include guitars, keyboards, violins, violas, cellos and drum pads.

3) PROVIDE  RECITAL EXPERIENCES
 
$2,000 of your funds would provide these kids with at least 2 recital opportunities in New York during 2019.  Students who are unable to travel will be provided with technology to perform via live streaming. Many kids these days never experience the incredible feeling of walking onto a stage or the courage that is needed to perform in front of hundreds of people. It's experiences like this that teach our children how to cope with anxiety, overcome fear, and see how their dedication pays off.
Crowdfunding on this website carries a transaction fee of 8% (or 6,000) of the goal. If you wish to contribute directly, please see the two methods below.
* We are on cashpp @ cash.me/$nymcmusic  or checks may be sent to New York Musician's Center at 701 Bedford Avenue, Bellmore NY 11710.
What We Need and What You Get
We need you to help us reach our $75,000 goal. Although the kids serviced may not be in your community, we'd like to offer you some cool perks for helping us reach our goal!
$25- You get listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter
$100- Your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs.
$250- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter,
your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, and you will receive the Guide to Music Lessons book written by NYMC founder Dr. Talonda Thomas.

$499- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, and you will receive the Guide to Music Lessons book written by NYMC founder Dr. Talonda Thomas, as well as an NYMC swag bag filled with NYMC gear.

$999- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, an NYMC swag bag filled with NYMC gear, and a half page in our 2019 recital program.
$5,000- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, a recital named in your honor, as well as a recital named in your honor.
$10,000- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter,  a full page in all of our 2019 recital programs, as well as a room at NYMC named in your honor.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, please SHARE this all over social media and be sure to tag your friends! We are incredibly grateful for your support!
","About Us

The New York Musician's Center (NYMC) was launched with the fundamental goal of providing kids with a place to develop their love of music, and grow as both musicians and leaders within their community.  We teach private music lessons to over 500 kids each week but want to spread the music to deserving kids who simply lack the finances and resources. That's where our Keys for Kids Program and you can help!
This campaign is to provide 100 at-risk kids with private music instruction, instruments, and performance opportunities.
Having as many contributions as possible will help us teach 100 or more kids within the tri-state area of New York and provide them with the resources to learn, play and thrive in their community!

The Keys for Kids project is a challenge to the lack of access to music education that children around the United States face everyday.  100 kids will be accepted into the program based on demonstration of financial need, or recommendation from their school or church.
What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be used in 3 ways:1) BRING MUSIC INSTRUCTION TO 100 AT-RISK CHILDREN$54k would be used to pay instructional staff for a total of 4,800 lessons taught throughout the year. We hope to enroll 100 students in the New York Musician’s Center's Keys 4 Kids program so that kids from around New York's tri-state area can take lessons at our studio or through online instruction. Students who live outside of our area will be able to take weekly lessons and even participate in our performance experiences through online streaming!

2) PROVIDE INSTRUMENTS $13,000 will be dedicated to providing instruments to all participants.  We plan to use the funds to put instruments in the hands of each of these at-risk children who are taking lessons so that they may use it during their lesson and to practice on their own.  Instruments that we will be providing include guitars, keyboards, violins, violas, cellos and drum pads.3) PROVIDE  RECITAL EXPERIENCES $2,000 of your funds would provide these kids with at least 2 recital opportunities in New York during 2019.  Students who are unable to travel will be provided with technology to perform via live streaming. Many kids these days never experience the incredible feeling of walking onto a stage or the courage that is needed to perform in front of hundreds of people. It's experiences like this that teach our children how to cope with anxiety, overcome fear, and see how their dedication pays off.
Crowdfunding on this website carries a transaction fee of 8% (or 6,000) of the goal. If you wish to contribute directly, please see the two methods below.
* We are on cashpp @ cash.me/$nymcmusic  or checks may be sent to New York Musician's Center at 701 Bedford Avenue, Bellmore NY 11710.
What We Need and What You Get

$25- You get listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter
$100- Your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs.
$250- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter,
your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, and you will receive the Guide to Music Lessons book written by NYMC founder Dr. Talonda Thomas.

$499- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, and you will receive the Guide to Music Lessons book written by NYMC founder Dr. Talonda Thomas, as well as an NYMC swag bag filled with NYMC gear.

$999- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, your name will be listed as a sponsor in our 2019 performance programs, an NYMC swag bag filled with NYMC gear, and a half page in our 2019 recital program.
$5,000- You will be listed on our website as an NYMC Community Supporter, a recital named in your honor, as well as a recital named in your honor.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
The Wild Roast Cafe
A great coffee shop is integral to any community. My family is bringing one to the Bluff Park neighborhood in Hoover, Alabama. We invite you to become part of this journey.
<ul>
<li>

We have worked in Hoover/Bluff Park for the past seven years and fell in love with it so much that we moved here. But we have also been frustrated by the lack of options close to home when we want to go somewhere and read a book, work remotely, or visit with friends.
<li>
While this will be our family business, this is YOUR community. So help us make it special.
<li>

We are moving out of the first phase of launching our coffee shop. We have started an LLC, developed a business plan, worked with an architect, identified our contractors, selected our equipment, created our house blend, and submitted plans for approval by the city and county. We are now moving into the build-out phase. We have an incredible space and location. But it was not designed for this purpose. That means we are adding new electrical and plumbing to support the use of power and water that are necessary for a coffee shop. Because we want this place to reflect our community, your sponsorship will give us wider options as we select the final flooring, paint, tile, counter tops, etc. Plus, our coffee shop will have a very intentional focus on art and music. Your sponsorship will help us quickly move to incorporate these elements into your experience.
What We Need &
<ul>
<li>

We're not a big corporate chain opening a franchise. We are a family who loves coffee and loves this community. Our children go to school around the corner. We live less than two miles away. Our focus won't be on the stock portfolio of someone across the country who has never even heard of Bluff Park. Our focus will be on the quality of coffee in your cup, the comfort of the chair you choose to sit in, paying our neighbor who provides the art on the wall, and promoting the middle-class musician who includes us on her tour. When you love your experience or when you have a suggestion for making it better, you will be talking to the owners: US! Since we don't have a big corporate structure behind us, creating our business must come from our own finances...and from our community.
<li>

Your sponsorship comes with some cool perks. You can earn free cups of coffee (all the way from one on up to a year's supply!), stickers for your vehicle, mugs, shirts, and even a night with the cafe all to yourself so you can throw a party for your friends.
<li>
Any level of support will be appreciated and useful. So if we don't reach our goal, we will prioritize some of the pieces we were hoping to add and make some tough choices.
The Impact
<ul>
<li>

Here's what this will mean to our family: Opening our business means that we will be able to spend more time together. I know that sounds crazy, right? But with careers in corporate retail and camping/student ministry, our schedules have almost never matched up. There are very few days out of the year when all five of us are together. We will be able to work side by side and have our children walk over and do homework after school. And that's something that you just can't put a dollar amount on. No one will work harder to make sure you have a great coffee shop because we will be investing so much of ourselves into it.
<li>

Here's what this will mean to you: You gain a great local, independent coffee shop! Bluff Park is widely regarded as one of the best neighborhoods in the Birmingham area. And while we have some phenomenal small businesses and local restaurants, what we don't have is a place with enough seating to spread out and sit for a while. We want you to pick up a cup on your way to the office or chat with a friend after dropping off your kids at school. Use our free wifi to work remotely or meet with a client. After school, we will have a kids-friendly area with activities and enough square footage for you to sit somewhere else and have a conversation. On the weekend, ride your bike over or stop by after a run along Park Avenue or a hike in Moss Rock. Swing by to pick up a unique and meaningful gift for a loved one. Take a cup outside and watch the sunset over the Bluff. This is YOUR neighborhood coffee shop.
Risks &
<ul>
<li>

So where does the money raised through crowdfunding go? So much has already been accomplished but there is a lot left to do. Our plumber will be drilling through concrete to create new drains for the additional sinks and and machines. The electrician will be making sure we have enough power to run all of the equipment at peak hours. Through all of this, we are adding in wall paint, flooring, lighting, and furniture that are comfortable and maintain a great sound quality for your conversations and also for live entertainment. Each of these pieces has a value...and a cost. We know the pieces that we can put off, if necessary. But our goal is to have everything 100% just the way that we want it, and the way that you deserve it, on opening day.
<li>

So why trust us to make it happen? First, we love coffee. Second, we love the community. But third, we have a track record of making big things happen. Our backgrounds include managing a summer camping program of 1,500 campers, running an 18,000 sq ft retail store with $4.5 million in sales and much, much more - all with a focus on exceptional customer experience. To help us along the way, we are being advised by the Small Business Development Center of Alabama and have been receiving coaching from two of Birmingham's best coffee shops.
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
<li>

Let other folks know about our coffee shop. Email us any leads to bart@wildroastcafe.com and encourage friends and family who grew up here but have moved away to contribute. We will be here when they visit and y'all want to meet and catch up!
<li>
Use the Indiegogo share tools. Share this to your social media accounts. Not only will this help us raise funds but will also advertise and build our business.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h2 style=""text-align: center
column2: >WELCOME TO OUR INDIEGOGO FUNDRAISER ROUND 2!!!
column3:
>

Hello!

Thanks to EVERYONE who contributed to our round one fundraiser campaign, and to those who attended our fundraiser show at Isis Music Hall.  Pictured above is The Styrofoam Turtles! From our first Indiegogo fundraiser we were able to get close to 60% of our goal!
column4: >We are proud and excited to announce we've been approved for funding for SoundSpace!!
column5:
>This ROUND 2 campaign is to bring us up to our goal of $70,000 - collateral for our loan!! We are trying to raise $25,000 to get there!!!

With every dollar you contribute and every conversation you have that shares or mentions SoundSpace, it all pushes us closer towards realizing our vision! Every little effort counts! This campaign will be running for 30 days, with more updates on the project as well as more promotional appearances.
column6:
>The purpose of this campaign is to seal the deal!

SoundSpace is looking to become Asheville’s first full-fledged music practice space facility. We will be serving the critical needs of the music community, touring and local musicians alike. Soundspace will be created as a place of support for artists amidst the rapidly growing industry of music in the area.

Soundspace believes it will serve as a powerful, creative hub that will help to enrich and grow Asheville’s vibrant music scene, strengthening the abilities of anyone who wishes to play an instrument, while providing workspace for our many music professionals.

SoundSpace is managed and owned by musicians Claude Coleman Jr. and Brett Spivey, both Asheville residents with lifelong careers in music and studios domestically and abroad, in addition to having experience as builders and studio owners themselves.

SoundSpace will feature state-of-the-art music rehearsal spaces, hourly, and monthly rental spaces, and a dance/movement studio.
column7:
>

SoundSpace at Rabbit's will also feature a soul-food café. The property we are trying to acquire is the famed Rabbit’s Café and Motel, in the Southside area of downtown. We are thrilled to honor the legacy and history of Rabbit’s Café and Motel and humbled to partner with Clarence Robinson (#FlavorKing) A-B Tech Culinary Graduate and local chef who grew up behind the Motel and is a relative of the original owner. The motel was used for the touring Negro baseball leagues, of which Asheville had a dominant team. We wish to feature murals on our building sides that will honor all of this history!
column8:
>

What We Need!

SoundSpace is seeking $25,000 to make our 10% collateral needed for our loan, that we've just been approved for! This loan is to purchase the property and cover construction.  Developing in phases, we will start Phase I with four state-of-the-art rehearsal fully decoupled rooms in the motel - two monthly lock-out rooms and two hourly and daily.  Phase II brings in the redevelopment of the soul food kitchen, a lounge, as well as two additional rehearsal rooms and a dance and movement studio on the 2nd floor. 

Our Perks!

We deeply appreciate and are humbled by the love and support we receive from online to on the street.  When you contribute to this campaign, you are contributing to a community's health and future.  These are gifts to thank you!

Shout out on digital media!
We'll blast our thanks to you across all of our social networks!

Personalized thank you postcard!
    A retro-style motel postcard of Rabbit's with a personalized thanks, to you!

Retro Rabbit’s Motel Keychain
    A neato old motel key tag with SoundSpace and Rabbit's on the tag!

Name recognition at the SoundSpace facility!
    We'll have a wall for the supporters who made the dream happen - you'll name will join the others on the wall!

10% Rehearsal Time
    Discount off of your first rental time with SoundSpace!

1, 2,3 and 4 -hours of Rehearsal Time
     Time in the shed, on us!

SoundSpace Punch Card
    The SoundSpace punch card with a few punches removed, towards a free hour rental!

Special edition SoundSpace T-shirt
    The SoundSpace special edition Tee!

Invitation to Special VIP party at SoundSpace grand opening
    We'll have a preliminary meet and greet hang at our grand opening gig/party, and you'll have special invite!

10% off the Kitchen/Cafe
    Discount for our soul-food kitchen/cafe's vittles, run by Clarence Robinson!

Name On A SoundSpace Rehearsal Room Door
    Your name added to the door of a rehearsal room!

The WeenFan Poster Pack

For the WeenFan, of course! A sample from CCJ's collection of silk screen's, plus a Weenfan Shirt!

- A great group of silk-screen posters from Claude Coleman Jr's collection - have them signed!
- Terminal 5, NYC by James Flames, 4.15.17
- The Bomb Factory, Dallas, 10.31.17
- Brooklyn Steel, NY 6.6.17 &
column9:
6.6.7.17 by Rhys Cooper
- Original WeenFan Tee! On Back: I CAN NOT REVEAL THE WORDS OF THE GOLDEN EEL

Your name on a Sammy!

Become immortalized as a sandwich!! Our cook will create a sandwich in your name, and add you to the menu!

Rock n Roll Tee Bundle

A group of cool vintage rock shirts, straight from the high school closet!

Murphy’s Law - Concert T-shirt from 1987 tour (with Fishbone and Beastie Boys)

Alien Sex Fiend - Concert T-shirt from 1988 tour

De La Soul - Concert T-shirt from 1989 tour

The Damned - Concert T-shirt from 1989 tour

Primus - Concert T-shirt from Suck on This tour 1990 (signed)

Pop Will Eat Itself - Concert T-shirt from Cure for Sanity Tour UK 1990

Frank Black - Concert T-shirt from Cult of Ray tour 1996

Throwing Muses - Limbo T-shirt 1996 tour

Tanya Donelly - Lovesongs For Underdogs tour 1997

Kristin Hersh - 3 T-shirts from Strange Angels, Sky Motel, Sunny Border Blue (1998-2001)

Bauhaus - Concert T-shirt from Resurrection tour 1998

Roger Waters - Concert T-shirt from 2000 tour

Speeddealer - Here Comes Death tour 2000

Rush - Concert T-shirt from Vapor Trails tour 2002

SoundSpace will be community based and created by musicians. There will be discounted time-periods, free rentals to music students, and workshops and clinics. Our rooms will be fully decoupled and soundproofed, great for recording rehearsals as well as providing the most isolation from room to room. SoundSpace will have a staffed office, safe surroundings and will start with late hours eventually going to 24 hours.

Having this resource for the area's many musicians will be nothing short of a game changer. It will enhance the industry of music as a whole, and it will give support for more creative work to occur.  SoundSpace will also be invaluable to the many touring acts coming to the city, thereby becoming an excellent utility for the city's music venues.

The Team at SoundSpace is a dedicated and passionate group of Asheville business folks that share our same passion and drive, and we wish to thank them for their fierce dedication and energy: consultants Annice Brown and Jennifer Flynn, the office of Covestar Investment Realty and Jessica Auge, and special thanks to Erika McGilley at Natural Capital Investment Fund(NCIF).

 

""First There is A Mountain, Then There is No Mountain, Then There Is....""

We have been developing SoundSpace for close to three years now. We have searched and searched only to come close and lose the deal more than several times over, in our efforts to find the right property with a willing owner. With each hurdle overcome, we have become stronger and closer to the vision.  Claude Coleman Jr. and Brett Spivey are both illness and trauma survivors with decades of grit, patience and passion in music, and stubborn energy that will see SoundSpace towards fruition. Won’t you join us?
column10:
>

 

Share Us!!

Please share our fundraiser everywhere you can and help us make noise!

And please use the Indiegogo share tools!
column12:
timeline_context_item_source=29717514"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Nathan Rivers Chesky

There will be discounted time-periods, free rentals to music students, and workshops and clinics. Our rooms will be fully decoupled and soundproofed, great for recording rehearsals as well as providing the most isolation from room to room. SoundSpace will have a staffed office, safe surroundings and will start with late hours eventually going to 24 hours.Having this resource for the area's many musicians will be nothing short of a game changer. It will enhance the industry of music as a whole, and it will give support for more creative work to occur.  SoundSpace will also be invaluable to the many touring acts coming to the city, thereby becoming an excellent utility for the city's music venues.The Team at SoundSpace is a dedicated and passionate group of Asheville business folks that share our same passion and drive, and we wish to thank them for their fierce dedication and energy: consultants Annice Brown and Jennifer Flynn, the office of Covestar Investment Realty and Jessica Auge, and special thanks to Erika McGilley at Natural Capital Investment Fund(NCIF). ""First There is A Mountain, Then There is No Mountain, Then There Is....""We have been developing SoundSpace for close to three years now. We have searched and searched only to come close and lose the deal more than several times over, in our efforts to find the right property with a willing owner. With each hurdle overcome, we have become stronger and closer to the vision.  Claude Coleman Jr. and Brett Spivey are both illness and trauma survivors with decades of grit, patience and passion in music, and stubborn energy that will see SoundSpace towards fruition. Won’t you join us? Share Us!!Please share our fundraiser everywhere you can and help us make noise!And please use the Indiegogo share tools!Video By: Nathan Rivers Chesky",8.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Why Next Level?

We've been gamers all of our lives. From the time we were trying to top our best Pac-Man score on our Atari 2600 until the Fortnite and League of Legends titles of today, we love to play our favorite games and show our skills in tournament competition. As long as we've been in Houston, there hasn't been a place we could go to meet others like us and play the games we love.
That's why we're opening Next Level, which is Houston's first gaming and E-Sports venue. And we want you to be a part of it!

Next Level’s mission is to deliver the ultimate experience in competitive and casual game play. We will offer consoles, PCs, Virtual Reality rigs and special gaming tables to host your tabletop games. You can find E-sports tournaments, tabletop gaming theme nights and a full bar and food for purchase.
Next Level is open for all ages and skill levels. There’s only one thing you need to bring – your desire to take your gaming experience to the Next Level.
How Does Our Campaign Work and What Benefits Can You Receive?

We've already received tremendous support for Next Level, and we're moving forward with plans to convert a space in Midtown Houston for our location for our gaming haven. We plan to open our doors later in 2018, and we would love your help to continue raising funds to help us purchase equipment, enhance our facility build-out and support initial operating costs.
Taking Next Level from concept to reality is our dream, and we would love for you to help make it happen. Below are just of few of the epic perks you can earn for participating in our campaign:
<ul>
• Up to 20 FREE hours of gameplay per month!
• Invitations to Next Level's opening event
Even if you don't live in the Houston area, you can still benefit from a number of our perk offerings such as:
<ul>
• Exclusive Next Level gaming mousepads, shirts, and other merchandise
• Next Level dice set
• Your name or gamertag on permanent display on our Next Level Wall of Honor
The Impact

When we open Next Level, it will establish a community of people who love tournaments and games of all kinds. That's why we'd love your support in creating the premier gaming spot in Houston where gamers can have a home away from home and play the best competition anywhere.
Now you have the opportunity to help us take this idea to the Next Level Up!
How Can You Help?
We'd love for you to support our campaign, and there are other ways you can help!

You could share our campaign with your friends and members of the gaming community. You can also visit our website at nextlevelgc.com, sign up for our newsletter, or follow us on Twitter, Instagram or Facebook for more information about our progress.
Thanks for your support!

""Alimento pendiente"" nace a partir de una idea llamada “café pendiente” de origen Italiano, que funciona gracias al gesto de pedir un café y pagar dos, invitando el segundo a un desconocido que llegue después, ésto con el fin de compartir con alguien más que no pueda acceder a uno.

Buscamos replicar este movimiento utilizando mercados de productos Agroecológicos para ofrecer a aquellos que no tienen posibilidades adquisitivas la oportunidad de tener una cena digna en navidad o año nuevo
column2: las familias beneficiadas serán elegidas por sus condiciones económicas, especialmente familias en las que sus integrantes sean en su mayoría ancianos y niños.

column1: La idea de Alimento Pendiente es hacer una donación por medio de esta plataforma para la donación del mercado, nosotros nos encargamos de que éste llegue hasta la puerta del hogar requerido para no sólo para beneficiar a familias campesinas de escasos recursos, sino también madres cabeza de familia y ancianos
column2: ya que ellos no solo por problemas económicos sino de salud tienen mayor dificultad para movilizarse.

column1: Como recompensa, la familia o beneficiado enviará una postal de agradecimiento para su benefactor en navidad y Se hará un documento público con una rendición de cuentas al final del ejercicio donde se haga evidente el impacto conseguido para crear continuidad y confianza.
Todo en Pro de  la Cooperatividad, responsabidad y seguridad alimentaria, porque comer no puede convertirse en una moda, es una necesidad y tu puedes hacer parte del cambio.
Conoce más de lo que hacemos en instagram y facebook.

What We're Doing

We're launching the next generation of the Vermont Liberty Tea Company! This past summer the shop closed its doors when John McConnell retired after nearly two decades in business serving the Waterbury, VT community. Now we're trying to launch the next generation of the shop, and we're not settling until we build something everyone can be proud of. Here's what that means:
<ul>
• We've already moved Heaven and Earth to relaunch the website
• We're taking a digital-first approach until we can open a new retail location in the coming months
• We're depending on you to keep the dream of a small tea shop serving the Vermont community alive.

You enable us to do a ton when you donate that directly impacts the tea you buy! The $25,000 goal isn't arbitrary. It's where we've landed on making sure we can provide the best possible level of service to the community.

The biggest goal of the Vermont Liberty Tea Company’s crowdfunding campaign is to re-establish the company in a long-lasting, meaningful way. An enormous part of that means getting an infusion of capital from the real investors – you.
Tea lovers and enthusiasts turn to Vermont Liberty for its history of providing an incredible value and service. That isn’t built overnight, and we don’t want to take a single step backward.

A successful crowdfunding campaign will allow us to increase the word-of-mouth about the store and to build marketing efforts, get seen by a wider audience, and be able to make a more thorough transition in the next generation of the business. The snowball effect is enormous and measurable.
Things get more cost-efficient

Pretty much everyone knows that buying in bulk is far, far more cost efficient than the alternative. A big part of running a tea business is being able to make bulk purchases of tea all at once instead of more expensive 1-off orders. The economics are simple:
<ul>
• Option 1: 2 pounds of tea can cost $50 or $60 to purchase.
• Option 2: 35 pounds of the same tea can cost $250 - $275 to purchase.
For a business, this breaks down as...
<ul>
• Option 1 means Vermont Liberty pays $25 - $30 per pound of tea
• Option 2 means Vermont Liberty pays $7 - $8 per pound of tea

You can see how we benefit by getting an infusion like this. Buying in bulk and providing a cost efficient tea to our customers means we keep costs down, and YOU pay less. A lot less. Seriously, less.
The Impact
A small business grows, grows, and grows

Small businesses make the world turn. Or at least, they make Vermont thrive.  Firms with less than 20 workers make up the vast majority of businesses (SBE Council, 2014). Depending on who you ask, small businesses make up 45%-50% of the US economy's GDP. In Vermont it's a different story. 96% of businesses are small businesses and it makes up 60% of the economy (VT SBA). These numbers are AWESOME and we want to do our part to make sure we can play a role in that. Does that make us a statistic? Yeah, but it's a statistic that helps beat back the influence of massive corporations that extract money from local communities. This is a business for the community.
Crowdfunding allows us to avoid expensive bank loans

Getting a loans offer short-term fixes with long-term interest. While it would benefit any business right off the bat, Vermont Liberty and its customers would be better served avoiding having to raise prices to pay back the loan, the interest, and the associated interest.
Crowdfunding allows us to grow

This funding route may not be the only one available, but it allows us to visibly grow. While the Vermont Liberty Tea Company could continue with its status quo without a strong showing on Indiegogo, it allows us to get so much done without the need to bootstrap the future or go into debt. We have no intention of drowning. We have every intention of catching fire.
<h3>Risks &amp

Communities love small businesses. People love small businesses. Small businesses fail, and fail often. We mentioned earlier that we could bootstrap this business without a great need for more capital, but there's an incredible difference between the ""haves"" and the ""have-nots"" -- these differences drive people, businesses, families, and communities into the ground.

We feel confident that given time and enthusiasm, we could bootstrap this business without any outside help. The cost of that would most certainly harm our ability to serve tea and to serve a community that loves our product.
<ul>

• We want to ask for your contribution and to give back in the process. We have a few high-dollar perks, but we want this campaign to be accessible to everyone. $10 for a custom tea is our lowest ""perk"", but we're flexible on everything. If you can only give a dollar, that dollar means the world to us.

• Making tea itself accessible to everyone in bulk is something we've spent a great deal of time thinking about, but don't have the resources to pull off. If you want to talk more about making tea a more accessible beverage option in poor households and communities, get in touch, because it's a challenge with solutions that don't need to be a burden.

• Change is hard. We're asking people to make a financial contribution to a business. Transparency in this case means we're out to make a buck (okay, a lot of bucks), but transparency in this case means we want your to benefit. Your donation of $5, $25, $50, or whatever you can afford to give will make sure we have the cushion we need to kick this off right.
Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can donate cash. That's fine -- we get it. We're the ones asking.
<ul>
• Share our campaign on social media and get us some attention. Want to get some pre-written messages and graphics? Just click here. We've got a bunch of messages and graphics to offer!

• Here's our favorite way to help: Make an account on www.vtlibertyteacompany.com, grab your referral code. Any time someone buys tea using that code you get points that create an awesome discount. There's no pressure on anyone, but you can get free tea for yourself or as gifts for your friends and family for the holidays by doing this!

And that's all there is to it.

Music: www.bensound.com

MEET ME AT THE BOOKSHOP!
We are excited to take over the space from Leigh Metcalf of TopStitch Studio at 722 College Ave! She's moving to Ponce City Market!

Brave and Kind Kids Bookshop will carry a beautiful and inspiring mainstay of new and classic kids books for ages zero through young adult with a section for parents too.  Dedicated to being a community resource, we are excited to host:
<ul>
• A mini cafe with coffee, sweets, and a carefully curated small array of organic kids beverages and snacks.
• Regular events such as story time for our youngest readers and book club meet-ups for various interests and ages.
• ""Reading Room and Study Hall"" times after school for children to grab a book, a comfy pillow and read quietly.
• Creative Writing, ""Speaking with Confidence"" and other workshops designed specifically for kids.
• Various evening events perfect for a parent-child date night. Imagine pop-up family potlucks and open mic nights.
• “Service Saturdays” designed to provide kid friendly and family community service opportunities.
• A small second-hand section where you can buy a book for as little as three dollars.
With stroller parking, a bike rack for after school kids, and a bench out front, the store has a warm, welcoming feel. It is a place you could easily spend an hour or two.
BE A PART OF BRINGING THIS SPECIAL FAMILY GATHERING PLACE TO LIFE
We believe growing up in a world of books can make all the difference,  one that in our digitally-saturated age, deserves and demands preservation.

To bring my plans to life, I'm asking friends, family, neighbors, generous strangers and the Indiegogo community to help us chip away at the start-up costs of opening Brave and Kind Kids Bookshop. We have invested as much of our personal savings as we can muster, and have applied for a small business loan, but there's still a gap between that and our opening costs and early operating expenses. Here’s a brief breakdown of what we can achieve with your support:
<ul>
• Complete the installation necessary to house the mini cafe and kids workshop spaces.
• Install  bookshelves – the bones of the space, carrying our favorite books for kids of all ages.
• Order our opening inventory, pay the rent, turn on the lights and hire our teachers and booksellers!
• Further develop the look of shop and our website..
Lets build a space in the community for kids and families to nurture a love of literature and connect with friends.

To be successful, we need to generate support from all over Decatur and the surrounding neighborhoods. Your participation will help us get noticed, attract support and gain momentum towards the opening date.
ABOUT THE SHOP OWNER -- BUNNIE HILLIARD
When you read a book as a child, it becomes a part of your identity in a way that no other reading in your whole life does. ​ -Kathleen Kelly, You've Got Mail

I have a vision of fostering a tribe of brave and kind kids with a love of reading who will change the world. I started a bookclub for both of my kids (now 9 and 6) when they left preschool as a way to keep up friendships as we went off to different elementary schools.  But also to form a positive connection with books and reading and sharing and friendship (and snacks, because what's better than books and snacks?).  Brave and Kind Kids Bookshop  is dedicated to helping families find the books and the space that will inspire them to be Brave and Kind for themselves and for the world.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you are unable to participate, please take a moment to pass this along to friends and help us get the word out! You can also volunteer to help stock shelves or with our grand opening festivities!
SPREAD THE WORD

Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag #braveandkindreader and tag us! We're on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram @braveandkindbooks. Call up your friends and tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting local!
UPDATES:
A Day in the Life - Indie Bookseller Love at Avid Books

Super grateful to Janet Geddis at Avid Bookstore in Athens, GA for hosting me yesterday.  I shadowed her and got some of the inside scoop on #IndieBookselling. She and her bookselling crew are amazing! Her shop and its mission of community, connection and great service have always inspired me and will be keystone as we build the Brave and Kind tribe.
A HOME FOR BRAVE AND KIND
The Brave and Kind HQ will soon be located at 722 W. College Ave and nestled among Decatur small business staples, The Imperial and Yoga Central.

To thank you for helping us build a foundation for The Brave and Kind Kids Bookshop, we’ve assembled a variety of objects and experiences we hope will contribute to your lives as readers and members of the Brave and Kind tribe. (These images are previews! Absolute final designs may vary some.)

A HOME FOR BRAVE AND KIND
The Brave and Kind HQ will soon be located at 722 W. College Ave and nestled among Decatur small business staples, The Imperial and Yoga Central.

To thank you for helping us build a foundation for The Brave and Kind Kids Bookshop, we’ve assembled a variety of objects and experiences we hope will contribute to your lives as readers and members of the Brave and Kind tribe. (These images are previews! Absolute final designs may vary some.)",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Story

My name is Mike Cavaroc, an award-winning nature photographer with a passion for hiking and preservation of the natural world. It's my wish to merge all these passions together to make sure that hikers will have the same 800+ mile Arizona Trail for decades to come, a future that's not yet guaranteed.

Currently, portions of the Arizona Trail are in potential danger of being altered for mining and other potential uses that would devastate and harm the landscape. My goal is to use my photography to document the incredible beauty found along the trail and highlight the dramatic scenery found throughout its duration. Working with the Arizona Trail Association (ATA), I'll capture the scenic diversity and resources that line the 800+ miles of the trail to hopefully preserve its scenic resources for good. The ATA will also have full access to the photos taken so that they can use them to their advantage to promote the scenic resources against such threats.

Hiking this trail has been a dream of mine since I first heard about it in 2007 while living in Arizona, and now feels like the perfect time for it all to come together to finally make this dream come true. I'd like your help to that happen and to make sure everyone else with a similar dream gets to hike the same trail. After all, the less the ATA has to work to protect the trail, the more they can focus on maintaining it (like the stretch in the Mazatzals, for example).

The Actual Amount Needed

To complete the trail, I'm predicting I'll need about $3000 total, with about $2300 of that for food and any other trail expenses based on past experience and research from others' information who have successfully completed it. In addition to that, I'll use what is needed to get to Arizona, hike the trail, and then get home once I've completed the hike. Any remaining difference will be donated back to the Arizona Trail Association to help further their efforts.
The Breakdown

$2380: Trail expenses:
- mailing food/resupplies
- new shoes/clothes after wearing out originals
- occasional bed/shower
- more food/resupplies
- zero days (a day of relaxing)
- national park permits
- shuttles
- real meals when opportunity strikes
$350: Perk fulfillment
column5: >$270: Indiegogo fees

column1: After the campaign started, I was able to arrange it so that rent will not be necessary. The total can now be cut in half as reflected in The Breakdown above!
What's At Risk?

The Center for Biological Diversity  just released what is the only footage of the ONE known jaguar in the entire United States. The AZT passes right through its habitat where a Canadian company is trying to completely destroy by setting up an open-pit copper mine full of toxic chemicals. The impact to the trail and this jaguar's habitat would be catastrophic. This is just one example why the ATA desperately needs good photos to protect these areas.
<h2>Risks &amp

Many of you may notice that I have already attempted the Arizona Trail last year, but only completed 164 miles before leaving prematurely. There were some incredibly valuable lessons learned last year and mistakes I would be foolish to repeat. In the end, I already feel much more prepared and ready to get on the trail than I was last year, however if you'd like me to elaborate, please get in touch (Mike@FreeRoamingPhotography.com) and I'll answer any questions you have.

At no point during the hike was there anything more than an expected amount of physical stress. Blisters and a bit of soreness were the only physical impairments I suffered, and I expect my body to carry me the entire length, as it has wonderfully in all my epic hiking adventures. Physical health was the least of my problems last year, and I'm the type of person to see something through to the end if I start it. ...even if it takes a year.
(Note: I will be starting from the beginning again.)
More Ways to Help

Want to help but don't have money? I can always use food! Food can either be mailed ahead while I'm on the trail, or if you're nearby the trail, water is precious and I will happily accept any and all cached water wherever possible!

I'll appreciate any food thrown my way, but what I could use the most of are organic pop-tarts, Chapul cricket bars, Kate's Real Food bars, Clif bars, and Justin's (chocolate) nut butters, as well as anything else similar that could break up that pattern. I won't be bringing a stove so that I can save on weight and water, so please nothing that requires cooking.
If you're not able to help out financially or with food or water, spread this around to people you think might enjoy it! Thank you!
Why the Arizona Trail?

I lived in Arizona from 2004-2008. It was during that time that the natural beauty of the state helped me grow from an indoor video game addict to a passionate nature enthusiast, among other ways. I want to help return the favor by documenting the Arizona Trail properly through photos that do the landscapes justice. Ideally, this will allow the surrounding areas to bring the same joy and amazement they've brought to me.

Most of the existing photos used to promote and protect the trail were taken either from cell phones or point and shoot cameras, and so few, if any, have the professional quality needed to give the trail its broader reach and inspiration. This makes conserving the scenic resources along the trail extra challenging. By hiking the trail in its entirety and donating the photos to the Arizona Trail Association, I'll be able to change that so that the trail is preserved as is for generations to come.
A Few More Photos from Last Year

Solution to American Manufacturing
Be proud to support our campaign as we are bringing
manufacturing back to the USA!
Why is overseas manufacturing cheaper? Lower rents, wages and
materials?
We are AMUSA (stands for America USA) a cut and sew factory
in small town of Wabasha, MN.  For the
past 2 ½ years we have been manufacturing American made products.  Many of our customers have found that working
with AMUSA they have saved time, money and it’s more convenient.
They save time:
They do not have to take 2 weeks out of their office to
visit the factory (2 or 3 times during a project).
They do not have the extra 30+ days ocean freight shipping.
They save money:
They do not have the expense of travel, overseas shipping,
duty/tariff/taxes.
They do not have to have to purchase 10,000 pieces at a
time, tying up funds on inventory that is only to be warehoused.
More Convenient:
No communication barriers, making it easier to describe
design details and they get the product they want.
How is AMUSA able to do this?
AMUSA factory is located in a small town where the rents are
lower and a wonderful quality of life is provided without high wages.  So why not create factories in American small
towns?  That’s exactly what we are
doing.
We have been contacted by 23 other small towns throughout
the USA, they are asking that we help them develop factories in their
communities.  It may be a cut and sew
like AMUSA or it’s electrical, or welding or mechanical or…..
<ul>
<li><b>This is a business model
that is to be replicated in small towns all around the country, and it
starts with you and us.  By helping us here, you are also helping
other small communities as we share our experiences to show them how they
can start their own factory in their community.
The Impact:
We receive
approximately 5 calls a week from small US business owners that are looking for
a factory in America that will help them get their product designs manufactured.
When we help those small businesses, we hire 1 or more people and the
small business we manufacture for now hires 1 or more people.  If we take
on 1 new customer a week, AMUSA adds 52 plus individuals and the small business
hires 52 plus individuals.  If we help 2 new customers a week, or 3
customers or...
As we start to help
other communities set up their own manufacturing facility, then they start to

hire and their customers start to hire and so on and so on and….

Also means more American made products on our shelves at a good price and top quality.
Risks and Challenges:
AMUSA has been
manufacturing for businesses for 2 ½  years now.  Our quality is top-notch and our delivery is on-time.
If we end up getting
more than our goal here, we will be able to help more communities get set up with their factories.
Other way to help:
Some people just can't
contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
<ul>
<li>Get the word out and make some noise about the AMUSA
campaign!

Firstly, I would like to thank you for visiting my page. This is my honest story of despair, hopelessness, self-loathing, guilt, shame and finally an awakening, a realization that my life could no longer continue on its current path and if I could make it through I would dedicate myself to giving back to those that are still in recovery.   

 I was lost in the proverbial bottle.  My world no longer revolved around the daily activities that other “normal” people enjoyed
column2:
quality time with family and friends, walking your dog, exercising, gardening, painting or any other hobby that people look to for peace, relaxation and joy.  I was indeed a joyless soul.  All my interests were thrown to the wayside and replaced with a small airplane bottle of distilled spirits.  I was a shell of the person I once was and the worst part was…I knew it. 

I battled alcoholism for most of my twenties when finally realizing, at the age of 27 that I needed help.  That help came from family, friends, medical professionals, perfect strangers I met on soberrecovery.com and finally from my books and cycling.  I have always loved to read but during my early recovery I often looked to them for inspiration, education, hope, empathy and most importantly to occupy my mind.  An idle mind early on in ones sobriety is very dangerous and through reading I passed those difficult days without issue.  Another important aspect of my sober life is the sport of cycling.  I do it religiously every day with the help of a great coach who has become a close friend and continues to support me and my sobriety to this day.   Without my family, books and cycling I wouldn't be where I am today.

I began selling books in 2014 after almost 1.5 years of sobriety.  My motivation was never higher, everyday was a gift
column3:
filling each one with positive thoughts and lots of hard work.  I have now gotten to the point where I can now give back and fulfill that promise I made to myself all those years ago.  

The initial idea was not clear to me but I knew I wanted to make a difference in some way and as I grew my book business I knew it would be a major part of it.  Only very recently did it occur to me what I wanted to do. Literally within the past few days, I had a fateful interaction with someone I was able to help through my book business, who was currently recovering and looking for help finding a job.  I thought to myself, ""I have a ton of books on interviewing and finding the perfect job"", so I sent this person, who I knew nothing about really, other than their post on a forum, 3 books for free.  He was so grateful and appreciative but the feeling I had was just as profound
column4:
it got me thinking.  

What if I could provide free books to those currently in alcohol recovery?  Perhaps they love to read but can't afford them, perhaps they dont know how to read and want to learn, perhaps those books will get them through those difficult times like they did for me?  Those in recovery are often depressed, guilt ridden, and feel like the world is against them, but through giving I can offer a small glimmer of hope to those currently suffering.  

I am looking to partner with recovery facilities around the country but like anything one has to start small and grow from there, just like I did with the book business.  I will begin with my home state of NJ and expand from there.  I want Wares of The Coast to be apart of a patients entrance into a facility.  Just as they are required to fill out entrance forms, they should also be given the option to select a free book for them to read during their time in treatment.  In order to do this I will need more inventory, more shipping supplies and at some point staff to manage this all.

The monetary goal will allow me to purchase more inventory, shipping supplies i.e. mailers, shipping labels  and to allocate a dedicated space to store all the books for this project.  They will need to be segregated from my main inventory and tagged with a barcode so I can locate them without the aid of amazons packing slips.  I plan on sending the treatment facilities a book list which they can give the newcomers, so they can select a book for their stay in treatment.  The books will be given unique seller sku that will also be tagged on the back of the book with a sticky.  This will allow me to locate them in inventory quickly. The cost of monthly storage is about $250 a month for a 10x20 foot space, not including the industrial racks I need to buy that will hold the books. This entire process will also take away from my money producing side of the business which is crucial to keep everything running smoothly.  The donations will pay for the storage fees, and inventory until I can get a steady flow of donations to the project.

If you, a friend or a family member has struggled with alcoholism and is now sober or if you know someone close to you who lost their battle with alcohol, you have the opportunity to give back, and help someone who wants to live a fulfilling joyous life. Give them hope through books!   Every little bit helps as well.  When the monetary goal is reached we will begin sourcing the inventory and making arrangements for storage.  In the mean time I will be working through the contact process with the facilities.  I will be updating frequently as things develop and also plan on adding a video  as well as additional monetary perks.  Any contributions prior to the perks being posted will be given  those benefits retroactively.  


Website Link:  http://booksforrecovery.org/

Here is a link to the Amazon storehttp://amzn.to/1PU1xm6 and  positive feedback ->
column5:
