>HELLO

Thank you, for taking time to learn about us! We are GIVEFIFTYONE, a nonprofit watch brand that helps children in need. 

With this campaign introducing our giving model called, Get To Give: 

When you get a watch, we will give a watch &
column8: 51 keys of greatness to a child in need. <div>

column1: <div>
<div>

column2: >In addition to our giving through
column5: international organizations that help children in the following 5 areas: 1. Education. 2. Food. 3. Water. 4. Shelter. &amp
column6: 5. Clothing. Among other things, much of our partnership help is done through child sponsorships.

column1: <div>
<div>
EDUCATION

We are currently giving to our partners, MCDF in Zimbabwe, Africa to provide education to children there. Our goal is to sponsor at least 17 children by the end the year, if we could, it would be great to sponsor as many as 51 children this year! The children that we sponsor attend school for three terms each year. For every $40 you give to our Spondor a Child fund, we can sponsor a child's education for one of their three terms. For every $120 you give, we can sponsor one child for their entire school year.
<div><b>FOOD &amp

Since, our partners MCDF in Zimbabwe, Africa are also experiencing food shortages due to the El Nino effect, we are specifically raising funds to get food to their children. For every 51 people that give $.51 cents to our GIVE 51 CENTS CREW food fund, we will be able to feed 100 children! Our goal is to feed at least 5100 children by the end of the year.
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Also, we are giving to provide water to a village in Uganda, Africa through our partners Action in Africa. For every 51 people that give $.51 cents to our GIVE 51 CENTS CREW water fund, we will be able to provide over 100 gallons of water a month to their village!

column1: <div><b>SHELTER &amp
<div>We have several other partners that help out in these areas, such as A Child's Place &amp
column2: CF Housing, so if you are passionate about providing to these areas, give to our Shelter &amp

column1: <div>

OUR CAMPAIGN: THROUGHOUT THE YEAR

This is specific campaign is our 2nd Quarter Get to Give
column4: >Campaign is continuing through out this year, &amp
column5: is set up in quarterly goals that will help us raise funds each quarter to meet our overall 2016 goals to help children in need. Thank you for your continued support as we proceed throughout this year!

column1: OUR STORY
Our story's inspirational beginning can be traced back to over a decade ago. It started with overseas orphans, it began with a 10 year old homeless child in the U.S., &
column2: it continues through a nautically inspired, generous, adventurous, bold brand culture.

column1: In December of 2011, Alexander Greer started mentoring at a Charlotte based mentoring program. Several weeks later, he discovered that the 10 year old child he was mentoring was homeless and that he was helping take care of his other younger homeless siblings. This realization grabbed Alex’s heart with compassion and inspired him to start a movement to help impoverished children in Charlotte and beyond. So, Alex joined with his friend, Jonathan Jones to form GIVE FIFTY ONE (GFO) to help children in need.

Alexander with some of the children he mentored.

Soon after discovering the homeless child, they began to research child homelessness and learned that at that time, over 1.6 million children in the United States and tens of millions of children worldwide were without homes. Jonathan and Alex soon became aware that in their own community of Charlotte alone the number of homeless children had risen from 1,038 in 2004 to 4,711 in 2011.

Additionally, Alex’s mission trip to Africa in the Summer of 2011, and Jonathan’s mission trip to the Dominican Republic in the Spring of 1999 exposed them both to impoverished children which planted within them a passion to one day help children in need. So after their direct encounter with child homelessness through the Charlotte mentoring program, they took action by purchasing 12 t-shirts to sell to friends so that they could use the profit to help children. After selling t-shirts, they started selling watches to bring more awareness to helping children. As of 2015, Alex and Jonathan transformed GIVE FIFTY ONE into a nonprofit brand.

Alexander in Zimbabwe in 2011 (standing center).

                           Jonathan in the Dominican Republic in 1999 (far right).

Now, we continue to help children locally, through partnering with organizations that help children in need &
column2: helps children internationally, through child sponsorships. We currently sponsor 7 children in Zimbabwe &amp

column1: <div>     <div style=""text-align: center
<h3>THE IMPACT: PROBLEM, SOLUTION &amp
Thank you to each volunteer &
column2: supporter for helping create this impact!

column1: As our Co-Founder Alex stated, there is a problem when there are tens of millions of children in need throughout the world. To counter that problem, we see a solution, through offering watches that provide funds to meet these needs. So, this campaign &
column2: your contribution both have value extending beyond this generation.

column1: The value of your contribution lies not only within the GFO watch you will receive as a perk in return, but also within the life change of children that is generated from your giving. When considering which level you will back us on, remember Normally, pictured below. According to her village's reports, many sponsored children like her, have either graduated and are pursuing higher education or they have careers. So likewise, Normally's life can be made greater through your contribution!
<div>
<div>
<div>
WHY THIS CAMPAIGN
<div>

First Campaign Launch ReasonWe are launching this campaign for several reasons. As stated above, we are raising funds to meet our 2016 goals. We are also using this campaign to help share our New Coast is Clear Watch with our friends, families, &

The Coast is Clear is a classic timepiece that is both stylish and comfortable to wear. In creating it, we kept it clean, with no hour marks, so that the message is clear: It's not about time, it's about a story. The story of how when you get a watch, we will give a watch &
column2: 51 keys of greatness to a child in need!

column1: Also, when you purchase and wear a Coast is Clear watch, you are able to be a voice for children in need &
column2: share with your friends and family how you are contributing to our GIVE FIFTY ONE story, so that they are able to help also.

column1: The Coast is Clear is great for almost any occasion. Whether you are sailing, at work or hanging out with friends, it will fit right in. And remember, when you wear a Coast is Clear, you are not just wearing another ordinary watch, you are wearing a watch with purpose.
OUR COAST IS CLEAR WATCH LINE
Below are our watch strap options:

column1: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Are you a non-profit? Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? Yes, GIVE FIFTY ONE (GFO) is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit, GFO donations are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Contributions made when receiving a perk are not tax deductible for the amount of the value of the goods received. In other words, since our watches are discounted, they are not tax deductible, unless you contribute an extra amount exceeding the perk price we have listed. Each of our pure donation perks are tax deductible, since you will not receive any good or service of value from them. GFO's tax ID number is 45-5265575.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt? When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.
How do I select which strap I want with my watch?

If you are not able to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help.  Will you consider getting the word out &
column2: making some noise about our campaign? You can use Indiegogo's share tools for social media or email.

","HELLOThank you, for taking time to learn about us! We are GIVEFIFTYONE, a nonprofit watch brand that helps children in need. With this campaign introducing our giving model called, Get To Give: When you get a watch, we will give a watch & 51 keys of greatness to a child in need.
EDUCATION, FOOD, WATER, SHELTER & CLOTHING

In addition to our giving through Get To Give, we also partner with local & international organizations that help children in the following 5 areas: 1. Education. 2. Food. 3. Water. 4. Shelter. & 5. Clothing. Among other things, much of our partnership help is done through child sponsorships.
EDUCATION

We are currently giving to our partners, MCDF in Zimbabwe, Africa to provide education to children there. Our goal is to sponsor at least 17 children by the end the year, if we could, it would be great to sponsor as many as 51 children this year! The children that we sponsor attend school for three terms each year. For every $40 you give to our Spondor a Child fund, we can sponsor a child's education for one of their three terms. For every $120 you give, we can sponsor one child for their entire school year.
FOOD & WATER  - GIVE 51 CENTS CREW

Since, our partners MCDF in Zimbabwe, Africa are also experiencing food shortages due to the El Nino effect, we are specifically raising funds to get food to their children. For every 51 people that give $.51 cents to our GIVE 51 CENTS CREW food fund, we will be able to feed 100 children! Our goal is to feed at least 5100 children by the end of the year.

Also, we are giving to provide water to a village in Uganda, Africa through our partners Action in Africa. For every 51 people that give $.51 cents to our GIVE 51 CENTS CREW water fund, we will be able to provide over 100 gallons of water a month to their village!
SHELTER & CLOTHING

We have several other partners that help out in these areas, such as A Child's Place & CF Housing, so if you are passionate about providing to these areas, give to our Shelter & Clothing funds respectively.

OUR CAMPAIGN: THROUGHOUT THE YEARThis is specific campaign is our 2nd Quarter Get to Give Campaign. Our Get to Give Campaign is continuing through out this year, & is set up in quarterly goals that will help us raise funds each quarter to meet our overall 2016 goals to help children in need. Thank you for your continued support as we proceed throughout this year!
OUR STORY

Our story's inspirational beginning can be traced back to over a decade ago. It started with overseas orphans, it began with a 10 year old homeless child in the U.S., & it continues through a nautically inspired, generous, adventurous, bold brand culture.

In December of 2011, Alexander Greer started mentoring at a Charlotte based mentoring program. Several weeks later, he discovered that the 10 year old child he was mentoring was homeless and that he was helping take care of his other younger homeless siblings. This realization grabbed Alex’s heart with compassion and inspired him to start a movement to help impoverished children in Charlotte and beyond. So, Alex joined with his friend, Jonathan Jones to form GIVE FIFTY ONE (GFO) to help children in need.

Alexander with some of the children he mentored.Soon after discovering the homeless child, they began to research child homelessness and learned that at that time, over 1.6 million children in the United States and tens of millions of children worldwide were without homes. Jonathan and Alex soon became aware that in their own community of Charlotte alone the number of homeless children had risen from 1,038 in 2004 to 4,711 in 2011.

Additionally, Alex’s mission trip to Africa in the Summer of 2011, and Jonathan’s mission trip to the Dominican Republic in the Spring of 1999 exposed them both to impoverished children which planted within them a passion to one day help children in need. So after their direct encounter with child homelessness through the Charlotte mentoring program, they took action by purchasing 12 t-shirts to sell to friends so that they could use the profit to help children. After selling t-shirts, they started selling watches to bring more awareness to helping children. As of 2015, Alex and Jonathan transformed GIVE FIFTY ONE into a nonprofit brand.

Alexander in Zimbabwe in 2011 (standing center).                           Jonathan in the Dominican Republic in 1999 (far right).Now, we continue to help children locally, through partnering with organizations that help children in need & helps children internationally, through child sponsorships. We currently sponsor 7 children in Zimbabwe & 1 child in the Dominican Republic.
THE IMPACT: PROBLEM, SOLUTION & BEYOND
Thank you to each volunteer & supporter for helping create this impact!

As our Co-Founder Alex stated, there is a problem when there are tens of millions of children in need throughout the world. To counter that problem, we see a solution, through offering watches that provide funds to meet these needs. So, this campaign & your contribution both have value extending beyond this generation.

The value of your contribution lies not only within the GFO watch you will receive as a perk in return, but also within the life change of children that is generated from your giving. When considering which level you will back us on, remember Normally, pictured below. According to her village's reports, many sponsored children like her, have either graduated and are pursuing higher education or they have careers. So likewise, Normally's life can be made greater through your contribution!
WHY THIS CAMPAIGN

First Campaign Launch ReasonWe are launching this campaign for several reasons. As stated above, we are raising funds to meet our 2016 goals. We are also using this campaign to help share our New Coast is Clear Watch with our friends, families, & beyond!

The Coast is Clear is a classic timepiece that is both stylish and comfortable to wear. In creating it, we kept it clean, with no hour marks, so that the message is clear: It's not about time, it's about a story. The story of how when you get a watch, we will give a watch & 51 keys of greatness to a child in need!

Also, when you purchase and wear a Coast is Clear watch, you are able to be a voice for children in need & share with your friends and family how you are contributing to our GIVE FIFTY ONE story, so that they are able to help also.

The Coast is Clear is great for almost any occasion. Whether you are sailing, at work or hanging out with friends, it will fit right in. And remember, when you wear a Coast is Clear, you are not just wearing another ordinary watch, you are wearing a watch with purpose.
OUR COAST IS CLEAR WATCH LINE
Below are our watch strap options:
OUR COAST TO COAST WATCH LINE
ALSO AVAILABLE
Other Campaign Reasons

Additionally, we are launching this campaign so that we can meet our other goals for this upcoming year, such as doubling our child sponsorships, covering administration & improving customer experience, among other things.
WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

With this campaign, we are seeking to raise $4,435 for this 2nd quarter. We are seeking to raise this amount so that we can feed 5100 children, provide over 1200 gallons of water to a village, sponsor at least 17 children's education, & give to provide shelter & clothing to children in need.
Additionally, this amount will help us accomplish each of our goals in an excellent, efficient & effective manner & hopefully raise more funds beyond our goal to help us grow as a organization!
Aside from this amount we are raising, we plan to be able to use our post-campaign watch sales from the rest of the 2016 year & beyond to be able more direct giving to help children in need.
In return for your contribution, you  get a perk, one or more of our watches. Also, when you contribute, you are both becoming part of Our 2015 Launch Team & additionally, helping us reach our goal!
OUR PLAN
1. Launch Go To Give 2nd Quarter Campaign on March 19th, 2016.
2. End Campaign within 60 days of start, by May 16, 2016.
3. Send your perks to you within 60 days after Campaign, by July 15, 2016.
4. Sponsor 17 or more children in need by year end 2016.
5. Feed at least 5100 children by year end 2016.
6. Provide over 1200 gallons of water by year end 2016.
RISKS & CHALLENGES
The risk that we foresee are as follows:

The timeline risk of fulfilling your perks after our campaign  completion is a 2 month duration. As stated above,we are estimating that your watches will be shipped out within 2 months after completion of our campaign, which ends on May 16, 2016. So, your watch(es) should be sent out by July 15, 2016. Sometimes manufacturing & shipping delays can occur, if they do, we can keep you posted on any delays, if necessary.
We do not believe the timeline risk is an obstacle we can't overcome. Our team is dedicated to getting your perks to you in a timely fashion.

We have set our campaign to flexible funding so that the risk of not reaching our goal is outweighed by the benefit of keeping all the money we do raise. We plan to use the money raised according to our budget & priorities. If we do not raise the entire amount, we will adjust our budget, so that we meet our priorities first.
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Are you a non-profit? Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes? Yes, GIVE FIFTY ONE (GFO) is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit, GFO donations are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Contributions made when receiving a perk are not tax deductible for the amount of the value of the goods received. In other words, since our watches are discounted, they are not tax deductible, unless you contribute an extra amount exceeding the perk price we have listed. Each of our pure donation perks are tax deductible, since you will not receive any good or service of value from them. GFO's tax ID number is 45-5265575.How can I get a tax deductible receipt? When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.
How do I select which strap I want with my watch?
For watch strap selection: See our available strap options in middle of campaign page. Choose a strap color & e-mail your selection to watchstraps@givefiftyone.org
*If ordering your indiegogo perk on a mobile device, email strap color choice to watchstraps@givefiftyone.org.

If choosing a striped navy strap with your perk, please specify in comments section which exact striped navy strap, i.e. striped navy double white, striped navy single white, or striped navy single red.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are not able to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help.  Will you consider getting the word out & making some noise about our campaign? You can use Indiegogo's share tools for social media or email.
THANK YOU
Thank you for your time & help!
Sincerely,
Jonathan & Megan & The GFO Team",12.0,0,"3 Campaigns

About me
My name is David Lanzendörfer and I'm Swiss.
I studied electrical engineering for 6 years in ETHZ (3 years) and ZHAW (another 3 years) and then I decided to move to China in order to build cool gadgets.
I'm right now living in Hong Kong and I'm designing a 100% free and open source micro controller.
Although Hong Kong is inexpensive to live at in general, I need however at least a minimum income in order to buy food while I'm working full time on this micro processor.
The thing I'll gonna build
Since no one will pay me money for just saying ""I'll gonna build a 100% FOSS MCU"" here is a also a description of what I wanna make in detail
Properties
The micro controller I wanna create will just be the first in a long row of release.
The first one will basically be a 100% free and open
ATMega clone which means:
<ul>
• It contains a RISC-V (32 bit) CPU core
• It can replace the recent ATMega chip within the Arduino boards
• pin compatible to ATMega32
• TTL compatible (5V IO)
• can drive an LED (or alike) on each pin
Features
This baby will contain the full spectrum of peripherals you would expect from a general purpose MCU:
<ul>
• ADC
• DAC
• PWM
• I2C
• SPI
• UART
• JTAG
Impact

The chip will redefine the standards of Chinese industry by setting totally new quality requirements in the future.
Hopefully it will sooner or later eliminate these many different CPU instruction sets and will lead all manufacturers to just use RISC-V as the instruction set for their CPU.  

Risks
Of course Atmel or Infineon might come and make trouble because our chip ""looks too much like theirs"", but there is no patent or alike backing such claims.
We're less expensive and more open. Short: We are better
Other ways to support me
<ul>
• Help developing yosys: https://github.com/cliffordwolf/yosys
• Help improving the platform support for the RISC-V architecture

I´m Barbara Ishana – an
intercultural trainer and coach, now in a learning process in the Therapist
Training at Humaniversity, in the Netherlands. In my work, I´m busy with the
development of interpersonal and social skills: communication, goal setting, managing
changes, raising effectiveness of working together in an international
environment, and so on. In my private life, I am busy with my own (as well as
other people’s) personal growth. I´m also very much into travelling and
exploring different cultures.
Two years ago, I joined a
session at the Humaniversity in the Netherlands – a therapeutic community,
where people with different backgrounds come together to heal and relax, and to
experience their own “blind spots”. And I see that this is the way for me to
become a better trainer, a better therapist and a better human being.  I started with the Personal Education Course,
joined the Therapist Training after that, and I keep on going...
Now it´s time for me to
go one step further – I want to fully commit myself to the community and stay
in the house for <span>ONE WHOLE AND INTENSIVE YEAR.
I´m about to start my
third year now. And as I always do: <b>I
want to experience it all!  To do so,
I've decided to join the One Year Intensive Program in the Humaniversity, where
every weekend is filled with workshops of emotional work, every morning with
dynamic meditation. It’s about being present in the community every day of the
week. No place to hide, no place to escape.

dynamic meditation. It’s about being present in the community every day of the
week. No place to hide, no place to escape.What does it mean for me?
It means to find out all the benefits from being and
living in a therapeutic community, and to share them with you.
It means to stop working as a trainer and coach
outside as much as I did until now. Instead of this, I´ll be working in and for
the community.
Instead of traveling around the world, it is now all
about traveling inside to discover who I really am as a person and a therapist.
It means to challenge myself and the others being 24/7
together.
It means to be responsible and to give a picture of
how we all can benefit from being in a community.
It means to share my passion and beliefs with the
whole world without being afraid what that may cause…
It means to share my daily life experiences, as well
as the condition of my mind, body and soul with you. Together we will go through
the most beautiful and most tough times.
It means I do this for a simple reason: to encourage
the whole world to live together, to share, to express. To encounter. To make
friendships. And to love.
What does
it mean for you?
It means you will have access to a short video of the
community’s life, which I will record every week. Through that, I´ll share the
most important moments with you. I expect lots of feelings, ideas and thoughts
which you can use in your daily life and work.
It means you meet the community people and their
personal stories. You´ll see them, you´ll get to know them, and maybe you´ll
get inspired by them.
It means you will see how we work day by day, as well
how we work in a therapeutic session.
You will have the opportunity to see and talk to me
regularly, to check how life is going on, what I've learned and what I can
share with YOU and the world.
It means you will be a part of a pioneering, unique
project that´s based in a therapeutic community.
What does
it mean for the world?
It means a creation of a documentary about how living and working in the therapeutic commune
looks like.
It means real scenarios to get inspired - people’s
stories, which show that in order to feel fulfilled and loved people do belong
together, that they need each other and that THEY ARE LOVEABLE.
It means a unique opportunity to get involved with the
methods of therapeutic work according to the Humaniversity.
To get a taste of all
the different possibilities available for personal and communal growth.
How can you
support the project?
I´m happy for every contribution you're willing to
make to help bring this project to life! You can buy one or more of the
“products” I've prepared. They are rich and fully packed, so you can benefit
the most from it!
You can make a
contribution to make this campaign visible. Share it with your friends, people
you know, with whom you can, with everybody, so that this project becomes a
reality!
What is
the money for?
38.000 Euro are needed to cover the COSTS of the ONE
YEAR INTENSIVE PROGRAM for the whole year and to make the documentary a real project. I truly hope we can do it together - it
will be a unique project that will encourage people to join communities all
over the world to stay connected to one another and to become more fulfilled
and loving - just perfect human beings!
What
happens if…
If I do not reach my goal of 38.000 Euros, I´ll use
the raised money to complete my education as a Humaniversity therapist without
continuing on with the One Year Intensive Program. This will also allow me to
continue working with people as Therapist and Trainer, so I can share my experience and give it back to
the world.
I´m grateful for your contribution! And I´m looking forward to you! You can check me out by visiting my website: www.barbarabartczak.com or my travel blog www.barbarabartczak.wordpress.com
Here a
shortcut:
Who am I?
Barbara Ishana.
Drives
I´m interested in people, in their
wellbeing, in people’s growth.
Believe:
Everyone has their own path, and sometimes
people need a gentle nudge to go further on it. This is what I do – both in
business and in private life.
What do I do for living?
I´m working as an intercultural trainer and
coach providing trainings and sessions for all kinds of clients. Check me out
on: www.barbarabartczak.com
Important
Work to live!
Passionate about
I love to travel! Wherever I can and
whenever I can. Always easy going and always as local as I can. To travel
means to live.  I do share my travels
with polish readers on a blog: www.barbarabartczak.wordpress.com
How do I see myself
My very natural role is of a companion, and
a friend.
Education
I've followed many different studies,
starting with education as a teacher for languages, through Expert for
Organizational and Managerial Communication, PhD in Politics and Culture...
Yet, they all have one thing in common: Working
with people. It´s always about people.
Humaniversity
My goal and passion is to become a
Humaniversity therapist and move on with sharing my knowledge and strengths.
I´m about to start my third year now. And as
I always do: I want to experience it all!
To do so, I've decided to go for the One
Year Intensive Program in the Humaniversity itself. It’s about being present
in the community. every day of the week. Every weekend is filled with
workshops of emotional work, every morning with dynamic meditation. No place
to hide, no place to escape.
Challenge
To travel inside, not outside. To face my
blind spots. To become a Humaniversity therapist and support others in their
growths.
Community
I see a huge potential in community life, as
I have experienced it myself.",1.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Egmond aan Zee, Netherlands",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/one-year-intensive-in-the-humaniversity/pica

MY SELF DESCRIPTION AND BACKGROUND

My name is Frank Swai.  I was born and raised in Roo village of the Hai district in Kilimanjaro region of Tanzania. I got a chance to get my first degree,  ""Bachelor of science in Hospitality and Tourism management “at Tumaini University of the Stefano Branch of Moshi Memorial University College. After completing my studies, I have been looking for a job using my education for long time. Here there is this thing called “networking” that means if you don’t know someone working in the government then it will be so had to get a job so to get job it will depend on who you know and not what you know.  My dream is to set up my own business as a way of self-employment but it is very expensive to make registration and pay for license and insurance. So I’m starting this crowd funding campaign so that my friends can help me pay to register my project.
Giraffe
MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANT

While still studying, I tried to think much on what to do after my studies. So I decided to start my small tourist company through which I can assist  tourists who visit Tanzania with its National parks and the highest mountain in Africa, Mount Kilimanjaro. Commencing a tourist company is very expensive as the things necessary needed to start the company include having enough vehicles to carry tourists, Insurance, workers, and a license. I have created a website (http://steppedogsadventures.com/) with some information about Tanzania’s tourism business. All I require now now is to advertise my company, registration for my company, buying some vehicles which I am required to have  to be considered qualified for registration,  which itself is very expensive. What I can ask from you is your support. sponsorship and assistance in making my business prosper and my dream come true.
Wildebeest migration
The importance of this campaign
1. The tourists that I will bring in Tanzania will lift the nation's economy.
2. My society will be developed through employment opportunities given by my company.
3. Hotels and Lodges will earn income as tourists prefer living in hotels during their visits in Tanzania.  I hope to arrange discounts with them for travelers using my company.
4. Many tourists like doing cultural programs, so even orphanage centers will be benefited by my company.
5. The business will also intensify knowledge of Tanzania for those who come for a visit from other nations.

6. My tourism business also stimulate the growth of other sectors such as agriculture. Many tourists likes to learn about agriculture in Tanzania when they come for a visit, taste the Tanzanian food which are traditionally made, for example stiff porridge (ugali) with meat, banana mix with beans, banana beer etc
<b><i>Lion &amp

This project  will stimulate kind donors who wish to make Tanzania a better place.   If I succeed, I hope many sponsors will get to come to visit.  I would love to meet you personally and show you the marvelous things in Tanzania..
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
The following are the risks and challenges starting this business
1. The tourism business is very competitive Worldwide and much effort is needed to master this.

I decided to choose the name Steppe Dogs Adventures Ltd for my new venture, after I visited Selous Game Reserve in the Southern Tanzania for the first time I saw wild dogs which are world's most endangered mammals. I was impressed with their lifestyle in hunting by cooperation. At first i wanted to call it ""Wild Dog Adventures Ltd"" but the name was taken already then i decided to call it ""Steppe Dogs Adventures Ltd""

Short Summary
It’s a shocking fact that three out of every four Sub-Saharan African communities do not have access to electricity. This means in Southern Africa about 650 million people have no safe access to
energy to light and power their homes, clinics, schools and businesses. In
rural areas that means about 80% of the population!
Our campaign wants to change this one village at a time.

We're starting with Xaxa, ( Location 19.8831° S, 21.0788° E) a village in the parish of Qangwa, roughly 300 miles away from the nearest tarmac road. From the money raised we will install the appropriate number of solar powered street lights to light the main road, clinic, school and marketplace.
The community has a population of approximately 1000. Community’s facilities include a small primary school, clinic, social welfare office, veterinary clinic and tribal community office.
<ul>

• Most villages have no streetlights which means many people do not feel safe going outside at night due to the possibility of assault, robbery, rape and even the threat of being attacked by wild animals.
• Local clinics close at sundown or are lit by paraffin lamps or candles and school children have to leave school when the sun goes down.
<li>After dark most children cannot do their homework, many have to rely on <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >kerosene, paraffin or candles. But these are inefficient, produce polluting fumes and carbon emissions and are costly to run. They also the cause thousands of accidents each year, with damage to people, homes and communities.

column1: • Local markets have to close at sundown. Which reduces the amount of productive hours which traders can work to help take their families out of poverty.

column2: >This is why we’re asking you to support our March for Lights campaign to make a real difference to lives of those in Xaxa, located in the parish of Qangwa.

column1: What We Need &
Our initial target is £7,500 ($10,000) – Your donations will provide the latest generation of solar streetlights to transform the village at night.

• We’ll focus on the main street, the local clinic, school and marketplace, each light being addressed by our partners What3Words (https://what3words.com) making each light easily found and accessible in a remote part of the world.
The Impact

We are here to make a difference which is why we are asking for your support. There is new generation of solar powered  lighting and equipment  for homes, schools and clinics which are reliable, quick to install, free to run and easy and cheap to maintain.
They have the power to totally transform the lives of some of the poorest people in the world.
We already know the impact solar can make, last year we installed solar home packs and solar streetlights in Sizanani, South Africa.
If you have a moment, check out our video clip showing the impact to people of Sizanani... https://youtu.be/Aoh5QT1xqOw

column5: type=text%2Fhtml&amp

column2: >The Village of Xaxa is located close to the Namibian border in an extremely rural part of the North West region of Botswana.
>The future aim is to establish a demonstration project with the Ministry of Health, establishing a Community Energy Hub (CEH) giving the village power via solar generators.

column1: Water supply is currently pumped using diesel generation and managed by Water Utilities a department of Central Government.
There is no mains grid supply to the village and no plan in the foreseeable future to connect to the grid power.
The local community clinic of is one of 46 health facilities identified by the Ministry of Health as requiring a more sustainable energy supply. The facility comprises of the following.
<ul>
• 4-room maternity unit
• 6-room outpatient department
• Staff accommodation

column2: >The purpose of the project, agreed by the Botswana Green Energy Consortium and The Botswana Ministry of Health is to :
>1. Establish a more sustainable energy supply with the community clinic as the energy hub and supplier to the local community.
>3. Research and report on the benefits derived from the introduction of a more sustainable and reliable energy supply.
>4. Design a project, which can be managed by the local community with little dependence on external support.

>5. Assist with identifying funding support for the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

column1: To transform Xaxa we need your help, donate if you can but spreading the word will be hugely important to the success of the campaign. You and your communities and can help the local community.

• Talk to your family, friends, church, school or community group about how you could help. Spread the word and ask your friends and families to help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign (you can share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools).
• Organise a sponsored 'March for Lights' at night time, or a candle-lit vigil, or a bake in, or a sponsored sit in the dark, or spend a day without power and donate the cost saving.
• See if your company wants to sponsor part of the project as part of its community support programme.
Together we can make a difference!
","Short Summary
It’s a shocking fact that three out of every four Sub-Saharan African communities do not have access to electricity. This means in Southern Africa about 650 million people have no safe access to
energy to light and power their homes, clinics, schools and businesses. In
rural areas that means about 80% of the population!
Our campaign wants to change this one village at a time.

We're starting with Xaxa, ( Location 19.8831° S, 21.0788° E) a village in the parish of Qangwa, roughly 300 miles away from the nearest tarmac road. From the money raised we will install the appropriate number of solar powered street lights to light the main road, clinic, school and marketplace.
The community has a population of approximately 1000. Community’s facilities include a small primary school, clinic, social welfare office, veterinary clinic and tribal community office.

Most villages have no streetlights which means many people do not feel safe going outside at night due to the possibility of assault, robbery, rape and even the threat of being attacked by wild animals.
Local clinics close at sundown or are lit by paraffin lamps or candles and school children have to leave school when the sun goes down.

After dark most children cannot do their homework, many have to rely on kerosene, paraffin or candles. But these are inefficient, produce polluting fumes and carbon emissions and are costly to run. They also the cause thousands of accidents each year, with damage to people, homes and communities.
Local markets have to close at sundown. Which reduces the amount of productive hours which traders can work to help take their families out of poverty.
This is why we’re asking you to support our March for Lights campaign to make a real difference to lives of those in Xaxa, located in the parish of Qangwa.
What We Need & What You Get
Our initial target is £7,500 ($10,000) – Your donations will provide the latest generation of solar streetlights to transform the village at night.

We’ll focus on the main street, the local clinic, school and marketplace, each light being addressed by our partners What3Words (https://what3words.com) making each light easily found and accessible in a remote part of the world.
The Impact

We are here to make a difference which is why we are asking for your support. There is new generation of solar powered  lighting and equipment  for homes, schools and clinics which are reliable, quick to install, free to run and easy and cheap to maintain.
They have the power to totally transform the lives of some of the poorest people in the world.
We already know the impact solar can make, last year we installed solar home packs and solar streetlights in Sizanani, South Africa.
If you have a moment, check out our video clip showing the impact to people of Sizanani... https://youtu.be/Aoh5QT1xqOw
Current & Future Aims
The Village of Xaxa is located close to the Namibian border in an extremely rural part of the North West region of Botswana.
The future aim is to establish a demonstration project with the Ministry of Health, establishing a Community Energy Hub (CEH) giving the village power via solar generators.
Water supply is currently pumped using diesel generation and managed by Water Utilities a department of Central Government.
There is no mains grid supply to the village and no plan in the foreseeable future to connect to the grid power.
The local community clinic of is one of 46 health facilities identified by the Ministry of Health as requiring a more sustainable energy supply. The facility comprises of the following.
4-room maternity unit
6-room outpatient department
Staff accommodation
The purpose of the project, agreed by the Botswana Green Energy Consortium and The Botswana Ministry of Health is to :
1. Establish a more sustainable energy supply with the community clinic as the energy hub and supplier to the local community.
2. Establish a community energy grid.
3. Research and report on the benefits derived from the introduction of a more sustainable and reliable energy supply.
4. Design a project, which can be managed by the local community with little dependence on external support.
5. Assist with identifying funding support for the project.   Other Ways You Can Help
To transform Xaxa we need your help, donate if you can but spreading the word will be hugely important to the success of the campaign. You and your communities and can help the local community.

Talk to your family, friends, church, school or community group about how you could help. Spread the word and ask your friends and families to help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign (you can share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools).
Organise a sponsored 'March for Lights' at night time, or a candle-lit vigil, or a bake in, or a sponsored sit in the dark, or spend a day without power and donate the cost saving.
See if your company wants to sponsor part of the project as part of its community support programme.
Together we can make a difference!",4.0,1,"1 Campaign

Short Summary

My name is Cathy Tshilombo-Lokemba or ""Mama Africa."" I am a passionate Culinary Entrepreneur, Small Business Developer, Cook and Caterer,

It is my passion to introduce African culinary culture into the international arena. My country of origin was the Congo and I came here to the U.S. 20 years ago as a refugee. Because I was raised in three different continents, being Africa, Europe and America, I picked up many cultural backgrounds of flavor including my study of interior and fashion design in Belgium.

column4: >My inspiration came from my mom as she lovingly taught me an appreciation for the cooking arts, new flavors, techniques and the presentation of the food in a way that uses my gifts and love for food.  I also noticed in coming to America the lack of the showcase of African food and it's healing value to body, mind and spirit. I also noticed how much Americans love to eat and I wanted introduce all the recipes my mother taught me to the people around me and fill both needs.

column1: It is my dream is to have my mama's recipes known and loved around the world. In order to fulfill this dream I reach out to those who love international flavors and want to see more culinary diversity in the world to join with me in support of this endeavor by investing in my dream.

In order to make this dream happen, I need the professional equipment to fill my unique gifts of African packaged flavor to the world, such as, Pili-Pili Sauce and Ginger Punch. This high tech equipment will give me the capacity to mass produce the product and have it shipped all over the world where there is a high demand for that already. Products such as ginger and the ingredients in my Pili-Pili Sauce are well known for health and have been used from Asia to Africa for centuries and have proved themselves to be of numerous benefits health wise.

Having this professional equipment would allow me to open the door to the international food lovers without them having to fly to Africa to test and discover these flavors, by bringing Africa to them. It will also support us as a small business in the U.S. as well as supporting the Utah community by being able to export these products all over the world. These are products are locally made products that bring diversity and connect people of all nations and religions, because FOOD SPEAKS ALL LANGUAGES.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

The funding will go toward the purchase of the needed filling equipment which is $50,000. I have researched well, products and companies, that offer the equipment I need and have found the best value to be that which is offered for purchase from the Hobart Company.  The equipment then would be used in a commercial kitchen environment at (3460 South Redwood Rd. Suite 5A. West Valley City, UT  84119).

column1: Any funding received for this cause of purchasing the filling equipment will be kept in an account for that specific purpose only, until we reach the desired amount to purchase it.  I will continue to make my unique products and share my recipes and my vision for the future, but I will not give up on my dream.

The Impact

The African Culinary has never been showcased the way that I showcase it and for years I have been doing just that. (Farmers Markets, festivals, fairs, conferences, catering, etc.) Now, I desire to share with the world.  Because of this product exposure, people are aware and familiar with my Pili-Pili Sauce and Ginger Punch and have enjoyed them.  My line of products are all authentic and natural with no preservatives, colors or additives, which again, makes them good for the body.

I have more people, groups and organizations that call and book me to cook and cater for them than I can physically keep up with.  People want what I offer.  I need the means to produce more output to keep up with the demands.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

There is always a risk of failure with any company for various reasons, such as that of competition, but that is what makes good business. The key is having the dream and pursuing it regardless of what challenges and/or failures may come along.  It is continuing the business journey with the patience, passion and determination paved by the challenges that make you stronger and brings about success.

column1: Any place of business that produces food is at risk of cross contamination, etc... and knowing the risks, it can be avoided and prevented. I follow FDA requirements and safety food management and respect and follow procedures that are required to make my products safe and healthy for consumption. The commercial kitchen is also an approved place of production by the Department of Agriculture along with the Department of Health.

My formula for solving any challenges and for creating success is to look at the challenges as they come as opportunities to move on.  Always be optimistic, never get discouraged and never give up.  Patience, Passion and Determination! I have NEVER been a quitter.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help monetarily, you can be a voice for me.  Share my campaign with you family, friends, neighbors, community, church and co-workers. Spread the word that Mama Africa has something unique to share with the world and she needs their help, support and any investment they can offer. (Publicity, advertisement, product promotion, social media networking, word of mouth, funding, etc.).
Please share my link with everyone: https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/mama-africa

Midday Grind started in late 2012 as an idea. An independent streetwear brand with low quantities and sketchy quality products from branding websites. But, I was only 18 at the time. Through years of trying and failing to launch, I decided to reevaluate and come out with a better product. Midday Grind is now dedicated to creating unique garments and re-purposing vintage garments. This time I also have three friends to help with marketing, creative processes, and brand development. We decided that Indiegogo would be the best place to start our resurgence, and with your help we can do this.

column3: >We our asking for $4500. A portion of the contributions
column4: > will go towards purchasing the necessary materials and equipment (sewing machines and screen printing presses) for our new garments. Another portion will be going towards getting a LLC for Midday Grind and copyrighting all of our work. The rest will go towards marketing our next launch, photo shoots
column5: >, and redesigning our website. Below is a mock-up
background-color: initial

column1:
Share With The World

Please share this campaign with all of your friend and family. Word of mouth is the best way to promote.

@_dannyphoto_
@visualfinesse
@brianwilette

In a world of ever-increasing demand for products and services, the internet has brought us an exceptional avenue of which we (the consumer) can shop. Although bricks and mortar are still widely embraced in the United States, Ecommerce and delivery of such goods has become even more widely accepted from us… and expected. Through all the industries and new opportunities Ecommerce has brought, one’s imagination could only be the barrier to what is possible in the world today. For us, we imagine a time where any consumer could open their electronic device and have access to the hundred thousand + products each local grocer has to offer. And not only that, but to be able to order a delivery on those products any time of the day, hassle free, and at an affordable rate for everyone. Unfortunately, for the average consumer in the United States that time has not yet happened and we’ve seen a few players burn some early adopters where it has. Fortunately however, we have an opportunity to learn from those mistakes and pursue a future in on-demand delivery
column2: a future that is almost certain to happen in all industries of services.

column1:
I started this company because I have personally witnessed many times, a perfect scenario for this type of service, and unfortunately it was not available. I feel most people would agree with that and probably have experienced the same. We are not only making grocery shopping hassle-free, but we are offering consumers the chance to free up their schedule and open opportunities of which may not have happened otherwise.  We truly believe that a large amount of families could benefit from a service like this... and that is why we will make it happen. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • For us to get this service up and running, we need to develop a website and an app. Since these platforms will be advanced, they will cost more money than my team and I had anticipated. We need $10,000 to be able to develop the website and get started.  After using the $10,000 we will work in getting the service up by the summer time of this year!

column1: <ul>

• Along with a delivery service for your groceries, we will offer awesome promotions for each week. Depending on the time of the year will depend on what types of deals we have going, but rest assured... they will be awesome!
  • Even if my team and I don't reach our goal for the funding, we will use every dime of it towards developing the website... and then we will search for more capital till we can get it done. That is our barrier we need to overcome to get the business started. 

    • The Impact

    The impact this type of service could bring to the US is larger than we thought. We currently have a few competitors and the significance they have brought to people is extraordinary. The thing however, is they charge prices that most people (including myself) could not afford. I don't really appreciate that, and because of that I would like to make it a reality for everyone. When anybody and everybody can get their groceries at the click of a few buttons, you know the world is moving in an awesome direction :) 

    •  We think this is really awesome because it makes life so much easier. Taking out the necessity of grocery shopping (yourself) can truly benefit every individual in their own way. For me, it relieves stress knowing that i don't have to worry about heading to the grocery store after work or on the weekends.

• We are making this for you, not for us. We believe people deserve a service of this caliber and will continue to work for it until it's a reality. The impact could be so large that it affects millions of lives in the United States each year.
Risks and challenges

As a company entering the market 3 years after the first player, we have both strengths of our own, and that we can draw upon from their mistakes, but also weaknesses from entering later, and some that we may never foresee coming until operating. With that being said, we understand there will be risks involved. Most notably, is the management of this project. The mere concept is an idea that everyone has dreamed of and thought about, so there is nothing completely unique about it. However... the management of the process, the pricing of the service, and the wages we pay our couriers for their customer service challenges is what will ultimately determine whether customers will like the business or not. We understand that we already have competitors, but if anyone were to read about how they treat their courier staff, how they charge you a large markup fee on the goods, and how they continue to increases prices and cut staff for increasing their bottom line... they would understand there needs to be significant improvements in the services out there. We (ShopLyft) are the ones who want to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

We aren't just looking for some money to get started... we are looking for awesome friends to support us and the word! Anyone and everyone who thinks this service could truly benefit themselves, please contact us with ANY ideas you have that could help this service be better. We are open to all ideas and look forward to what you can come up with! And please share the idea with other friends of yours. We are nothing without your support. With the help of you, we could grab a hold of this idea and make it a reality for everyone.
","See our Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/shoplyft/

My name is Kyle Harrop and I'm the owner of Horus Aged Ales. I have been homebrewing for the past ten years, where I have received dozens of awards. I have tasted nearly 18,000 different beers in the past decade. I have written reviews in various online beer and food publications. I have an Instagram account, floydster_horus, that shows my brewing endeavors, all the different great beers I have come across recently, and the craft beer events I have been fortunate enough to be a part of. Along with my wife, Laurel and daughter, Willow, we are embarking on the journey of opening a craft beer blendery/brewery.

What does Horus mean? Horus is the legendary falcon-headed god of Egypt. The name is an ode to my father, Bob, who is a falconer in California. I grew up around various species of birds of prey and considered them my feathered siblings. I credit my dad for getting me into craft beer as he was an enthusiast as soon as Stone Brewing Company became a fixture in the 1990s. All of the beer offerings from Horus Aged Ales will be named after a different bird of prey!

Why barrel aged beer? Barrel aged beer has intrigued me since the day I tasted my very first one. The mix of oak and wine or spirits with a delicious base beer offers such a unique drinking experience because of its complexity and exclusivity. Even with the same beer and same type of barrel, the beer in each one will have subtle differences and truly be one of a kind. The possibilities of flavors are unlimited and the craft beer world has just began to scratch the surface in my opinion. Horus will set out to provide combinations of flavors that have not been done before using local ingredients from local and regional farmers such as aronia berries, prickly pear, mulberries, rhubarb, black walnuts, and many more. Some of my most successful homebrew offerings will be replicated and will include a bourbon barrel aged imperial stout with Wisconsin maple syrup, wildflower honey, and Madagascar Vanilla Bean, as well as wild ales using peaches, nectarines, dragonfruit, and passionfruit.

I fell in love with barrel aged beer in 2006 after trying Lost Abbey Angel's Share in San Marcos, California for the first time. The days of drinking mass produced lagers were gone and I became a craft beer geek at that very moment. I started trading for different barrel aged beers across the United States and tried to get my hands on every different one I could find. What I noticed about most barrel aged beers was that they were simply a brewery's imperial stout aged in bourbon barrels. This flavor profile slowly became repetitive to me and I wondered why more breweries were not adding things like coffee, chocolate, vanilla, fruit, and spices to barrels to make these barrel aged offerings even more complex. So, I started making these kinds of beers on my own at home. They were very well received by friends and family, at local homebrew festivals, and even among professional brewers in the craft beer industry. Hence, the idea of Horus Aged Ales came to fruition. While there has been a small push for some to do these types of beers in the past few years, the market is still in need of unique barrel aged beers.

Our goal is to create a small blendery/brewery that focuses on small batch barrel aged beers using as many locally sourced ingredients as possible. We want to make unique beers that we are excited to drink ourselves and share them with the rest of you. We want to bring the farm-to-table restaurant experience to you through a bottle of unique barrel aged beer instead by using fruits directly from farmers. We are reaching out to possible contributors to make our dreams come true and get Horus Aged Ales up and running.

We are looking for $40,000 that will go towards rare oak barrels consisting of previously used bourbon barrels including Pappy Van Winkle, French Bordeaux wine barrels, Cognac barrels, puncheons, and a foeder. These unique barrels will make our recipes even more complex because of the amazing character from the spirit or wine that was used in them before. If we exceed the goal for crowdfunding, the money will go towards even more barrels, therefore we will be making more beer. The initial plan is to start with 100 different barrels, but that number can grow dramatically with your help.

The craft beer market is growing and our products will be a great addition to the portfolio. Vermont has Hill Farmstead, Oregon has De Garde, Wisconsin has Funk Factory, and Missouri has Side Project. Please help fund our dream of opening Horus Aged Ales!

I am a vegan chef and musician based in the San Francisco Bay area.
Sound &
column2:
Savor is a catering/personal chef business i started in 2003. I also offer cooking classes and run a dinner/concert series with world renowned musicians paired with gourmet cuisine in intimate, private settings, aka underground restaurants.
My food is entirely handmade, devoid of any industrialized, processed ingredients.   My culinary expertise focuses on the traditions of Thailand, Japan, the Caribbean, China, Italy and the Middle East as well as from my own cultural background from his Eastern European Jewish heritage.

column1: In addition, i am a professional musician and music teacher and have performed all over the US and in Japan and Europe and released numerous CDs.
This second book will follow up from the first one, adding more innovative and more traditional recipes.
This book is a sequel and followup to my well received, self-published first one, ""Notes From An Underground Restaurant: Improvisations Through Food and Music.""  Some of the amazing reviews:
National Public Radio:
http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2016/05/20/...
The local food magazine, Edible East Bay:
http://edibleeastbay.com/bookshelf/notes-from-a...

This book will feature a wide array of recipes that have been appearing on various underground restaurant events and catering events in recent years. A focus on traditional foods from around the world, especially Japan, Thailand, the Caribbean and my own Jewish Eastern European heritage will be featured.  The majority of the recipes are simple, everyday dishes but they can be combined and layered to create very elaborate gourmet meals.
The incredible food photographer and blogger, Hannah Kaminsky will be doing all the photos.
The funds being raised are for:
To hire and pay an editor (Eve Lynch).
To hire and pay a book designer (Dyanna Csappos).
To hire and pay a food photographer (Hannah Kaminsky)
To hold some book release celebration dinner/concerts
column2: to cover expenses of paying musicians, hiring servers, and, of course, ingredients.

column1: Publishing 1,000 copies of the book and mailing them out.

With your help I can get this accomplished! And with your help, I can offer you a wonderful new cookbook to enrich your kitchen. And for those who are more generous, I am happy to share what I have become known for, presenting evenings of world-class musicians paired with gourmet cuisine.
I have a proven track record with crowd fundraising as last yearI ran an indiegogo campaign to release my first cookbook, to great success!
Please feel free to share this among your friends and colleagues.
Thank you very much!

","I am a vegan chef and musician based in the San Francisco Bay area.Sound & Savor is a catering/personal chef business i started in 2003. I also offer cooking classes and run a dinner/concert series with world renowned musicians paired with gourmet cuisine in intimate, private settings, aka underground restaurants.My food is entirely handmade, devoid of any industrialized, processed ingredients.   My culinary expertise focuses on the traditions of Thailand, Japan, the Caribbean, China, Italy and the Middle East as well as from my own cultural background from his Eastern European Jewish heritage.
In addition, i am a professional musician and music teacher and have performed all over the US and in Japan and Europe and released numerous CDs.
This second book will follow up from the first one, adding more innovative and more traditional recipes.
This book is a sequel and followup to my well received, self-published first one, ""Notes From An Underground Restaurant: Improvisations Through Food and Music.""  Some of the amazing reviews:
National Public Radio:
http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2016/05/20/...
The local food magazine, Edible East Bay:
http://edibleeastbay.com/bookshelf/notes-from-a...

WHO ARE WE?

Roads Less Traveled - Africa is all about family, we are Gus, Ri, Caela and Loki. As avid travelers we have decided to embark on setting up our own travel business to share some of the magical places and moments we’ve had along our road!
Our real focus is making sure that families have a truly unique African experience that is still affordable
column2: unlike the many large tour operators we want to custom make all our tours with added extras to ensure each family’s trip is theirs and theirs alone. We don’t want quantity we really would like to make it all about the quality!

column1: Gus grew up in Africa and has traveled to most of Southern and East Africa over the years and has spent much of his time in the African bush. Risette set out from the Netherlands in 2010 to experience and learn more of what Africa had to offer, she still hasn’t gone home yet! Caela, at 20 months old has lived in the African bush, traveled to Mozambique and lived at the mouth of the mighty Limpopo River, visited Swaziland and much of South Africa and is now living in the awesome province of KwaZulu Natal. Loki as our faithful companion is never far away and loyally by our side on as many trips as possible!
WHAT WE NEED

After 3 months of setup and investment from our savings, we have completed the start-up company basics – vision, area of focus, registration and a solid foundation, we need to move to the next and very critical level.

This next level includes expanding on the small amount of marketing done thus far. With the $13,000 we will be able push our brand and product to travel agents and most importantly, the general public. It is essential that we improve our exposure in order to compete with the many larger operators out there.

Another key area of our product and who we are, is ensuring that all the places we offer to our guests are unique and have that “little something” extra. Therefore, we need to expand our search for these “hidden gems”. Your contributions will allow us to reach more places to ensure our guests have magical experiences!
In short, branding, marketing and exposure along with contacting potential partners is what we feel is required to kick us off completely!

You can help us realise our dream by purchasing one of our fantastic and unique perks, like our branded travel mug, custom travel journals or a fantastic African goodie pack. Always wanted to come to South Africa? This is your chance to help us and get the trip you've always dreamed of! Please contact us if you have any questions about the trips.
OUR CHALLENGES

As a small start up company who's focus is to keep it personal and hands on with all of our clients, we feel our biggest challenge is getting exposure and making a name  for ourselves in a very competitive industry with many large fish.

We therefore will utilise our funding to push our marketing and exposure to the areas we feel will gain us as much traction as possible, this being said, if we do not reach our funding requirement we will ensure that what we do raise, is utilised as effectively as possible!
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't help with a contribution, we would be most grateful for any help with getting the word out there about our campaign! If you can share our Indiegogo campaign on any social media level you'll always have a special place in our little start-up's heart! Thank you all very much!
Our Itinerary Planner

""What is Smokin Brotha’s?

   I have had a hunger for culinary ever since I was an adolescent and the majority of it stemmed from being a young boy that admired his father. As a kid growing up my father, my brothers (Kenneth Thorns, Brandon Washington, Danny Gorrer and Ivy Brown), and I had many favorite past times but one of the countless greats was the backyard barbeques that we use to do together. Most people only barbequed on special holidays but anytime my dad desired to get the boys together he would have a backyard barbeque. These childhood and adolescent experiences cultivated a desire within me to become a pit master.
   The more I smoked, however, the more I recognized the pleasure I obtained from seeing people truly appreciate the food I had prepared. This feeling turned into the fuel that pushed me to start perfecting my skill
column3:
as well as investing into my hobby at this time. Furthermore, four years ago I began barbequing on a more professional level by catering for events. My passion for perfection continued to grow and this passion caused me to begin creating my own: seasoning, links, and sauces.
    I moved to Tulsa to attend Oral Roberts University for college and I thought that this passion would have to die because I had to start over. However, the passion did not die and I met a friend named Zachary Monks
column4: now I recognize him as more of a brother then a friend. He continued to push me. He never ceased constantly telling me that I needed to sell my barbeque, and all I could think of were those past time backyard barbeques with my dad and my brothers
column5: thus Smokin Brotha’s was born.
column6:
/>What is the plan?

  We have purchased and partially furnished a barbeque bus in order to begin distributing our Smokin goodness in the Texas area. We have high expectations of opening more mobile food stations around the area to create a family of brotha’s throughout Texas.""


 

 

What we need:

Funding need will be distributed as follows. The figures are approximate as it depends on when the materials and equipment is purchased.

$4500 - Needed for the food trailer.

$2000 - interior Finish Out ( Including shelving, food holders, floor mats, etc.)

$1000 - Health inspection

The rest of the cash will be used for misc. restaurant supplies, food stock and whatever else comes up in the build process. There is also funds calculated within to cover fulfilling the perks. Most of the work will be done by yours truly.

Other Ways You Can Help - Get the Word out and Volunteer!

This is a community effort with many partners. You can help in many ways. Please send this to your friends. Use the ""share tools"" to link to this effort via Facebook, Twitter etc.

Contacts:

Brian Washington - 409-960-2199

http://www.smokinbrothas.com

Introduction

As in previous years with your support we plan, build and run hub which is suitable for food, drink and bio activities open to a broad public directly at the Hamburg Congress Center (CCH). We will have experimental kitchen where people can make their favourite recipes happen and share the results with others, workshop venue(s) dedicated to both more hands on educational workshops like ""Kombucha is Easy"", ""Experimental Incubator Building and Running"" but also to the tasting events like ""FHB Cheese Rendezvous"", ""Cider Tasting"" etc. Of course all the facilities necessary to accomplish this like washing area, storage, fridges, tables etc. needs to be organized too. All of the above we share with the community based on donations, no one turned away for lack of funds. For more info please have a look on our set up at previous events like 32c3, CCC camp 2015 and other.

 What is needed - YOU!

In order to make the above happen we need your support. We need people to get involved helping with general organization, preparing specific workshops and events, spreading the word, promoting this project and of course also the money needs to be collected to cover the expenses. What is left after the event will be used for future projects related to  the food, drink and bio.

This year we are back at the Hamburg Congress Center (CCH) located on the roof of the Hall H so you can pop in any time you like, as long as we have the capacity. We will be running workshops  and events through whole day starting in the morning going till late. In order to function properly we will need people on the deck so if you are around and willing to help, let us know in advance, it is not a rocket science to help with keeping the place clean and bit organized after all.

The budget and support

In order to support us also financially please do have a look on our perks. You can of course chip in just because you like this project, which is generally how we get our funds. However if you reward yourself and claim something nice what we prepared this year for you it would make us happy, and honestly, there really are some nice options there for you even if you can not come to 33c3 in person so have a look and claim!

The goals

€1200 - The Food Hacking Base basic set up. We will be able to build necessary infrastructure for experimental kitchen and workshops which this year due to our outside location includes tents, running water and drainage and we will stock the place and have enough resources to ""start it up"" on Day 0.

€1600 - Standard and smooth FHB set up. We can be bit relaxed about what we do and not count every penny doing some extra fun and crazy projects, also buying some better equipment which we can use on the future events.

€2500 and over - ""Infrastructure Guru and Projects Budget for 2017"". We can plan and build our infrastructure in a such manner that we can reuse it more easily on the future events and we will be left with money for projects for 2017.

Liamigua Hydroponics mission is to provide the highest-quality fresh vegetables in St Kitts and Nevis, with the best responsiveness to the needs of the people, while reducing reliance on imported food to feed our population. Our humanitarian mission is to make this technology easily accessible to individual families to empower them to feed themselves and others at a grass-roots level. Each donation helps a child in our Mentorship program.

What is hydroponics?

Hydroponics is a technology for growing plants in nutrient solutions (water containing fertilizers) with or without the use of an artificial medium (sand, gravel, vermiculite, rockwool, perlite, peatmoss. coir, or sawdust) to provide mechanical support.

Hydroponic growing (as opposed to soil growing) allows you to control the nutrient levels for your plants directly. Because of the higher control over nutrients, hydroponically grown plants generally have a much higher yield than similar plants grown in soil.

Why the use of Hydroponics?

Today, agriculture is much different than that practiced by our grandfathers. Threatened by problems related to water shortages, topsoil loss, reliance on fossil fuel inputs, and a changing climate, the productivity and reliability of our food systems and ecosystems are at stake. Alternatives are needed which are more efficient in use of resources, sustainable, resilient, and better mesh with our communities. Hydroponics is an agricultural technique poised to meet our current and future needs for locally raised, healthy and sustainable produce.

What will we produce?

Tomatoes
Cucumbers
Pepper
Lettuce
Basil
&
What We Need?

We need $8,500 to assist us with purchasing the necessary equipment to get started e.g (nutrients, nft channels, timers, water drums, waters pumps, seeds, plumbing supplies and other miscellaneous items).

To ensure the success of Liamigua Hydroponics, we will demonstrate the superior taste and shelf life of hydroponics vegetables in order to differentiate ourselves from traditionally grown produce while promoting sustainable food production in St. Kitts and Nevis.

Your support will be greatly appreciated.

Your contribution will help to make a positive change in the communities throughout St Kitts and Nevis and open employment opportunities for the youth of SKN.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word!

If you can't donate to our campaign. We'd love your help getting the word out. Please invite your friends and networks to check out our campaign. Use the share tools provided by this site to spread the word on social media.
