Self introduction and  background.
UDWA was established and registered in 1986 purposely to address the impediments to progress in the locality. They constitute among others
column2: unsustainable resource use,high deforestation, poor environmental management, malnutrition among pregnant women with disabilities and children, low tree planting response, conflicts between the community people and National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) ,gaps in provision of clean water , community health , Sanitation and Hygiene services.

column1: Importance of the campaign

The campaign aims to support beekeeping for livelihood improvement and food security through beekeeping and tree planting among marginalized youths and people with disabilities in Mukono district, by supporting 100 households by the end of the project, and to promote environmental conservation through awareness campaigns and advocacy in Mukono district.

This campaign is important in that it will benefit the community and their house holds by improving their socio-economic status and food security .All the farmers in the project area will benefit from pollination of crops by bees .Bee keeping will increase crop yields and improve house hold incomes and diet, Increase on school attendance where disabled parents will now have the ability and capacity to take their children to school because the project will teach them how to become self reliant and engage in gainful and environmental friendly employment
The magnitude of what contributors will help us achieve.

contributors will assist to the extent of providing support in the procurement of some inputs like timber, apiary specialized equipment including uniform, smokers, extraction equipment as well as sourcing any other inputs which we cannot get or improvise in-kind. These will supplement member and organizational contributions including construction of hives and training
<ul>
<li>We need $12000 to fill the gap in the implementation. This money will buy apiary equipment like
column2: beginners kits, assembled hives, 8 framed equipment, hive accessories, smokers and tools, clothing ,extractors and containers

column1: • Perks for supporters will include mentioning them on our web site in appreciation as well as in the blog and monthly newsletters. Also a list of contributors will be displayed at all training sessions and at our offices.
• If we do not meet the entire goal, we shall use the funds on a select part of the target group on a small number of beneficiaries then slowly multiply the project
why our project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
<ul>

• The project targets, particularly marginalized people with disabilities, parents of people with disabilities as well as vulnerable community people in dire need for intervention. These people are susceptible to suffering, brought about by lack of contingencies to enable them overcome challenges of life. Their state warrants the emergence of the project for their own good. People of all ranges are considered to participate, with respect to gender. We all realize the impact of environmental degradation and its global effects that do not discriminate perpetrators from innocent others. So by this action the whole global community stands to benefit from a good environment and more food production as well as a settled population that do not look at migration as a solution.

•  On record we are proud to mention that in the past 30 years of the organization's existence, projects related to community livelihood support incorporated with environmental protection and sustainability have been successfully implemented by our organization. Among these include training  and equipping disabled women in crafts making ,candle making as well as management of community peri-urban vegetable gardening among others.
Insight into the risks and obstacles likely to be faced on the way to achieving the goal. Some risks d o exist in the implementation of this kind of project and among them include
column2: bush fires through malice and the actions of hunters, there is also the risk of continued drought that is now ravaging peoples crops which includes destroying flowers ,a good source of nectars. Theft is another obstacle to success as many lazy people like to reap where they have not sown. Quality assurance I a common problem here but as we are to work in a group it will not be such a great challenge. There is also the problem of market access by farmers in this field as they are often cheated by traders.

column1: <ul>
<li>

overcoming the hurdles. Due to the goodwill established over a long time as well as the experience gained in community mobilization we hope to use mobilization and sensitization to contain the situation. Beneficiaries will also be taught to secure their hives by ensuring bush cutting near hives as well as continuing to be good members of their communities to secure goodwill and cooperation among the people. The marketing problem will be handled by a joint effort on processing and marketing to fetch a good price and ensure quality product through our organization.
<li>

Describe your plan for solving these challenges. The main strategy in solving such challenges lies in community sensitization as well as creating good will among community members, with a promise for integrating them into the project as it grows with time. Also through training members will learn to prevent some of the challenges as well as work on groups to overcome the weaknesses of working alone.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

The magnitude of what contributors will help us achieve.

contributors will assist to the extent of providing support in the procurement of some inputs like timber, apiary specialized equipment including uniform, smokers, extraction equipment as well as sourcing any other inputs which we cannot get or improvise in-kind. These will supplement member and organizational contributions including construction of hives and training
We need $12000 to fill the gap in the implementation. This money will buy apiary equipment like
column2: beginners kits, assembled hives, 8 framed equipment, hive accessories, smokers and tools, clothing ,extractors and containers

column1: Perks for supporters will include mentioning them on our web site in appreciation as well as in the blog and monthly newsletters. Also a list of contributors will be displayed at all training sessions and at our offices.
If we do not meet the entire goal, we shall use the funds on a select part of the target group on a small number of beneficiaries then slowly multiply the project
why our project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

The project targets, particularly marginalized people with disabilities, parents of people with disabilities as well as vulnerable community people in dire need for intervention. These people are susceptible to suffering, brought about by lack of contingencies to enable them overcome challenges of life. Their state warrants the emergence of the project for their own good. People of all ranges are considered to participate, with respect to gender. We all realize the impact of environmental degradation and its global effects that do not discriminate perpetrators from innocent others. So by this action the whole global community stands to benefit from a good environment and more food production as well as a settled population that do not look at migration as a solution.

On record we are proud to mention that in the past 30 years of the organization's existence, projects related to community livelihood support incorporated with environmental protection and sustainability have been successfully implemented by our organization. Among these include training  and equipping disabled women in crafts making ,candle making as well as management of community peri-urban vegetable gardening among others.
Insight into the risks and obstacles likely to be faced on the way to achieving the goal. Some risks d o exist in the implementation of this kind of project and among them include
column2: bush fires through malice and the actions of hunters, there is also the risk of continued drought that is now ravaging peoples crops which includes destroying flowers ,a good source of nectars. Theft is another obstacle to success as many lazy people like to reap where they have not sown. Quality assurance I a common problem here but as we are to work in a group it will not be such a great challenge. There is also the problem of market access by farmers in this field as they are often cheated by traders.

column1: overcoming the hurdles. Due to the goodwill established over a long time as well as the experience gained in community mobilization we hope to use mobilization and sensitization to contain the situation. Beneficiaries will also be taught to secure their hives by ensuring bush cutting near hives as well as continuing to be good members of their communities to secure goodwill and cooperation among the people. The marketing problem will be handled by a joint effort on processing and marketing to fetch a good price and ensure quality product through our organization.

Describe your plan for solving these challenges. The main strategy in solving such challenges lies in community sensitization as well as creating good will among community members, with a promise for integrating them into the project as it grows with time. Also through training members will learn to prevent some of the challenges as well as work on groups to overcome the weaknesses of working alone.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it.",0.0,0,"4 Campaigns
|","Mukono, Uganda",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/enivromental-conservation-and-appiary-for-income/pica

Hi! I'm Beau.

For 15 years, I've traveled the world as a professional dancer and instructor. I've been on stage with artists including Missy Elliott and J.Lo, on screen for productions such as American's Best Dance Crew and the VMAs with Fanny Pak, toured with World Of Dance, choreographed for high-profile brands like BMW and Infiniti, founded Maker Empire, and have taught at dozens of studios around the world. And I currently direct the non-profit dance company Culture Shock Los Angeles!
Knowing first hand how important the studio space is, I've made it my personal mission to create an environment made by artists, for artists.
Because I know... Being an artist is hard enough.
Elements Dance Space will cater to us.
Hi! I'm Tu.

I've spent the past 12 years cultivating dancers and dance programs from the ground up – and now I'm ready to plant new seeds. My previous studio's staff and I grew the roster from 100 to over 400 students, producing 10 recitals, 6 in-house adult dance showcases, numerous workshops and intensives, and co-producing Maxt Out Dance Competition for 4 seasons. I am currently in my second term as the Downtown Alhambra Business Association President.

With all these experiences, I'm confident that I will be able to create even more opportunities for artists of all ages at Elements Dance Space.

Maybe it's the Mommy in me...
With 2 sons, it's really showing that I love fostering the growth of others – both in a personal and professional context.
Beau + Tu = The Synergy of Passion and Action
Together, we want to create Elements Dance Space, where dancers and artists in the Greater Los Angeles / Southern California area can find everything they want and need.
<h2>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• We have a 10,000 sq ft. space
• We need $100,000 to turn that into Elements Dance Space
Elements Dance Space
From hosting events, workshops, master classes, and studio programs, to providing a workplace for all artists to choreograph, shoot, and rehearse,
Elements Dance Space...
<ul>
• Will have 5 studio rooms
• With viewing areas for classes, including a loft with a lounge area
• Will provide regular dance classes and programs, both for youth and adults
• Will serve as a multi-use event space
• Will be open open for rentals and shoots
• Will come with 6 restrooms (hallelujah!) and a shower
• Will come with convenient parking
• And up to 20 ft. high ceilings
<li>
And wood sprung floors (your knees will thank you)
<li>
AND AIR CONDITIONING
• Is a 3 minute Lyft ride away from downtown Pasadena's trendiest eateries and shops
• Will have no distinct branding inside of its rooms – it's meant to be a blank canvas for YOU!
<h2>Construction &amp

We're starting to build EDS this month – here's the tentative schedule.

Week 1 (3/2 – 3/5)
<ul>
• DEMO! Breaking down walls, removing the old carpet, etc.
• EXPERTS! The electrician, plumber, wiFi consultants, and more!
Week 2 (3/6 – 3/12)
<ul>
• Building of some walls
• Flooring, flooring, flooring...
• Did we mention floors? Wood sprung floors in ALL 5 spaces....
Week 3 (3/13 – 3/19)
<ul>
• Floors
• Floors
• Floors
Week 4 (3/20 – 3/26)
<ul>
• Prime
• Paint
• Flooring, floors, floorrrrrssssss
Week 4 (3/27 – 3/31)
<ul>
• Renovate restrooms, kitchen, offices
• Final fixtures, etc.
The Impact
Elements puts the creator, the mover, the artist first.
We drew from personal experience and talked to other dancers, choreographers, instructors, photographers, videographers, and even parents to pinpoint every little want &
From your health and safety to convenience and artistic freedom, Elements Dance Space is YOUR blank canvas.
It's A Movement

Do you believe in our mission to put dancers and artists first, but can't donate right now?

No worries! Help out the movement by spreading the word!

Share this Indiegogo campaign on social media or by telling your friends.

Thank you for supporting Elements Dance Space! 

 

Follow us on Instagram @elementsdancespace 
Like us on Facebook @elementsdancespace
Check out our site www.elementsdancespace.com
Email us elementsdancespace@gmail.com for more information

A short introduction video that narrates the problems faced by employees and how Graciouz minimizes the issues, creates happy employees, and make the business world a better place.
Shouldn't Every Employee be as Happy as Pharrell?
The fact is, most employees are not happy at all.
Statistical, we've found*:
<ul>
• 89% of organizations have time-waster issues
• 86% have employees’ collaboration issues
• 79% have problems to attract and retain employees
<li>77% feel unappreciated
column5: feel biased

column1: • 76% have politics issues
• 74% feel under-utilization and favoritism issues
• 60% have issues on not realizing employees’ potentials
• 51% have employees’ negative mentality
• 46% have value proposition issues on multiple generations and cultures
Why are employees so unhappy? Lack of recognition
column4: workplace politics... there is a multitude of reasons that can occur and all of these reasons cost every company a lot in lost revenues and profitability. Over time, this could create a trickle effect causing businesses financial hardship as well as the negative impact on the employees' health and mental well-being.

column1: Introducing...

Graciouz is a cloud-based Software-as-a-Service, powered by Graciouz mobile app provider that provides Workforce Actualization that allows employers to recognize and note missed opportunities of their employees. Graciouz Product Suite provides the solution that allows the workplace to become a foundation of pride and appreciation thereby increasing employees' morale, production, better workplace environment and overall health.

Gracious offers a research-proven approach for employers to recognize their employees while employer and employee can keep track through the state-of-the-art Graciouz mobile app. We will create an engaging company practice to institute change and improve overall work performance.

Our Mission: Make the Business world a better place. Through this principle and mission, Graciouz will launch our Graciouz Product Suite by the end 2016 and beyond, with the intention to “benefit” every employee in every organization.
How It Works and The Impact
Graciouz Product Suite consists of nine products:
<ul>
• Graciouz Appreciation
• Graciouz Motivation
• Graciouz Efficiency
To be launched by the end of 2016
<ul>
• Graciouz Performance
<li>Graciouz Profiling &amp
To be launched by the end of Q1 2017
<ul>
• Graciouz Participation
• Graciouz Welfare
• Graciouz Trainingware
• Graciouz Analytics
To be launched by the end of Q3 2017

Graciouz Appreciation formalizes the appreciation process between employees, and managers to employees. Simply, the appreciating employee / manager will login to the Graciouz mobile app to send his/her Graciouz Appreciation points (reward points) to the helpful employee as a reward to “thank” the support / assistance rendered / KPI achievement.

Graciouz Motivation formalizes the recognition of accomplishment process for all employees, where each employee will input their accomplishment before month end, and all other employees will recognize these accomplishments and sending Graciouz Motivation points (reward points) to the accomplishing employee. Graciouz Motivation encourages all employees to input their accomplishments (no matter how mundane) into the system as recognition of accomplishment / achievement, and reward Graciouz Motivation points to other employees as recognition of others’ accomplishments.

Graciouz Efficiency formalizes the process of cost-saving and/or corporate policy improvement initiatives, and soliciting consensus among employees on these ideas. Employees will get to review all consolidated initiatives through the Graciouz mobile app, and each employee will reward their Graciouz Efficiency points to those ideas they would like to be implemented. Collectively, the employees’ support of cost-saving and policy improvement initiatives will help to minimize the time taken for implementation, thereby, improve efficiency within the organization, and increase business net profit.
<ul>
• Feel appreciated and motivated from your colleagues and manager
• Be recognized for your contributions
• Be creative, innovative, inventive, and productive to increase business net profits
Who am I
I am Dr. Keith Kueh. I have a PhD in Marketing (with research emphasis in reward points) and have spent the last 20 years of my career in various multi-national and regional companies.

Since 2011, I have provided marketing consultancy to recruitment agencies and interacted with human resource executives, employees, and potential candidates. Many workforce-related issues surfaced between employees and management executives, and fueled the need to further research into fostering a better business world for these talents.

In early 2015, my research team and I commenced the study into non-benefit employee based motivation, and how organizations can better align business objectives through workforce actualization. *The research lasted more than a year, with thousands of research hours spent, and senior executives, human resource professionals, managers, and employees of sampled organizations were interviewed. The research findings were generalized and compared against secondary data, and a number of solutions to the research problems are conceptualized as the Graciouz Product Suite.
Additional Support

Please help to spread the word. I am sure most of you have had discussions about the workplace. Employees can introduce the Graciouz Product Suite to your company by engaging your supervisors, manager, HR or other  employees to improve the workplace environment.
Let your friends and family learn about this program so they can share and be encouraged as well. Everyone can benefit.
Please also share about this campaign on your social media pages through Indiegogo share tools, it will be greatly appreciated.
Costs Breakdown

Graciouz is committed to make the business world a better place for all talents. Please enable us to deliver our commitment with your kind support. The campaign funding target represents only 1.29% of our total expenditure. However, every backer counts toward delivering our commitment and goals to make the business world a better place.

Who We Are and How We Got Here:

Mira's Homemade was founded in 2012 with the idea that snack foods could and should be simple and healthy. Mira has always loved preparing food for family and friends and has spent years experimenting to make dishes that are optimally nutritious, ethically conscious, and fantastically delicious. Frustrated by the complicated ingredient lists and dubious nutrition of most commercially available snack foods, Mira developed a simple, crowd-pleasing granola and started making it available to her community. Almost before we knew it, Mira's Homemade was proudly sitting on the aisle of natural grocers all over the Mid-Adlantic region. The reaction to our granola has been inspiring and encouraging, and we have had an amazing four years of learning and discovery. Now we hope to adapt to what we've learned and lay a strong foundation for future expansion so that we can continue to make healthy snacks our friends and global neighbors can feel good about eating.
Obstacles You Can Help Us Overcome:

We are a small, family-run company and, true to our name, Mira herself still makes and packages everything by hand. While this is rewarding, it doesn't leave a lot of time or resources for the other demands of the business. Right now, we can just keep up with the contracts we have, but we lack the resources to take things much further. That's where your contribution can really make a difference!
How We're Going to Do It:

We love hearing from our customers and we consider their feedback very closely. One thing we've learned is that people really enjoy the versatility of our product and they connect to it as a snack food more than as a granola. We've also had requests for smaller-portioned packaging and encouraging interest in an expanded product line. These are great ideas, and we believe that they will be beneficial to our long-term success. In order to take our company to the next level, we are hoping to raise twenty-five thousand dollars for new packaging, new equipment to accommodate the smaller bags, and payroll for an employee to help meet increased demand. This injection of capital will boost us to a level that is more sustainable by streamlining our production process and reducing costs. Once we achieve this goal, we hope to distribute our granola on a national (or even global) scale, expand our product line, and continue our mission to create snacks that do 'the least amount of harm to, and the most amount of good for, animals, humans, and the natural resources on our precious planet.'
Why Support Vegan, Organic, etc.?

Many people are searching for more sustainable, ethical, or healthier dietary options. Some people are required to eat certain kinds of food due to a medical condition. Regardless of why people choose or need to eat these foods, the fact is that these options are becoming more popular.
https://www.organicconsumers.org/old_articles/O...
We believe our snackable granola will appeal to a wide audience and grow into a major player in the health food industry.
Want to Donate, but Simply Can't?

Money is not the only way you can help...

~ Ask your local health food store (or larger retailer) to carry Mira's Homemade
~Tell your friends about us
~Visit and share our website, Facebook page, Twitter, Tumblr, and campaign page
Thank you for helping us spread the raw granola love!
Most gratefully yours,

column1: Vendée Point Restaurant & Wine is a small boutique fine dining restaurantwith a modern rustic ambiance and experience that compels guest to return. This World Class restaurant will house 62 guest withelegant decor, china, glassware, & flatware. The team will consist of an Elite and highly talented small crew executing an amazing experience for each guests.The menu will reflect the dynamic expression of the Chef’s culinary mastermind and seasonal high quality produce.Menus will change daily, weekly, & monthly depending on product availability and guest interest. Banquets and catering will showcase the Chef’s talents in meeting the needs of large parties and provide highmargin transactions allowing Vendée Point Restaurant & Wine kitchen to provide multiple streams of revenue.Burning with Chef JaE - Stuffed Chicken Breast & Mushroom Risotto  Burning With Chef JaE - Episode #3 With the extreme amount of diet related illness in 2016 Chef Penright makes it his personal responsibility tobe an enlighten leader of the culinary industry. Paying close attention to how your food is sourced, grown, harvested, slaughter, shipped, & cooked. When Vendée Point states its chicken is hormone free it’s not meaning ""hormone free upon slaughter”because the hormones that were introduced are now untraceable according to the FDA specifications.Vendée Point Restaurant & Wine will serve chicken that hasnever been introduced to hormones at any point ever. No games or play on words to deceive the public! Chef Penright has made his name for the elaborate private chef appearancesin the Houston community. Known for stark yet familiar contrasting meals for local celebrities, company home holiday parties, and staycation honeymoons. Vendee Point Restaurant & Wine will build a strong network of very talented professional private chefs that will cook, serve, and clean in your home for family and friends.  Apprenticeship ProgramOne observation from France was the well-established relationship between the culinary schools and local restaurants. This program allows for Vendée Point to source talent in its early stages that can be molded into the skill set needed for success. As an Alumni of Culinary Institute of Lenotre Executive Chef Jonathan Penright has a direct and well established connection with the authority to build a strong apprenticeship program.    The layout of Vendée Point Restaurant & Wine will be that of a loft style conceptthat is flexible to accommodate the needs of the guest.With a total of 4,000 sq ft this is a small restaurant format with a fairly large kitchen to support the multiple areas of operation.  **Full Disclosure** Vendee Point Restaurant & Wine's total project cost $1,000,000 and we can not begin construction until that goal is reached. In the invent that this indiegogo campaign does not reach the goal of $1MM we will take what funds we have raised and move to plan b. Our plan b is to source private investors that are looking for a solid restaurant concept to silently invest combining the funds raised from this campaign to reach our $1MM goal. We will honor ever single perk you have purchased! I will assure you I will not stop until the doors of Vendee Point Restaurant & Wine are open and ready to serve the community. Thanks for your support in advance. **Full Disclosure**",7.0,3,"1 Campaign

LV

Help NeZvērs go mobile!

We want to become the first 100% plant-based catering service in Riga, Latvia to make this ethical and sustainable lifestyle more accessible to the population of Latvia. Healthy fast food, is that possible? 

All around you companies provide you with delicious food, but many don't seem to care about their impact. We're convinced it's possible to offer our customers a delicious, healthy meal for an affordable price right in the center of Riga without producing excessive amounts of waste. By buying from local farmers, avoiding non-biodegradable products and giving away leftovers to local homeless and poor people, we plan to make a better impact and be an inspiration for other businesses of the future. We need your help to do this!


We're going to provide you with delicious, juicy, plant-based burgers to satiate your voracious, beastly appetite. We have worked on our recipes with professionals and found the best solutions for combining healthy ingredients and unforgettable taste!

Despite very few recycling options in Riga, we always make an effort to recycle and reduce and most importantly reuse as much as possible. Our goal is to become as waste-free as possible.


We are a team of three young women who are passionate about animals, food and sustainability. Victoria studied Bio-Medical Engineering and Physics, Agate studied International Hotel Management and Katrina is studying Biology. All three of us love cooking!

NeZvērs was one of the winning teams at the Social business accelerator program ""Socifaction"" funded by Erasmus Plus in 2015. Not only did we get competent training in social business planning and marketing, but we also took part in a mentoring program, had our products tested and got some catering experience. Since then we've been catering at small events, parties and small festivals, but a food truck will make us much more mobile.

column1: What We Need

In order to upgrade our status from NeZvērs pop-up to NeZvērs mobile we need your help. We have found a perfect food truck to transport our goods, betters and bests to the crowds of hungry youngsters at festivals.

Our goal is to raise 10,000 Euros to cover all the necessary expenses that come with starting a catering business. We need to buy, re-design and better equip the food truck to be able to go to all the coolest festivals around Latvia and the Baltics. 8000 Euros is needed to buy and redesign the food truck and the rest will go towards buying additional equipment and stock for the first events.
Please help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family and follow us on Facebook for more updates!
Contribute now to help us feed the hungry beasts waiting for our burgers!

Due to limits set by PayPal we kindly request you to choose payments by credit card rather than PayPal. Also the currency of funds raised will be converted in the end of the campaign due to Indiegogo setup requirements and limits. Dollars will become Euros, NeZvērs will go mobile.
Many thanks to Klāvs Loris for excellent video production
Thanks to Jānis Andersons for contribution to our ideas and the food truck design
Thanks to Rombo and Sanita for the input in the development of the logo
Thanks to Ramsey Rimkeit for narration and for adding his Californian touch to our recipes
Thanks to our mentor, Eliza Kibere for great advice, recipes and support!
Palīdzi NeZvēram kļūt mobilam!

Mēs, NeZvēra komanda, vēlamies atvērt pirmo 100% vegānisku ēdināšanas vietu Rīgā, lai padarītu šo ētisko un videi draudzīgo dzīvesveidu pieejamāku Latvijas iedzīvotājiem. Pagājušā gada novembrī vairāk kā 1000 Latvijas iedzīvotāju pieņēma izaicinājumu kļūt par vegāniem uz vienu mēnesi, kas liecina par plašu interesi par šo dzīvesveidu mūsu valstī!

NeZvēra galvenais mērķis ir sniegt Tev gardus, apetelīgus vegāniskus burgerus, lai apmierinātu pat nezvēra apetīti! Izstrādājot receptes ar profesionāļu palīdzību, esam nonākušas pie labākiem risinājumiem, apvienojot veselīgas sastāvdaļas un neaizmirstami lielisku garšu!
Viss NeZvēra ēdiens tiek mājražots, ir lielākoties vietējs un pagatavots no sezonālām sastāvdaļām. Īsāk sakot - mēs esam no nākotnes!
NeZvērs parūpēsies par to, lai visi ēdieni, kas netiks izlietoti, nonāk to rokās, kam tie visvairāk vajadzīgi. Mēs esam par labo darbu darīšanu un atkritumu mazināšanu!

NeZvēra komanda sastāv no trim jaunām dāmām, kam rūp vegānisms, ēdiens un ekoloģija. Viktorija ir ieguvusi izglītību medicīnas inženierijas un fizikas jomā, Agate –viesnīcu menedžmentu un viesmīlību internacionālā augstskolā, un Katrīna mācās par biologu.

NeZvērs bija viena no uzvarētājkomandām sociālo uzņēmēju akseleratora Erasmus+ atbalstītajā programmā „Socifaction” 2015. gadā. Mēs esam izgājušas apmācības par sociālās uzņēmējdarbības plānošanu, mārketingu, piedalījušās mentorēšanas programmā, esam testējušas savus produktus un ieguvušas izbraukumu ēdināšanas pieredzi. Kopš tā laika esam piedalījušās lielākos un mazākos pasākumos, un mobilā virtuve padarītu NeZvēru vēl pieejamāku!
Kas mums ir vajadzīgs

Mums ir vajadzīga Tava palīdzība, lai NeZvērs kļūtu mobils! Mūs ir uzmeklējusi ideāla virtuve uz riteņiem, kas ir gatava  pārvadāt NeZvēra labumus uz festivāliem un pasākumiem izsalkušu jauniešu pūļiem!

Mūsu mērķis ir uzkrāt 10 tūkstošus Eiro, lai segtu nepieciešamos izdevumus, kas ir saistīti ar izbraukuma ēdināšanas uzņēmējdarbības sākšanu. Šajos izdevumos ietilpst mobilās virtuves iegāde, dizaina un aprīkošanas izmaksas kā arī ar uzņēmējdarbības sākšanu saisītas izmaksas.
Palīdzi NeZvēram, pastāstot par šo kampaņu saviem draugiem un ģimenei!
Saistībā ar Paypal uzstādītajiem ierobežojumiem, mēs laipni lūdzam Tevi izvēlēties maksāšanas opciju ar kredītkarti.
Valūta tika izvēlēta saistībā ar Indiegogo prasībām un ierobežojumiem. Kampaņas beigās visi savāktie līdzekļi tiks pārvērsti Eiro.
Atsevišķi vēlamies pateikties Klāvam Lorim par brīnišķigu video
Paldies Rombo un Sanitai par ieguldīto darbu NeZvēra logo tapšanā
Paldies Jānim Andersonam par ieguldījumu mūsu idejās un mobilās virtuves dizainu
Paldies Remzijam Rimkeitam par teksta ierunāšanu un savu Kalifornijas pieskārienu mūsu recepšu veidošanā
Paldies mūsu mentorei, Elīzei Ķiberei par labiem padomiem, receptēm un atbalstu!

<b style=""font-size: 16px

Founded by Chattanooga locals, Matt E. Park and Josh Tilford, + c o f f e e  has been operating mobile pop-ups at various locations and events around Chattanooga. But, we've chosen to open our first brick and mortar + c o f f e e  shop in St. Elmo because the community here embodies the collaborative spirit that drives everything we do. We believe we can do more together. 

This isn't just another coffee shop, this is something more, something that reflects, engages and benefits our community. 

We are ST. ELMO + c o f f e e.

Makers + Curators + Innovators

We make delicious specialty coffee thoughtfully curated from Southern roasters who care about the farmers and sustainable growing practices. And we’re not scared to try new things.

Hire Local + Serve Local + Reflect Local

ST. ELMO + c o f f e e  is also uniquely microlocal. What do we mean by that? The ST. ELMO + c o f f e e  shop will be operated by folks from in and around the St. Elmo neighborhood. Everything from the design and buildout of the space to the people working behind the counter. This shop—your shop—will reflect the unique characteristics of our neighborhood.

Environmental Commitment.

We strive to be environmentally conscious by using upcycled materials, efficient building practices, choosing a repurposed space in a historic building, recycling our waste, composting our spent coffee grounds, focusing on “For Here” serveware over paper and plastic “To Go”, and collaborating with others to keep this neighborhood and our city clean and beautiful.

YOU + c o f f e e.

We’ve bootstrapped to this point. But, we still need $30,000 to build out the shop, and cover basic startup costs. Help us spread the word and come by the shop. This place is for you!  

PERKS + c o f f e e.

We've put together several perks packages that we think you're going to love! We're excited to partner with this neighborhood and can't wait to make you a coffee and share this space with you.

Follow Us.

www.pluscoffee.co

instagram.com/pluscoffee.co

facebook.com/pluscoffe.co

twitter.com/pluscoffee_co

I am Kerry Cochran,
Formerly a Chief Operations Officer in Silicon Valley, Seattle musician, and currently a salesperson in deregulated energy market.
<ul>
• Small Neighborhoods mission, is to provide an opportunity for folks. Not by merely providing an additional income, and to help pay bills and make necessary major purchases.

• This small amount of capital is needed to incorporate Small Neighborhoods. With your help, this contribution gives confidence, as the revenue begins to come, and creates a contract with the state of Illinois, where I've chosen to license.
• For over 7 years, steps have been taken to create the business model that Small Neighborhoods is to become, and now (October 2016) is the time.
Please donate $2 now, if you haven't already. Thank you for your time.
<h3>Small Neighborhoods <u>needs a business license</u> &amp
column2: by simply knowing, first, you have privy to be an early adopter.

column1: Each contributor will be given the opportunity to see the expansion of Small Neighborhoods Business, on a quarterly basis. information that won't be readily available if available at all, to general public:
<ul>
• I need $709 to incorporate, and $499.99 for legal fees.
• Everyone who donates $1 or more, will receive quarterly expansion updates as to where in the USA Small Neighborhoods is being utilized and which products are popular/offered.

• If funding does not reach goal, the amount will go toward promotions, and we will expand the campaign and try again. If over 70% of the goal is reached, we will try to acquire the license and postpone the legal fees until revenue can cover the cost.
Small Neighborhoods Community

This type of work, the kind that allows people to earn a living by solicitation, cold calling, and appointment setting, has been in my blood for many years. Bringing a commission only paying job, a direct marketing job, to someone who wants a career change, or who wants a job and does not have one, is my hope. By spreading the word, and contributing, you and I are going to be sure this opportunity happens, and becomes available for them.
<ul>

• The expandable business model allows an 80% profit retention within the small neighborhood community by giving an overwhelming majority of the profit directly to the Small Neighborhood leader. Expandable in a way that gives incentive to the the Small Neighborhoods leader by creating other leaders. New leaders, in turn, create 80% profit retention (5%-10% to referring small Neighborhoods Leader)
• This will accomplishment will sit nicely aside with other companies that I have worked with, worked for, and that I have helped found.
• The quicker I have this available, the sooner people can be out promoting and selling.
<h3>Risks &amp

This funding is important, very much so, not just for me as an owner, and for many future co-founders and partners, but for the hundreds perhaps thousands of future Small Neighborhoods Leaders and the communities and products to which they represent. As I step into a role as CEO, and significantly cut back on my sales representative agent role, I will be attempting this leadership position for the first time. Most certainly a risk, as I step away from the (multi-billion dollar parent company) corporate umbrella, and eek a modest living from partnership sales and percentage of profit agreements.
<ul>
• My door to door experience has prepared me for many negative responses, and sales revenue lulls.
• I plan to continue the good fight, through the highs and the lows.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• A re-post from you, can potentially make the difference between success and failure!
<li>CTRL A, CTRL C, and CTRL V, onto your sharing site please
• Become a Small Neighborhoods Leader.

That is all, thank you for your time folks.

Small Neighborhoods needs a business license & by simply knowing, first, you have privy to be an early adopter.

Each contributor will be given the opportunity to see the expansion of Small Neighborhoods Business, on a quarterly basis. information that won't be readily available if available at all, to general public:
I need $709 to incorporate, and $499.99 for legal fees.
Everyone who donates $1 or more, will receive quarterly expansion updates as to where in the USA Small Neighborhoods is being utilized and which products are popular/offered.

If funding does not reach goal, the amount will go toward promotions, and we will expand the campaign and try again. If over 70% of the goal is reached, we will try to acquire the license and postpone the legal fees until revenue can cover the cost.
Small Neighborhoods Community

This type of work, the kind that allows people to earn a living by solicitation, cold calling, and appointment setting, has been in my blood for many years. Bringing a commission only paying job, a direct marketing job, to someone who wants a career change, or who wants a job and does not have one, is my hope. By spreading the word, and contributing, you and I are going to be sure this opportunity happens, and becomes available for them.

The expandable business model allows an 80% profit retention within the small neighborhood community by giving an overwhelming majority of the profit directly to the Small Neighborhood leader. Expandable in a way that gives incentive to the the Small Neighborhoods leader by creating other leaders. New leaders, in turn, create 80% profit retention (5%-10% to referring small Neighborhoods Leader)
This will accomplishment will sit nicely aside with other companies that I have worked with, worked for, and that I have helped found.
The quicker I have this available, the sooner people can be out promoting and selling.
Risks & Challenges

This funding is important, very much so, not just for me as an owner, and for many future co-founders and partners, but for the hundreds perhaps thousands of future Small Neighborhoods Leaders and the communities and products to which they represent. As I step into a role as CEO, and significantly cut back on my sales representative agent role, I will be attempting this leadership position for the first time. Most certainly a risk, as I step away from the (multi-billion dollar parent company) corporate umbrella, and eek a modest living from partnership sales and percentage of profit agreements.
My door to door experience has prepared me for many negative responses, and sales revenue lulls.
I plan to continue the good fight, through the highs and the lows.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
A re-post from you, can potentially make the difference between success and failure!
CTRL A, CTRL C, and CTRL V, onto your sharing site please
Become a Small Neighborhoods Leader.
That is all, thank you for your time folks.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Murphysboro, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/small-neighborhoods-marketing/pica

Who are we?

usemy.xyz is a mobile app, designed to provide a marketplace where people can lend and borrow things. The idea for usemy.xyz was born when we found there is no user-friendly platform that exists in the marketplace today that serves this rapidly growing sharing economy.
<div>

usemy.xyz brings a community of people together to allow people to save money by borrowing things they only need for a short-term and also allows others to make extra income with the things they already own.

Aiki-Community

Our purpose is to return to Earth as its caretakers and to utilize the spiritual practice of Aikido to maintain communal harmony, connect to the divine source, and to realize our potential as human beings.
Founder,
Mark Hughes

Mark has been studying in many areas of the human experience, including mythology, transpersonal psychology, mystical experiences, eastern and western philosophy, and comparative religions. Mark has determined that Aikido is the key ingredient to create his dream of a harmonious community that lives close to nature.
Aiki-Community Structure
Our community is based on the Aikido live-in student program in Iwama, Japan.
We will keep a daily schedule that delegates work, training times, and other basic duties as they need to be completed.
The remainder of the day will be spend doing as the individual community member sees fit. Our purpose is the sustainable freedom of mankind.
We will utilize sustainable building practices like cobb, wattle and dob, straw-bale, etc, to reduce costs and our impact on the environment.
In addition to our raised bed gardens, our plan is to build a food forest by using permaculture. For off season organic farming, we will use aquaponics.
What Your Gift Buys
Your contribution helps to secure our core team, purchase land, and build basic structures to begin developing an agricultural community.

Some of our perks include recognition on our website, personalized copies of The Art of Peace by Morihei Ueshiba, the founder of Aikido, personalized video's dedicated to you, and the chance to reserve a spot as a live-in student after we become established.
Obstacles

Creating a community like this is not as difficult as some may assume. Human beings do not need very much to be satisfied. It is just that we have made our lives to be so complicated and based our economy on human weaknesses that we are more sickly and depressed as ever.

The simple life is the life a human yearns for. To live close to nature, to be a part of a community, to learn and grow, and to have time to appreciate life. We hope that through the live-in student program, people can see that a sustainable future full of abundance and happiness is the best way for the future.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please visit our website and fill out our student questionnaire. You can also tell your friends and family about our campaign and encourage them to donate. We will also accept messages of encouragement and to deposit in our enthusiasm bank account!!

Stacey's Sweets History... so far:

In December of 2012 I was facing a crossroads of my life. Post divorce, working full time at an unfulfilling job and not making the commission promised, not able to pay my bills and wanting MUCH MORE out of life.  Full disclosure, within a week's time I made the decision to declare personal bankruptcy (very low moment for me) and also decided to sell these amazing Original Chocolate Chip Bombs that I had made for many friends and family over about 15 years.  Well let me tell you, the orders started coming, flavor requests were made and I pulled my bootstraps up and got to work!  This empire has become much more than I ever imagined it would be.  Yes, I hustle like a crazy woman but the SUPPORT I receive from my Sugar Baby Customers and this community is unparalleled.  A couple of years ago you guys helped me get my epic, pink Cookie Cart, aka CC.  I love her so much and she has so much fun in public and is a total traffic stopper.

My brand has grown so much and the orders have greatly increased though retail shops, corporate accounts, private label Bourbon Bombs (William Sonoma is VERY interested!), charity events, school functions and web orders, that I'm asking for help once again.   ""Go to a bank"" you might say, well banks are fussy and not quite ready to loan much to someone that's rebuilding their credit with very sporadic income.

I've been able to obtain my commercial license by utilizing other commercial kitchens.  Well... it's time for my OWN BAKERY!  Don't you agree?  Every single bit of funds raised will help with the build out of the space and purchase of equipment for the bakery.  The space is small and very manageable.  I will have some fantastic, flexible landlords and it's grouped with other businesses so we can support each other.  To say I'm excited is the understatement of the year.
There are different levels of perks and goodies that come with donations.  I will have a super cute wall in the bakery dedicated to ALL of my supporter's name and business logos as well!
Thank you from the bottom of my Sugar Momma heart.
Peace, Love and Cookies,
Stacey

Just picture it…an American family is working in Cameroon and sees the potential in the people from a rural village and the soil’s ideal conditions for agriculture.  Fast forward 6 years and WeFarm2 has been thoughtfully and strategically developed and is ready to take its first step as a Women Owned / Women Run agribusiness.

As the principal founder of WeFarm2, Jennifer wanted to create an income generating farm for a group of women from a rural village outside of Cameroon's capital city that would utilize modern farming techniques based on solar energy and smart water agriculture.  

Cameroon ranks 5th in the global production of cocoa beans that are sold for bulk chocolate.   Its climate and soil pH is optimal for cocoa but the small plot farmers who are leading Cameroon’s production are using outdated farming techniques while suffering devastating harvests due to Cameroon’s ever-changing rainfall patterns.  Despite the change in the rainy season's schedule and rainfall amounts, no known farm in Cameroon uses drip irrigation.  The lack of technical knowledge and cultural reliance on rainfall forces farmers to enjoy strong harvests one year and devastating crops the next.
column2:
>That’s where WeFarm2 comes into play.

WeFarm2 has created a cocoa venture that will be Cameroon’s first drip irrigated farm powered by solar energy.  Based on the foundation that the women who labor on the farm are also co-owners, WeFarm2 works with a group of 25 women who have always farmed for a living.  They have worked on small cassava plots but have never been paid directly for their work. Now, for the first time, they will earn a daily wage for their labor at WF2 while simultaneously acquiring farm shares as co-owners of WF2’s cocoa farm.
column3:
>The women in our group are wives—they are mothers and daughters and sisters—and now, together, they farm, too.

With an engineering background, WeFarm2 created a master plan so that the 225 acre farm is divided into 2-100 acre parcels.  Each 100 acre parcel has been further divided into 4-25 acre sections so that each 25 acre section cultivates 12,000 cocoa trees.  The initial 25-acre section has a 325foot deep water well and its water pressure test results have proven that it will fully drip irrigate an entire 100 acre parcel or 50,000 cocoa trees.   To further our commitment to smart energy, the well’s irrigation pump will be powered by solar panels.  

The initial 25-acre section will have 10 rows of cocoa trees:

column1: <li>Each row hosts 100-120 cocoa trees
• Each tree is drip irrigated with drip emitters.
With this design and system in place, we will ensure a sound foundation for this first crop of 12,000 cocoa trees that will mature and produce cocoa pods for harvest in 3-4 years.
column2: >The drip irrigation pipes + 24,000 drip emitters + irrigation well pump + the solar panels
column3:
>cost = $25,000.  

Since 2012, WeFarm2 has raised over $90,000 to buy 225 acres of land, set up a nursery with 12,000 baby cocoa saplings, and pay for the trees’ maintenance over the next 4 years.  

The women are ready to begin planting and maintaining the trees – the trees are ready for transplant – the final piece to complete this phase of WeFarm2 is the installation of the drip irrigation and solar pump system.
column4:
>Thank you and we hope you will become a part of our cocoa farm venture. Come join us on our start of the Chocolate Trail.

Short Summary
<ul>

• Hi! My name is Michael Palombo, husband, father, cook, artist, artisan coffee roaster and owner at Fans Of Film cafe and V Roast Coffees.  I've worked at many local Albuquerque kitchens over the years and love putting my talent into food and coffee.

• Great News!!! We've signed a lease on a location in one the hottest destination points in Albuquerque. Nob Hill- 3904 Central AV SE 87108. The space is 900 sf, not has big has I would like but a great start and location for the first coffee shop with an all vegan menu. The coffee shop will be called ""V Roast"" vegan coffee bistro. ""V Roast Coffees"" is still Albuquerque's first all organic air roaster.

• We have a month and half free rent to open it up and we have no money to do it yet, BUT WE HAVE FAITH. We are applying for loan and we're selling our mobile coffee trailer if need be. We know we'll open because Michael has built two successful coffee bars and if we have to open with just a coffee bar some pre-made burritos and pastries, that's what we'll do. Our love and blessing to all that have pledge, your kindness is a jewel in our hearts. -Michael.
• Current vegan menu

• You get to make a difference in a world that depends on the killing of animals to survive. Our perks are small but the outcome of your contribution is huge beyond measure. In this recent report by CNN <
column2: --link, going vegan could save the planet.

column1: • $20,000 will cover remodel and move, the rest will be used to pay employees. The money will also insure we survive the first few months of re establishing a new location.
• Your help will give me and my wife and business partner the ability to overcome the huge financial burden of moving into a bigger space and ensure our success.
The Impact
<ul>

• Our impact on the community and world at large would be huge environmentally. If we cook 50 vegan meals a day we'll save everyday 16 animals, 17600 gallons of water, 720 ponds of grain and 480 SQ feet of forest.
• Being a cutting edge organic coffee house and vegan cafe it would be a game changer for our community.
• Our coffee roasting process has a carbon foot print of 19 to 1 in emissions compared to gas drum roasting. We use new induction and air frying technology for our cooking for a 0 carbon emissions.
<li>It might be hard to connect meat and carbon emissions
column2: but it turns out eating meat increases your carbon footprint more than driving your car.

• Being a a small struggling coffee shop to a thriving cafe and coffee house roaster as been a true third wave experience. So lets now take it beyond the wave into the future of a cruelty free ""V Roast Coffees"" an all organic coffee house and vegan cafe.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our famous vegan Bluebery Muffins recipe

6 muffins-

1 vegan egg from ""Follow you Heart""

1/2 cup of soy creamer

3/4 cups of sugar

2 teaspoons of vanilla

1 teaspoon of salt

1/2 cup of coconut oil

stir contents before adding the rest

2 teaspoons baking powder

1/4 cup warm water on top of baking powder

1 1/2 cups of flour and mix

3/4 cup blueberry- spread blueberry just before adding crumb

Crumb recipe

1/2 cup regular sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar

2 teaspoons of vanilla

1/2 teaspoon salt

3/4 cup flour.

1/4 cup of vegan butter or coconut oil. best when it's half butter and half oil

mix

Albertine Press is moving to Inman Square!

After twelve years in Union Square, Somerville, Albertine Press is moving. Our new location is only blocks from our current studio and in the heart of Inman Square, a historic, vibrant Cambridge neighborhood full of restaurants, shops, and a growing maker community. In addition to our letterpress studio, we will be adding a new retail store focused on the exchange of the written word, plus a space for workshops and creative events. We bring to our new neighborhood a place where creative community can grow by sharing tables, materials, and ideas with one another. Help us create our new home in Inman!
Write More. Right Now.

Albertine Press is a woman-owned design and letterpress print studio founded in 2005 by Shelley Barandes, a sometime-architect who just loved paper more. Our team carries on the centuries-old tradition of letterpress printing
column2: inks are still hand-mixed, most of our presses are hand-fed, and we have a collection of hand-set wood and metal type. We also integrate computers and photopolymer plates, marrying age-old techniques with modern technology.

column1: At its core, our artisanal business is built upon the physical, tactile exchange of the written word and communication as it once was - lasting, memorable, meaningful. In a digital world, we all have fewer and fewer instances to engage with one another in this indelible way, and we typically reserve them for momentous life occasions. Albertine Press wants to help people bring the celebration of paper and written exchange to the everyday.

In our new space we can do this. We will sell not only our own paper goods, but work by other respected artisans and craftspeople, as well as desk accessories, craft supplies, and paper curiosities for our local paper lovers. We're connected to a vast network of makers from which we can curate a collection not available online or at chain stores. Funds will help us with custom build out particular to selling stationery and gifts as well as commissioning unique custom products for our community.

Teaching has also been an integral part of the studio mission from the beginning. For our first few years, we offered regular workshops in letterpress and book arts, but as our business grew, the demands on our small space made it impossible to continue.

We are beyond excited to have found a new space for Albertine with the flexibility to go back to our roots and offer regular workshops and events once again. We are working hard on developing some fantastic offerings for the month of December, including calligraphy, DIY holiday gift wrap, thank-you-note writing, print-your-own stationery, and more.

We are also committed to supporting our community by offering up our mixed-use space regularly to neighborhood groups - helping promote open communication and conversation between neighbors.

 

What’s all the money for anyway?
The money we raise will offset these major expenses:
<ul>
<li>
Moving the studio :: Moving our antique presses is no small feat
column2: it requires specialized riggers and equipment because they literally don’t make ‘em like they used to - they no longer make presses like these at all! In addition to moving a studio with twelve-years of accumulated furniture and ephemera, the week-long process will require partially dismantling and reassembling several of our presses.

column1: <li>

Build out ::  Some of the funds raised will be used to outfit our flexible, mixed-use workshop space with large, sturdy worktables and stools (so we can host more of you at once!), to install good lighting, and to purchase additional tools and materials so we can develop a wider range of workshops. We want our new home to be welcoming, bright, and comfortable for everyone. Ikea is great and all, but we’d like to create something really special and reflective of our industrial roots.
What’s in it for me? Perk up!

Besides our eternal heartfelt gratitude, we’ve got a great collection of perks for those who contribute to the campaign. Scroll through the list at right for more details, but we think there’s something for everyone.
<ul>
<li>
For the locals :: We love Inman and so do you! Grab some of our special-edition, newly-designed Inman Square postcards and prints while they last.
<li>

For the paper enthusiasts :: Our new retail store will delight any paper lover with a curated collection of artisanal paper goods, desk accessories, prints, craft supplies, and so much more. Pick up some discounted gift certificates.
<li>

For the makers :: Fancy trying your hand at modern calligraphy? Need to brush up on your etiquette and letter writing skills? What about some book arts? Ever wanted to print your own stationery? Now you can! Check out our discounted workshop pass, personalized Vandercook experience, or VIP private event.
<li>
For the note writers :: Get up close and personal with our letterpress process for some custom note cards, note writing kit, or a collection of our decorative note sets.
<li>
For the marrying types :: Thinking about bespoke letterpress wedding invitations or save-the-date cards? We’ve got your back! And at a special price.
<li>

For the do-gooders ::  For every $500 in referral contributions we will donate $100 worth of cards and supplies to Rosie’s Place in Boston and The Women’s Center in Cambridge for their arts empowerment initiatives supporting women in need.
<li>
For everyone :: If we exceed our goal, a portion of the extra funds will go towards supporting more free events in our space, opening up creative opportunities to our whole community.
Risks and Challenges

Starting any new venture is hard: learning new systems, overcoming challenges in financing, managing the seasonality of retail, growing a brand. Fortunately for us, we have twelve years of experience and company growth behind us. While we’ve never run a retail store, per se, we’ve built out and merchandised our products at international trade shows for over a decade
column2: our team members have all worked at countless craft fairs and expos and engaged directly with our customers
column3: we’ve worked with retail buyers on the flip side as a wholesaler, and connected personally with other artists and craftspeople throughout the stationery and gift industries.

column1: The multi-faceted nature of our expanded business will help us balance the seasonality of all of our different services. A slow time for wedding invitations may be a busy time for the store, and vice versa. We feel as well-prepared for this adventure as anyone could be.

So why reach out to our friends, family, and community? We have big dreams for our space but a limited budget. The amount we’re trying to raise does not represent the entire cost of our move or expansion and we are committed to this next step regardless of the success of this campaign. However, with our community’s support, we can make Albertine Press the best it can be - something we can all share in and grow together.
Spread the Word!

For the past twelve years in our current studio in Union Square, Somerville, we have cranked and clanked away on our antique presses to print over 40,000 wedding invitations and announcements, and over 250,000 greeting cards, note cards, postcards, calendars, fine art prints, and other paper delights for customers and stores across the country and around the world.

If we’ve touched your life, if you’ve ever bought or received an Albertine Press greeting card, if we helped you celebrate life’s momentous occasions with our invitations and announcements, we hope you’ll consider supporting us again, either by contributing to our campaign or spreading the word to others. Either way, we’ll see you soon in Inman!
xo
Shelley &

AGARAK is going to be a unique pet friendly center, a dreamplace for you &
column2:
your pets, with huge opportunities of leisure activities and more.

While enjoying your time with your four legged friend, you’ll make your contribution in helping yet another stray animal.

Story of AGARAK

The love for nature and animals has deep roots in our family. We have been educated as a true nature child, having deep affection for all our surrounding beauty.

We couldn’t stay indifferent to stray and abandoned animals. Since 2014 we are actively involved in animal welfare, we have rehomed 192 stray dogs.

Being owner of 5 lovely rescued dogs, our family has elaborated AGARAK project, which is going to be a unique recreation and entertainment center, will provide diverse opportunities for leisure, active and passive recreation and many more other services.

Why AGARAK?

We often face a situation, when our pets are not welcomed in public places. Our pets are part of our lives and the path we walk together should be fan and rejoicing.

Another disadvantage of urban life is that we are disconnected with nature, which can cause stress, depression and mood disorders. Nature is an important source of our health, we can always find comfort and calm in the company of woods and animals, and reset our brains.

The lack of green areas and the fact that the overwhelming majority of parks in our city are not pet friendly compelled us to create a green and happy corner for ALL.

AGARAK will be a center for fostering a harmonious lifestyle with nature, resulting healthy thinking and well-being.  

AGARAK will welcome nature lovers
column3:
children and adults, individuals and families. The center will take care of your needs as it will suggest:

Pet hotel with swimming-pool: Pet hotel will have comfortable rooms in a facility, which will be located in the park with playground and swimming pool. Your pet will benefit from all mentioned and will enjoy his/her vacation, while you are enjoying yours.

Pick-up &
column4:
pet daycare services: You can leave your dog at AGARAK for a day or you can order the whole service, which includes pick up, daycare and drop off.

Pet friendly anti-café: Pet friendly anti-café for diverse events, anniversaries, parties and many more other occasions. Will include kitchen, open and closed facilities, chairs, tables, sofas, piano, guitar, poufs, other.

Pet friendly co-working space: Co-working space will include comfortable chairs, tables, sofa and access to WI-FI. You will have the opportunity to prepare lunch in the anti-café’s kitchen.

Park with a playground: Will include dog tunnel, jumping obstacle and a ramp.

Rehoming center for stray animals: Dog’s Place is our rehoming center, which currently shelters 40 dogs, until they are adopted. After the center’s construction we’ll be able to shelter and ensure proper care to over 80 dogs.

Our training and entertainment programs will include:

Training programs for children and adults: Children are the future of our society. Educated children are the guarantee of healthy society with high sense of responsibility. We targeted young students for our training programs, although we would welcome adults to join our interactive courses.

Inclusive programs: The center is for all. Kanis therapy is one of wonderful examples of the humane animal connection.

Healthy Nourishing: Food is the most important part of our everyday life. In AGARAK, we will be highly attentive to food and so, we will arrange interactive cooking events in the kitchen.

Physical activities and yoga: We will provide open space for different physical activities and yoga. The view is stunning, air is fresh.

The entire revenue of the center will be allocated to the needs of stray animals.

How to support?

Our family with the help of other donors has raised $ 32,173 and $ 9,278 has already been spent. In addition, $ 22,895 is planned to be addressed to the purchases and construction.

Total budget of the project is $ 63,302.

With your support, we can complete the project. We are missing $ 31,129.

We are accountable for every cent spent on the project. For updates, please review UPDATES section on Indiegogo or visit our Facebook page www.facebook.com/dogsplacengo.

You can learn more about donors as well on our FB page.

AGARAK community

With the help of our supporters and volunteers, we have arranged the clean up, partially built the wall for our rehoming center and planning a big tree planting event.

By connecting people with nature, we aim to create strong community, which will grow and deepen its roots of well-being, and give blossoms of harmony and love.

Become part of AGARAK community and let your pet be part of happy pet society.

Since 2016 Rosalind Bakery has lovingly produced naturally leavened breads - sourdoughs, baguettes, and other crusty goodness - for the coastside community. We distribute those loaves to local grocers, restaurateurs, and our farmer's market booths with our own delivery van. Unfortunately, our van has made its final delivery and now we must secure a replacement.

Our focus is to open the doors of our new bakery and retail space fully prepared to offer our customer base all they have come to expect of us, and more. Replacing our delivery van is a top priority, and we need your help!
Who Are We?

Simply, we are bread nerds! We are a dedicated group of bakers and managers on a journey to supply the coastside with outstanding crusty breads and other baked goods. A combined 20+ years of baking experience provide the baseline knowledge for perfecting our hearth oven breads, and experimenting with interesting new products.
<ul>

• Founder Matt Kosoy spent nearly twenty years in the tech industry designing Web sites for a variety of clients before he began baking as a hobby in 2015. Since late 2016 he has dedicated himself full-time to establishing Rosalind Bakery, and fostering growth from a nano bakery based in his house into a full-blown retail/wholesale bakery. Originally from Philadelphia, Matt loves to surf and bake bread.

• Bread Manager Tony Voorhees joined Rosalind after spending nearly two decades as a graphic designer and web developer. In late 2017, Tony joined Matt to help him on his quest to change the world, one loaf at a time. Since then, he has been instrumental in establishing Rosalind Bakery's production. Tony loves making bread and spending time with his family.

• Pastry Manager Camila Moura has recently moved from Brazil where she has been learning and practicing the craft of baking since her teenage years. Here, in Pacifica, she's been leveraging her talents to support multiple local small businesses.  Camila is a wizard in the kitchen.

• General Manager Meredith Newkirk joined the team in early 2019 after managing daily operations of a local cafe for several years. Prior to that she lived in Washington D.C. where she had spent 12+ years as a government contractor, and 5 years tending bar. In 2014, Meredith and her husband loaded their young son, dog, and cat into a RV and spent three months exploring the country before landing in Pacifica.
How Can You Help?

Our goal is to raise $40,000 which will go directly toward the purchase of a brand new Rosalind Bakery delivery van. Achieving this goal will afford us the exact vehicle we need to hit the ground running!

We have a wide variety of perks with products and experiences that offer a little something for everyone - from gift cards to a bread-making class offered by founder Matt Kosoy! Plus, San Francisco based artist, Chris Gallen, crafted a limited edition poster, custom tote bag, and stickers in SF Giants-themed colors especially for this fundraising drive!
Why Should You Help?

We love our coastside community! Nothing excites us more than having the opportunity to expand our product lines and widen our customer base, but we need the means to get that product to you! By donating to this effort, you can be assured that 100% of your contributions will go toward the purchase of our delivery van.
Every bit of our customer support is valued, and we understand that not everyone is able to contribute monetarily. Please share our campaign with family, friends, and neighbors alike!
