Kitty Dreams

Hi! I'm AJ and I'm the main human behind this cat cafe project. I have 3 cats of my own and I like to think of myself as a ""totally sane cat lady."" I worked in veterinary medicine for years and now I work as a Registered Nurse at a local hospital, but I've always wondered how I could merge the two fields to help more cats while making a difference in people's lives as well. That was until about 3 years ago when I visited my first cat cafe and realized it was possible to combine cats, coffee, and community into one amazing space for all to enjoy. I'm so excited to bring this dream to St. Pete and can't wait for you to experience it, too!

The SKC mission is simple: contribute something special to this amazing city while saving all the cats! The thing is, I'm just a regular person with a big dream, and I know I can't do this alone. It's going to take a village to get this fully off the ground and that's why I'm asking for your help. Each and every one of you reading this right now plays a huge role in making this cat cafe a reality for St. Pete!
Cat Cafe? Catfe? What??

If you're new around here, you may be super excited about this ""cat cafe"" thing everyone keeps talking about, but are still secretly wondering, ""What exactly IS a cat cafe??"" No worries! It's a common question and we don't mind explaining:

The Catfe is a unique cafe experience, adding the element of cats to the typical coffee house setting. Customers can enjoy locally sourced beverages and treats while relaxing in the company of adoptable cats acquired from our rescue partner, Friends of Strays Animal Shelter. The 'Cat Lounge' is a separate space within the cafe area and provides a relaxed, home-like environment where guests are able to interact with the free-roaming kitties who live there until they get adopted.
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/P5b4tiyJpoI?autohide=1&amp
The Ultimate WHY: The Impact
For the Cats!

Thousands of perfectly healthy cats and dogs are euthanized each year due to shelter overcrowding. Sunshine Kitty Catfe’s primary goal is to help ease shelter overcrowding and promote rescue animal adoption while providing a stimulating, cage-free foster home for cats to live in while awaiting adoption. Sunshine Kitty Catfe is proudly partnered with Friends of Strays Animal Shelter and through this unique platform we aim to help more homeless and abandoned cats find the loving forever homes they deserve.

The Catfe will provide adoptable cats the socialization and exposure to potential adopters that they may not necessarily receive in the traditional shelter setting. Customers will have the opportunity to spend as much time as they wish with the cats in a relaxing environment where they will be able to see each cat's true personality. This atmosphere will foster stronger bonds with the cats, leading to more successful adoptions, decreasing adoption returns and re-homing efforts, and reducing euthanasia rates by allowing the shelter to take in even more homeless and stray cats in our community.
For the People!

Our second goal is to be of benefit to humans, too! It is scientifically proven that spending time with cats reduces stress, decreases blood pressure, and promotes the release of endorphins in the brain that make us feel happy. It has also been shown that the frequency of the vibrations from a cat’s purr can promote healing within the body. People who already own cats, people who are not able to have cats where they live, and people looking to adopt a new cat will all benefit from the Catfe. Not only will customers have a new space for socializing and working, but it will be good for their health as well! Sunshine Kitty Catfe will be enhancing the well-being of both the cats and the community.
<h2>What We Need &amp

We've acquired a beautiful space in the Grand Central District of downtown St. Pete, but there's still a lot of work to be done before Sunshine Kitty can open its doors and we can cuddle all the cats. The next big steps include major renovations of the space, acquiring appropriate permitting and licensing required by the city and state, and then ""catification"" of the Cat Lounge so the kitties have the most ameowzing space to live and play in until they get adopted!

Your generous donations will go towards these substantial costs that we'll incur in the coming months as we approach the home stretch of opening St. Pete's first cat cafe. It's been a long time coming and you, SKC tribe, should be rewarded! That's why the backer perks were created with YOU, our community, in mind and we want the final end product that is Sunshine Kitty Catfe to reflect that.
Timeline

All backers will receive updates on our progress including permit approvals, construction happenings, perk fulfillment, sneak peek and opening dates, and more. As of right now, our anticipated grand opening date is in October!
<h2>Risks &amp
Fundraising:

Our space has so much potential and we want to make Sunshine Kitty an amazing experience for everyone, so that's why we're asking for your generous donations to help us make that happen! Since the Catfe will serve food and drinks (did we mention beer and wine??) while also housing cats, our space will require major renovations in order to meet very specific city and state building and health code regulations. Though our goal may seem like a lot at first glance, it's not because we're being extravagant, it's because this is a huge project and we need to hire professionals to do most of the renovations for us.

If we do not meet our fundraising goal, this would likely delay construction, which ultimately delays the grand opening of the Catfe. The key is to reach and exceed our goal so we can create the best space possible for the kitties as soon as possible!
Permitting:

Our renovation plans must be submitted to the city of St. Petersburg for approval before we can get started on the actual construction. Obtaining permits can sometimes take upwards of 3 months, especially since St. Pete is booming right now and there are so many projects going on in the area. Currently, our goal to open is mid-September of this year. In the meantime, we are working with an awesome, trustworthy contractor team who has already begun the process of drawing up our building plans and should have the final draft ready to submit to the city for approval soon. We also have contacts at The Greenhouse, an amazing resource for small business development in St. Petersburg, and they will help us to expedite the permitting process wherever possible.

The good news is that the City of St. Petersburg Zoning Department has already given us the green light for zoning approval to use our acquired space as a cafe serving beer and wine while also housing cats!
Other Ways You Can Help
Sometimes, despite how much you wish you could donate, you just can't and we totally understand. But, there are still ways you can help!

1. Share, Share, Share, Share, and Share some more!! Tell your friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, mail carrier, librarian, barista, hair stylist and anyone else you can think of about our project. Whether they're local or live on the other side of the country, every mention of our mission helps! Social media share links are at the top of this page!

2. Donate your time. Do you perform a service that you think could help us out as we get closer to opening? (examples include cleaning, painting, interior design, landscaping, creating custom artwork, etc) Please let us know! We mean it when we say that Sunshine Kitty Catfe is powered by community!
","Kitty Dreams

Hi! I'm AJ and I'm the main human behind this cat cafe project. I have 3 cats of my own and I like to think of myself as a ""totally sane cat lady."" I worked in veterinary medicine for years and now I work as a Registered Nurse at a local hospital, but I've always wondered how I could merge the two fields to help more cats while making a difference in people's lives as well. That was until about 3 years ago when I visited my first cat cafe and realized it was possible to combine cats, coffee, and community into one amazing space for all to enjoy. I'm so excited to bring this dream to St. Pete and can't wait for you to experience it, too!

The SKC mission is simple: contribute something special to this amazing city while saving all the cats! The thing is, I'm just a regular person with a big dream, and I know I can't do this alone. It's going to take a village to get this fully off the ground and that's why I'm asking for your help. Each and every one of you reading this right now plays a huge role in making this cat cafe a reality for St. Pete!
Cat Cafe? Catfe? What??

If you're new around here, you may be super excited about this ""cat cafe"" thing everyone keeps talking about, but are still secretly wondering, ""What exactly IS a cat cafe??"" No worries! It's a common question and we don't mind explaining:

The Catfe is a unique cafe experience, adding the element of cats to the typical coffee house setting. Customers can enjoy locally sourced beverages and treats while relaxing in the company of adoptable cats acquired from our rescue partner, Friends of Strays Animal Shelter. The 'Cat Lounge' is a separate space within the cafe area and provides a relaxed, home-like environment where guests are able to interact with the free-roaming kitties who live there until they get adopted.
The Ultimate WHY: The Impact
For the Cats!

Thousands of perfectly healthy cats and dogs are euthanized each year due to shelter overcrowding. About 3 Bug Farm

At 3 Bug Farm, we grow organic produce for stores, restaurants, and farmstand patrons in our local community.  When we bought the land that would become our farm in 2013, the fields were awash with dragonflies, swallowtail butterflies, and lightning bugs.  We vowed to farm the land in such a way that these insects and their cousins would always have a healthy home here.  Over the last six years, we've built our house, our farm, and had three bugs of our own.
Why a Better Farmstand?

When we erected our small farmstand in 2015, we expected to get a few visitors per day at best.  We didn't realize how much our neighbors would value having a nearby source of organic produce!  The traffic we've been getting at our stand has overwhelmed the driveway and parking lot that we inherited from the Christmas tree operation that used to be our farm.
What We're Trying to Do

We're looking to raise $10,000 to help improve our farmstand.  While we've already purchased the building, we still need to run power to it, expand the driveway and parking lot, add landscaping, and finish out the interior of our washing and packing area.  When we're done, we'll have a farmstand that more people in our community can access more easily, a new sign, as well as better produce storage, cooling, and display.
What We'll Give You
<ul>
• The first 40 people to invest $35 can get a limited edition 3 Bug Farm T-Shirt.
• For every additional $100 you provide, you have the option of claiming $105 in 3 Bug Bucks, which you can use just like cash at our stand.  The Bucks have no expiration date.

• If you like, you can choose to donate some or all of your investment to local food pantries.  We'll contact our local food pantries, find out what they need, and grow food that be donated in place of your 3 Bug Bucks.

BELOVED FRIENDS AND SUPPORTERS OF THE MAJESTIC,

As you may know, The Majestic is the only queer bar, venue, and kitchen in Western Massachusetts. With the outbreak of COVID-19, we have had to indefinitely close our doors. At this moment, which is filled with uncertainty for us all, the future of the bar is in jeopardy, not to mention the livelihoods of those of us who create and run the space day-to-day.

We have put so much love and time into creating this community space, and would love to continue playing out our dreams and all of yours on the other side of this pandemic. Now, we ask for your support and shares and love so we may get there together!

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We are seeking to raise $28,000 to cover lost revenue and tips, pay our rent, bills, and staff during the closure of Majestic and be able to open again with healthy bank accounts and staff once it is safe to do so. In the spirit of transparency, we would like to note that $28,000 is a lowball estimate of the monthly cost of the business functioning above the red and the workers who make that happen earning something like a living wage. Right now, we are forced to close for at least 2 months (through at least May 4).

Stay tuned for possible perks of donating, we are still working out how exactly to navigate that through this uncertain time, as we do not yet know how long this will actually last. In addition to fundraising, we are preparing to sell gift cards and creative merch to support ourselves during this period. Nonetheless, our main goal is to see all of your shining, gay faces upon reopening - to continue to create queer space together through glittery conversation, poetry readings, being in community under our moody pink lighting, dance parties, mutual aid, drag shows, fundraisers, karaoke, dungeons and dragons meet-ups and more. Your support will keep this dream alive.

The Impact

Northampton is an LGBTQ2IA+ epicenter of New England and The Majestic is currently the only explicitly queer-identified venue in our region. We are both a community space and a small business -- growing but nonetheless precarious -- lacking the resources to get through this indefinite closure on our own. We simply do not know the lifecycle that COVID-19 will take in the world at-large and our community, specifically. There is no sugarcoating the effects the circumstances of COVID-19 will have on our future.

We started this project because we believe in the importance of queer spaces and the joy, safety, and security that they can provide to members of our community. We want to be able to keep this mission alive and see it grow on the other side of the COVID-19 outbreak. If you have the resources or ability to share and want to see queer spaces sustain themselves, your support will make this possible.

Risks and Challenges

At The Majestic, we have prided ourselves on being both a community-oriented small business and a local cultural resource. We have attempted to raise consciousness and funds around various issues, from indigenous land defenders to cash bail funds to trans asylum seekers and local labor efforts. Dance parties have been a major channel through which we have accomplished these ends and also been the most significant source of revenue for the bar. To put it bluntly, weekend dance parties are what keep Majestic running, both culturally and financially.

Given the imperative for social distancing, our business model will likely have to change when we do reopen. Even if we are able to open in some capacity in the Spring, we can’t imagine it feeling responsible or safe to have a dance party until at least the Fall, depending on how things play out. This poses another risk for the business going forward. We offer this in the spirit of transparency to those offering their resources to keep the bar afloat, and in a spirit of curiosity: what would you like to see us do at Majestic while we weather this storm? What sorts of events and efforts would you like to see us attempt? How can we collectively continue this project of opening queer space without its functional and existant financial base? We’d love to hear from you at majesticnoho@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that these times are difficult for everybody, especially immunocompromised folks, those whose health has been affected by this outbreak, our elders, those who lived through the AIDS epidemic, our peers in the service industry, freelancers, makers and small business communities. We also know that there are many funds and organizations that need support in this time - please check out our instagram and website linked below to find others organizing and seeking resources, as well as to find info and updates. If you can’t financially support this campaign, consider asking your wealthy lesbian aunt in Seattle to! That home-owning bear you love in Provincetown! Your tenured queer studies professor from Smith! Post about us online! Send us a sweet message on Instagram! We promise, we’ll be thinking of you, too. If you need a cause boosted, please send it our way as we would love to post it for you. 

In solidarity and community,

THE MAJESTIC CREW

Short Summary
Who We Are:
We are dog lovers, dog owners and entrepreneurs at heart with a passion for working and connecting with great people.

Furball Fitness has been servicing lovely humans and their dogs throughout the greater Bay Area for over 7 years now, and we're pleased to be bringing the same great mission and service to the North Loop in Minneapolis (slated to open in August 2020).

Minneapolis-based owners, Dani and Lindsay DiMeglio are excited to share their vision and start the next chapter of the beloved Furball Fitness story – Minnesota style.  To do so, the pair is opening up a new modern,  convenient, top-of-the-line doggie daycare facility in the heart of the North Loop, bringing together all the amenities you and your fur babies look for in a home away from home.  Rest easy while you’re at work, need a break, or just simply want to get your dog some exercise with pals.  They’ll be in good hands with us at Furball Fitness MN.
About Furball Fitness:

Furball Fitness Dog Camp and Daycare is a cage-free indoor dog park / daycare facility specializing in daily, supervised ""play-care"". Staff members are dedicated to maintaining a safe space for your pups to feel comfortable, socialize and have a ball!

One of the special things about Furball Fitness is that we are purposeful in maintaining an intimate environment. You will develop a good rapport with all of our handlers, and your dog will have that same consistency in knowing who they are hanging with on any given day. We also strive to keep the pack as consistent as possible, giving your dog the opportunity to develop lasting friendships.

With our large 3,000+ square foot indoor/outdoor facility in the heart of the North Loop, we're providing the flexibility, convenience and familiarity you’re looking for while offering up ample space for the dogs to play, observe, rest, and whatever else they like to do.  To preserve this relaxed environment and to maintain a good dog-to-human ratio, we will assign small groups of dogs to each handler per session.  Finally, because you will know each and every one of your dog’s caretakers personally, this private format helps to build a reliable, communicative, and intimate relationship and experience that is so important to us.

Your dog will exercise, socialize, and become well-adjusted creatures of the community!  Our hands-on staff will also work and play with your pup 1-on-1 throughout the day to keep him or her engaged and comfortable within the pack environment.
Furball Fitness MN will also feature seasonal pet-related goods and services for the convenience of our customers, with a focus on locally sourced products hand-picked by our staff.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We are looking to raise a minimum $15,000 to help us create a first-class facility with first-class staff for you and your pet to feel at ease every day all day. With the money we raise on Indiegogo, we will able to add and improve our existing and future services with the following:
<ul>

• Dog Lounge and Play Equipment – We want the best blocks and ramps for your dogs to play on while giving those that love to nap, a cozy space to do so.  Plus they’ll love all the pets from our staff on the cozy couches during rest time.
• Outdoor dog play space and lounge area

• Easy payment and booking system with an online portal for all of your customer needs. This would also allow us to take and share pictures throughout the day and add them to your pups report card. Plus a one-stop-shop for making reservations, tracking your payments and packages, add or modify vaccination records and make/view notes related to the care of your buddy.
• Special agility flooring to help keep their joints and bodies happy and healthy!  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going.
Other upgrades we’re considering include
<ul>
• Full and/or self-service onsite grooming
• Proper IT equipment for curbside check-in to help expedite pick up/drop off services
• Pet Shuttle!  For your full-service pick up / drop off concierge
• Upgraded play equipment
Why we're different:
<ul>
<li>
Dog Camp  Environment – playtime and socialization in a 3000+ sqft. indoor/outdoor dog area. Partially turfed, with plenty of fun activities and furniture to make the dogs feel right at home.
<li>
<strong>Hands-On Attention &amp
column2: Training – preserve consistency in your home training by utilizing pre-established commands
column3: in addition, fine-tune manners and other skills, like off-leash recall.

column1: <li>
Small Play Groups, Large Play Area(s) – safety and comfort in keeping a maximum capacity
column2: no more than 20 dogs per staff member. Just the right amount of dogs. Just the right amount of energy. Just the right amount of space with plenty of room to roam. We’re not trying to build a doggie empire over here with hundreds of dogs circling through each day. Furball Fitness MN is deliberate in staying intimate with the goal of servicing each and every one of you to the best of our ability.

column1: <li>

Lasting Friendships and Enhanced Socialization Skills – experienced staff who develop a personal relationship with you and your dog. No revolving door of walkers. We’ll build trust. You’ll know your dog’s caretaker well.
<li>

No Crates – because we cap group sizes and have plenty of space, no crates are utilized. The puppies treat the indoor dog park as their own backyard – run around and rumble OR sprawl out and lounge.  Totally cage-free!
The goal of Furball Fitness today is to provide an integral service and experience for the communities in which we are located, one that is paramount to everyday life.

With your help, we hope to fulfill this mission alongside our close friend and founding member, Sheri Villa, by opening this new stellar location in the North Loop of Minneapolis – building a community around our common love of dogs!
<h3>Risks &amp

As you all know, this is a very risky time to start a business, but after more than 8 months of planning and searching for the perfect space, we couldn't just walk away.   We value our community and our future customers, and would love nothing more than to be able to deliver everything you and your pup could ever dream of when it comes to the perfect daily hangout spot.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help spread the word! Any and all support is GREATLY appreciated.

We are dog lovers, dog owners and entrepreneurs at heart with a passion for working and connecting with great people.

Furball Fitness has been servicing lovely humans and their dogs throughout the greater Bay Area for over 7 years now, and we're pleased to be bringing the same great mission and service to the North Loop in Minneapolis (slated to open in August 2020).

Minneapolis-based owners, Dani and Lindsay DiMeglio are excited to share their vision and start the next chapter of the beloved Furball Fitness story – Minnesota style.  To do so, the pair is opening up a new modern,  convenient, top-of-the-line doggie daycare facility in the heart of the North Loop, bringing together all the amenities you and your fur babies look for in a home away from home.  Rest easy while you’re at work, need a break, or just simply want to get your dog some exercise with pals.  They’ll be in good hands with us at Furball Fitness MN.
About Furball Fitness:

Furball Fitness Dog Camp and Daycare is a cage-free indoor dog park / daycare facility specializing in daily, supervised ""play-care"". Staff members are dedicated to maintaining a safe space for your pups to feel comfortable, socialize and have a ball!

One of the special things about Furball Fitness is that we are purposeful in maintaining an intimate environment. You will develop a good rapport with all of our handlers, and your dog will have that same consistency in knowing who they are hanging with on any given day. We also strive to keep the pack as consistent as possible, giving your dog the opportunity to develop lasting friendships.

With our large 3,000+ square foot indoor/outdoor facility in the heart of the North Loop, we're providing the flexibility, convenience and familiarity you’re looking for while offering up ample space for the dogs to play, observe, rest, and whatever else they like to do.  To preserve this relaxed environment and to maintain a good dog-to-human ratio, we will assign small groups of dogs to each handler per session.  Finally, because you will know each and every one of your dog’s caretakers personally, this private format helps to build a reliable, communicative, and intimate relationship and experience that is so important to us.

Your dog will exercise, socialize, and become well-adjusted creatures of the community!  Our hands-on staff will also work and play with your pup 1-on-1 throughout the day to keep him or her engaged and comfortable within the pack environment.
Furball Fitness MN will also feature seasonal pet-related goods and services for the convenience of our customers, with a focus on locally sourced products hand-picked by our staff.
What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a minimum $15,000 to help us create a first-class facility with first-class staff for you and your pet to feel at ease every day all day. With the money we raise on Indiegogo, we will able to add and improve our existing and future services with the following:

Dog Lounge and Play Equipment – We want the best blocks and ramps for your dogs to play on while giving those that love to nap, a cozy space to do so.  Plus they’ll love all the pets from our staff on the cozy couches during rest time.
Outdoor dog play space and lounge area

Easy payment and booking system with an online portal for all of your customer needs. This would also allow us to take and share pictures throughout the day and add them to your pups report card. Plus a one-stop-shop for making reservations, tracking your payments and packages, add or modify vaccination records and make/view notes related to the care of your buddy.
Special agility flooring to help keep their joints and bodies happy and healthy!  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going.
Other upgrades we’re considering include
Full and/or self-service onsite grooming
Proper IT equipment for curbside check-in to help expedite pick up/drop off services
Pet Shuttle!  For your full-service pick up / drop off concierge
Upgraded play equipment
Why we're different:
Dog Camp  Environment – playtime and socialization in a 3000+ sqft. indoor/outdoor dog area. Partially turfed, with plenty of fun activities and furniture to make the dogs feel right at home.
Hands-On Attention & Training – preserve consistency in your home training by utilizing pre-established commands
column2: in addition, fine-tune manners and other skills, like off-leash recall.

column1: Small Play Groups, Large Play Area(s) – safety and comfort in keeping a maximum capacity
column2: no more than 20 dogs per staff member. Just the right amount of dogs. Just the right amount of energy. Just the right amount of space with plenty of room to roam. We’re not trying to build a doggie empire over here with hundreds of dogs circling through each day. Furball Fitness MN is deliberate in staying intimate with the goal of servicing each and every one of you to the best of our ability.

column1: Lasting Friendships and Enhanced Socialization Skills – experienced staff who develop a personal relationship with you and your dog. No revolving door of walkers. We’ll build trust. You’ll know your dog’s caretaker well.

No Crates – because we cap group sizes and have plenty of space, no crates are utilized. The puppies treat the indoor dog park as their own backyard – run around and rumble OR sprawl out and lounge.  Totally cage-free!
The goal of Furball Fitness today is to provide an integral service and experience for the communities in which we are located, one that is paramount to everyday life.

With your help, we hope to fulfill this mission alongside our close friend and founding member, Sheri Villa, by opening this new stellar location in the North Loop of Minneapolis – building a community around our common love of dogs!
Risks & Challenges

As you all know, this is a very risky time to start a business, but after more than 8 months of planning and searching for the perfect space, we couldn't just walk away.   We value our community and our future customers, and would love nothing more than to be able to deliver everything you and your pup could ever dream of when it comes to the perfect daily hangout spot.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help spread the word! Any and all support is GREATLY appreciated.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Minneapolis, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/furball-fitness-minneapolis/pica

What's Happening?

We're a truly classic drive-in theatre that has been bringing you movies under the stars for 66 years.  Who doesn't love a double or triple-feature with family and friends?  You've told us that you'd love to come more often.  Since movies require a two week minimum run, we need a second screen to make that happen.

We've been working on this project for a couple seasons now.  Most of the infrastructure is in place, but some unexpected issues (think plumbing, electrical and structural) with the original 1953 building has taken most of the budget we had in place.
With two screens, we'll be able to offer a more balanced mix in terms of ""family"" and ""mature"" films, and open new ones almost every week.  More Screens, More Movies, More Drive-In Nights!
You Can Help!

Some of our great fans have generously suggested crowdfunding as a way to reach this expansion goal quicker.  We love our role as caretakers of this historic institution.  Our mandate is to preserve a classic experience and feel while maintaining relevance and viability for generations to come.

Your contribution will enable us to finish our Screen 2 expansion and get you enjoying more drive-in nights much sooner.  We've allocated a large portion of the proceeds from the past few seasons to this project and most of the infrastructure we need is complete.

We know we'll get there eventually, but just a little extra push now and we're good to go!  At this point, we need to build a screen, buy another projector and do some earthwork.  Besides engineering the screen, nothing requires approval, so if we can fund it, we can do it!
Why Are We Asking For Help?

Our customers are the reason we love what we do.  Many voices these days would have you believe nothing's like it used to be, the world is colder, busier, it doesn't know how to slow down.  That's certainly not what we see here.  We see people making new lifelong friends as they chat before showtime.  We see smiling happy people enjoying the simple pleasure of movies under a perfect sky.  We hear crickets and laughter.  The combination is nothing short of tonic for the modern soul!  We get to enjoy this every night and we think you'll see the value in being able to enjoy it more often.

column5: >What If...?

column1: ...we don't reach our crowdfunding goal?  We'll keep going with our single-screen as usual, no problems there, we'll be here so long as people love going to the movies!  And we'll continue with our project step by step until we get there.
Other Ways You Can Help
We certainly understand if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Share with everyone you know via the Indiegogo share tools!
• Join our social media pages and share those too!
• Most importantly, visit us often and enjoy a night at the drive-in whenever you can!

Hello, hello!

Lion's Tooth is a start-up bookstore café specializing in small press books and graphic novels. We started this Indiegogo campaign before the coronavirus crisis hit, but we're not giving up our dream to have a storefront in Milwaukee.

column2: >

column1: Our goal is to offer high-quality comics and books for kids and adults, and to provide Milwaukee with a unique cultural hub and gathering place.
We've been holding pop-ups since the fall of 2019 and recently launched our book and graphic novel subscription service, which we are now promoting with this campaign :)
What we want: a home in Milwaukee
The funds raised through our subscriptions will help finance our brick-and-mortar location. We need your support as we take the huge step of opening our storefront.

We are planning a bookstore café with a busy event calendar including story time, book clubs, art exhibits and music shows. Lion's Tooth will be a magical space for people of all ages. We want to become your favorite place!
What you get: amazing care packages

All our crowdfunding efforts are based on our subscription program. Every month we curate a selection of books and comics, and feature artists who create zines and treats specially for our care packages.
Getting a subscription is the best way to support our vision because:
<ul>
• It puts us in the business of offering awesome books and graphic novels
• It allows us to support artists by commissioning and featuring their amazing work
• It builds community through our book clubs
Here's what you get with each care package:
<ul>
• A new release (book or graphic novel)
• Something fun from a featured artist (like a zine or a print)
• Lion's Tooth mini zine with information about what is in the package
• And we also pack some cool swag, such as cards, stickers, magnets, you name it!
These are the types of subscriptions available:
<ul>
• Kids subscriptions (graphic novels or illustrated books) - choose the age group: up to 7 years old,  8-12 years old or 13+ years old.
• Adults subscriptions - choose the type: graphic novels, non-fiction books or music books curated by Milwaukee Record.
We need more subscribers! The financial goal of this campaign is roughly the equivalent of 100 six-month adults subscriptions, including taxes and shipping.
The ladies behind Lion's Tooth
Lion's Tooth is a partnership between Shelly McClone-Carriere and Cris Siqueira.
<ul>

• Shelly McClone-Carriere is one of the founders of the Riverwest Co-op. She was a board member from 2002-2012, manager from 2001-2018 and bookkeeper since 2003. She is currently the School Café coordinator at Highland Community School, working with middle schoolers to develop skills that include planning the menu, budgeting and preparing meals for students, teachers and family members. Shelly's passion for books and community is at the heart of what Lion's Tooth stands for.
<li>

Cris Siqueira is a Brazilian-born American citizen living in Milwaukee since 2004. She owned a bookstore  specialized in ""comics as art"" in São Paulo, and has translated over ten graphic novels to Portuguese. In 1997, Cris interviewed some of the most important American cartoonists, like the Hernandez brothers, Daniel Clowes, Chris Ware and Dame Darcy, and published an award-winning compilation that introduced their work to Brazilian readers. For the last couple of years she has been revisiting her favorite artists, and these conversations are being published in the Milwaukee Record and in Lion's Tooth website.
Other ways you can help
<ul>
• Please consider making a cash contribution to this campaign to help us achieve our goal
• Come to our monthly pop-ups at the Sugar Maple in Milwaukee
• Sign up for our newsletter on our website
• Like us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter
• Subscribe to our YouTube channel
• Spread the love

column2: >Thank you for supporting Milwaukee's newest bookstore!

column8: >Several years ago a Canadian traveler ventured to Jamaica on holiday.

column1: This traveler went off the beaten path and into the heart of Jamaica.
Despite Jamaica's natural beauty and rhythmic culture, there are many
areas entrenched in poverty and crime.  This visit led to years of
volunteering and shipping donations.  In 2013, this tourist decided that
enough was enough with the donations, simply addressing an immediate need, not the underlying issues.  The most sensible solution was to establish a community
empowerment centre.
column5: >Mission Statement

column1: safe, inspiring, learning environment that fosters respect, self-development,
work skills and life opportunities for all.

column5: >To enhance the quality of life by promoting self-sufficiency thereby reducing poverty, illiteracy and crime through positive and sustainable

column1: empowerment that will strengthen the individual, family and community.
The Sampson Shore CEC will provide coaching, teaching and support through skills training to marginalized citizens. The programs offered will provide an opportunity for individuals to learn

skills and trades while building self-confidence.  The CEC programs are as follows: masonry, carpentry, sewing, cooking, fishing, candle-making, soap-making, farming, horticulture, computer basics, reading,writing and mathematics.
House of Faith
The CEC will be based around a small house of faith by the sea. The CEC will give back to those who cannot help themselves, namely children and the elderly. The
construction on this building has already begun.  The landscaping has begun. Temporary buildings have also been erected to serve the construction development.
order to see the completion of this CEC and implementation of programs
column2: your support, through in kind donations, financial support and onsite volunteer work, is needed.   We welcome volunteers during the construction phase of the CEC and later during the implementation of  the programming. The CEC also welcome material donations (construction materials, FF&amp
column4: B, seeds, toiletries, linens, etc) and financial donations.

column1: The Georgian House B&
column2: B provides sleeping accommodations and breakfast, available to individuals or groups who want to volunteer their time to the CEC or want to holiday in a community setting.   Additional meals and travel expenses are not included.  Proceeds from the B&amp
column3: B goes back into the community and the CEC.  60 guests capacity for adults 18 years and older.  The CEC is an alcohol and drug free community facility
column4: possession and /or consumption on the property is prohibited at all times.  Illegal activity is also prohibited on the propety at all times.  Any guest, client or volunteer in violation of these restrictions will be required to leave property immediately.

Shore CEC, traveled from Jamaica to Toronto, Canada to put together a team that will create the architectural, landscape and program design for the CEC, that will fulfill the mission statement.
A team of s

from Ryerson University, York University, University of Toronto and George Brown College have come together to meet this challenge.  These students have backgrounds in the following fields: architectural design, landscaping design, social
media, technical design and program development.

column1: <div style=""font-weight: bold
<div style=""font-weight: bold
I
know I am not the first to take this path in life
column2: serving people, and I know  I won't be the

column1: last. To assist a community high in needs and low in assets comes with various challenges and  also incredible joy.  Firstly,  I had to accept that I cannot simply 'fix' everything , but I could help them, to help themselves.   Secondly, I cannot do it all  myself
column2: I need partners, volunteers and collaborations.   Lastly,  I would face setbacks
column3: but I will meet them, learn from it, and continue to move forward.

column1: There
are many folks out there who want to do something meaningful in their lives
greater good of those less fortunate. However, due to circumstances, or timing or perhaps other commitments,  it is not always possible to do
so.  Regardless, when the opportunity presents itself and the need is real
and dire, we all have it in us to render assistance to those in need. in some capacity. It
does not mean that everyone can give up everything they have and commit to a
third-world country, as I have. It is not for everyone and it is not without sacrifice.  If we all just took a moment and contributed in some, small way, add our own little piece to
the bigger puzzle, it will make a difference.   Through unconditional kindness and sustainable social change, we will lower crime, destitution and illiteracy, in Jamaica.
We are all one family, one people, and we need to help each other whenever we
can.
The Jamaican people have a beautiful and hopeful saying,
""Lit'l lit'l  nuf nuf""
meaning,  little by little there will be enough.
Sampson Shore CEC will
be that little piece in a bigger picture, to one day be enough.
-W.M. Irving

Vision StatementTo enhance the quality of life by promoting self-sufficiency thereby reducing poverty, illiteracy and crime through positive and sustainable

The Sampson Shore CEC will provide coaching, teaching and support through skills training to marginalized citizens. The programs offered will provide an opportunity for individuals to learn

skills and trades while building self-confidence.  The CEC programs are as follows: masonry, carpentry, sewing, cooking, fishing, candle-making, soap-making, farming, horticulture, computer basics, reading,writing and mathematics.
House of Faith
The CEC will be based around a small house of faith by the sea. The CEC will give back to those who cannot help themselves, namely children and the elderly. The
construction on this building has already begun.  The landscaping has begun. Temporary buildings have also been erected to serve the construction development.

The CEC also welcome material donations (construction materials, FF&E for B&B, seeds, toiletries, linens, etc) and financial donations.

column1: FOR MATERIAL DONATIONS PLEASE CONTACT: sampsonshore@gmail.com
Georgian House

The Georgian House B&B provides sleeping accommodations and breakfast, available to individuals or groups who want to volunteer their time to the CEC or want to holiday in a community setting.   Additional meals and travel expenses are not included.  Proceeds from the B&B goes back into the community and the CEC.  60 guests capacity for adults 18 years and older.  The CEC is an alcohol and drug free community facility

column1: Landscape Design
Our Team
The Founder of Sampson
Shore CEC, traveled from Jamaica to Toronto, Canada to put together a team that will create the architectural, landscape and program design for the CEC, that will fulfill the mission statement.
A team of students

from Ryerson University, York University, University of Toronto and George Brown College have come together to meet this challenge.  These students have backgrounds in the following fields: architectural design, landscaping design, social
media, technical design and program development.
Several Toronto businessmen have also stepped up to support the CEC by providing storage facilities,donations of building materials and collaborations in program development.
In Negril, Jamaica there is a small, local construction crew, landscapers and security in place. These workers have brought the CEC to its present development, thus far.

HI my name is Glen and I am age 32.

I ended up on the streets after a bad upbringing at the age of 14. I only had 2 choices, sleep rough or go into social care. I had already put myself in social care when I was 12 and had a bad experience, so I decided to sleep rough, keeping my head down so not to be found and forced to go back to my parents.

I had to keep hidden till the age of 18 when I started selling the Big Issue in Bath. By that time I was used to sleeping rough and had acclimatised to the outdoors. Since then I have travelled the UK selling the Big Issue and busking.

I have never claimed benefits and do not intend to.

I HAVE A PLAN

I cannot live indoors since I have spent too long sleeping rough. I have recently managed to open a bank account with the help of the Big Issue foundation and have started saving towards a boat and outdoor catering business.

Initially I am trying to raise £3500, this will get me a bare shell and an engine which I can work on to make my home.

If you would like to help me reach my goal PLEASE BUY THE BIG ISSUE and follow me on Twitter and Facebook.

Many thanks

Glen

Aider un enfant au Vietnam

                                                           English Version below

""Les
Enfants Du Dragon"" est une O.N.G française et agréée par les autorités
vietnamiennes.
L’association, elle a été fondée, en
2009, par Marc DE MUYNCK et son ami BUI HUY Lan. Marc est le porteur du présent projet
(http://marcopolo1949.skyrock.com/),
âgé de 66 ans , il est bénévole humanitaire au Vietnam où il réside depuis 2007 pour
se consacrer aux actions de l'ONG.
Objet et missions de l’association : Aider
les enfants abandonnés ou orphelins - Lutter contre la précarité des plus
démunis - Soutenir des orphelinats et des écoles pauvres - Apporter de
l’eau propre à des villages ou des écoles - Lutter contre la malnutrition des
populations en détresse
Le
grand projet"" de l'ONG est de construire un centre d’accueil pour enfants
abandonnés ou orphelins à Cần Giuộc.
Les objectifs globaux de ce projet sont : Education,
développement personnel, et insertion dans la société Vietnamienne d’enfants
défavorisés, orphelins ou abandonnés
Comment soutenir l’association
L’aide
que vous pouvez nous apporter peut prendre différentes formes:
- En devenant membre actif (Voir ici)
- En parrainant un enfant (Voir ici)
- En faisant un don : (Voir ici)

- Par le partenariat ou le mécénat .

Nous faisons appel à votre générosité pour trouver les 20% manquant au budget nécessaire à la construction... Avec tous nos remerciements pour votre soutien.

Site Web de l'association : http://lesenfantsdudragon.com/

Des vidéos ici,

et des photos ici.

and his vietnamese friend BUI HUY Lan. Marc is the project leader (http://marcopolo1949.skyrock.com/),
66 years old, he is humanitarian volunteer in Vietnam where
he lives since 2007 to dedicated
himself to the actions of the
NGO.
Purpose andmissionof the association: Helping abandoned children  or
orphans - Fight against vulnerability
of the poor among the poorest - support
orphanages and poor, or rural, or urban schools - Providing clean water to villages and schools - Fight against malnutrition populations in distress.
The ""big heartproject"" of the NGO is to build a shelter for abandoned children and orphans in  Cần Giuộc, Long An
Province, Vietnam.
The global objectives of this project are: Education, personal
development, and <strong>integration into

Your Local Green Party needs Your Help

With the 2015 General Election now only 4 short months away, the Banbury and Cherwell branch of the UK Green Party are planning a full raft of events and publicity initiatives to get our message out there to you, the Banbury Constituency voters.

The Banbury Constituency also includes Bicester and many surrounding areas.  Check online to see if this includes your area.

We Need Funds To Fight For You

There has never been a more urgent need for a Green presence in UK politics. So many national and local issues in Oxfordshire and Banbury, Bicester and Cherwell are specifically addressed by the Green agenda. 

Not just local issues such as the environment, flood defence and social housing need, but national concerns such as the NHS, social care and the fight against the damage being wrought by cuts to local services and the continuation of unnecessary austerity measures.

Only the Green party offers alternative policies to those of the three grey parties and we are fielding Ian Middleton as your Green Party Parliamentary candidate in the General Election on May 7th, as well as many candidates in the local elections which will be held on the same day

We Need Financial Support

Unfortunately, UK and national politics is now driven by money just as
much as by the dedication of volunteers and members.
We're fighting
this election in an arena where other parties have large funds to draw
on for campaigning activity.  The more we have in the kitty, the more we
can do to compete against this on a more level playing field.

The Green Party doesn't take donations from large corporate investors or companies.  We don't want to have our local or national representatives in the pockets of large corporations who are looking out for their own interests.  We're only interested in representing ordinary individuals in Westminster and in local government.

Our primary source of funding is our own revenue raising activities such as boot fairs, quiz nights and small private donations.  We're the only national party that operates like this and it means we will always be free to fight for issues and individuals with no one breathing down our necks.

We're Not Asking For Millions!
In the context of the multi-million pound budgets that our opponents
have to call on, our resources are tiny.  But what we lack in cash we more

than make up for in enthusiasm and drive.

However, just £1000 extra added to our election fighting chest will enable us to print more leaflets to get our message out there at this key time.  It will pay for locations for public meetings and events to involve our ever growing number of local members. 

If you live within the Banbury Constituency, please pledge whatever you can afford to help us

Other Ways You Can Help

Please also consider joining us as a member or volunteer.  As the fastest growing national party in the country you'll be in good company.  You can do as little or as much as you like.  The Banbury and Cherwell group also have monthly meetings which you'd be welcome to attend.

If you don't want to be formally involved that please pledge a few pounds to our cause this year by supporting this Indiegogo campaign or simply by sending us a donation.  You can find links to our national and local websites and social media pages below.

Thanks in advance for your support

Ian Middleton
Parliamentary Candidate for the Banbury Constituency

Promoted by John Haywood of 1, Queens Road, Banbury, OX16 0EB
on behalf of Ian Middleton and the Banbury and Cherwell Green Party

column5: letter-spacing: 0px
column8: >My goal has always been to keep my own costs as low as possible so that I can pass on the cost saving to our clients.  With the help of eBay and every bargain I can find, I have built a small datacentre to help us provide great private cloud services, email and website hosting to local small business. We also provide IT support to home users and repair laptops and PCs.

column1: <div><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: letter-spacing: 0px

column1: Now I need your help:

The problem with buying second hand hardware is that it can sometimes fail unexpectedly.  Our Uninterruptible Power Supply (aka UPS) has stopped working, which is quite an important piece of equipment. It helps to protect all of the systems if there is a power failure, and reduces the risk of any serious damage happening.

We've had it just over two years, and fed it some brand new batteries not too long ago. Running without the protection it gives is very scary. Because of this, I have been holding back on  expanding the range of services I offer, which leads to a catch 22 situation - I can't save up the finances to buy a new UPS without offering some new services, but I'm concerned about deploying the new services without the protection of a UPS.
That's where you come in.

Think of the number of times we waste £1.00 and have nothing to show for it. If enough people gave me that £1.00 it would make a real difference to my business. In return I'm offering my services and expertise for just £1.00.
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column5: line-height: 30px

column1:
• I'm asking for your support in raising £6500
  • Your contribution will be used to purchase the UPS unit itself, the electrical equipment needed to connect it to our systems, and the services of an electrician to have it installed
• Once funded, we aim to have everything installed and running within 1 month from funding completion
<ul>
• In return I'd like to offer contributors some of our services for free
• The greater contribution, the more we'll try to do to help you and your business
We can offer:
<div>
<ul>
• Web Hosting
• Email Services
• VoIP Telephony
• Secure Data Storage and Backup
• PC and Laptop Repair
• Networking and Business Systems Support
Check out our website at http://www.echo77.com for more information on the services we offer.
Because each individual need is unique I haven't put together a series of packages - instead I'd like to work with each contributor to come up with a tailored service.
If we're not able to support you free of charge, we'll definitely work with you to come up with a suitable and attractive discount package.
The Impact
A brand new UPS would give reassurance that our systems and clients data will be safe if there is a power failure, and enable me to offer you some cutting edge services.
The advantage of a brand new piece of equipment compared to another second hand unit is the warranty and service support provided by the manufacturer.
We are ready to deploy a new generation of private cloud services to help you manage your own web and email hosting services, along with self-service VoIP and backup systems.
We will also be launching a new web hosting service website once we are able to get our new UPS installed.
Plus, a more modern unit will require less monitoring and maintenance which frees up me and my technicians to provide you with even more IT support.
Challenges
Incase we do not reach our goal, we'd like you to have a choice on what you would like to do with your contribution.
We can either arrange for you to have a refund, or we'll keep it in the pot to help us save up to buy the unit.

If you choose for us to keep your contribution, we'll be in touch to talk about providing you with our services. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I recognise that some people are in a similar situation and just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
• Tell other people about our great IT services for small businesses and home users too
• If you can help in any other way, please get in touch - we'd love to have your support, and to support you!

Please use the share buttons on the left hand side to share this with your friends, family and colleagues if you think they might be interested. 

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for your support!

","Hi! I'm Chris, director of echo77.

I've always been interested in how everything works and everything technology related, so I started working with computers as soon as I could when I needed a Saturday job. After working in IT with some big enterprises and absorbing every bit of knowledge possible, 15 years later I now run my own IT business.

I gave up a fulltime job and started echo77 in 2013 to provide simple, sensible technical support to other small business locally around me so that they could focus on their busineses without having to be an IT guru at the same time.  My small startup is doing well, and I re-invest everything into improving the systems and services we can offer.

My goal has always been to keep my own costs as low as possible so that I can pass on the cost saving to our clients.  With the help of eBay and every bargain I can find, I have built a small datacentre to help us provide great private cloud services, email and website hosting to local small business. We also provide IT support to home users and repair laptops and PCs.
Now I need your help:

The problem with buying second hand hardware is that it can sometimes fail unexpectedly.  Our Uninterruptible Power Supply (aka UPS) has stopped working, which is quite an important piece of equipment. It helps to protect all of the systems if there is a power failure, and reduces the risk of any serious damage happening.

We've had it just over two years, and fed it some brand new batteries not too long ago. Running without the protection it gives is very scary. Because of this, I have been holding back on  expanding the range of services I offer, which leads to a catch 22 situation - I can't save up the finances to buy a new UPS without offering some new services, but I'm concerned about deploying the new services without the protection of a UPS.
That's where you come in.

Think of the number of times we waste £1.00 and have nothing to show for it. If enough people gave me that £1.00 it would make a real difference to my business. In return I'm offering my services and expertise for just £1.00.
What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for your support in raising £6500 Your contribution will be used to purchase the UPS unit itself, the electrical equipment needed to connect it to our systems, and the services of an electrician to have it installed
Once funded, we aim to have everything installed and running within 1 month from funding completion
In return I'd like to offer contributors some of our services for free
The greater contribution, the more we'll try to do to help you and your business
We can offer:
Web Hosting
Email Services
VoIP Telephony
Secure Data Storage and Backup
PC and Laptop Repair
Networking and Business Systems Support
Check out our website at http://www.echo77.com for more information on the services we offer.
Because each individual need is unique I haven't put together a series of packages - instead I'd like to work with each contributor to come up with a tailored service.
If we're not able to support you free of charge, we'll definitely work with you to come up with a suitable and attractive discount package.
The Impact
A brand new UPS would give reassurance that our systems and clients data will be safe if there is a power failure, and enable me to offer you some cutting edge services.
The advantage of a brand new piece of equipment compared to another second hand unit is the warranty and service support provided by the manufacturer.
We are ready to deploy a new generation of private cloud services to help you manage your own web and email hosting services, along with self-service VoIP and backup systems.
We will also be launching a new web hosting service website once we are able to get our new UPS installed.
Plus, a more modern unit will require less monitoring and maintenance which frees up me and my technicians to provide you with even more IT support.
Challenges
Incase we do not reach our goal, we'd like you to have a choice on what you would like to do with your contribution.
We can either arrange for you to have a refund, or we'll keep it in the pot to help us save up to buy the unit.

If you choose for us to keep your contribution, we'll be in touch to talk about providing you with our services.    Other Ways You Can Help I recognise that some people are in a similar situation and just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
Tell other people about our great IT services for small businesses and home users too
If you can help in any other way, please get in touch - we'd love to have your support, and to support you!

Please use the share buttons on the left hand side to share this with your friends, family and colleagues if you think they might be interested.   And that's all there is to it. Thanks for your support!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Your support – it means the world and not just to us
Anchor &
Moisturiser is a high-quality, all natural product which is great for
all skin (inked and un-inked alike) and also ticks all the environmental and ethical boxes! It contains no alcohol, no parabens
(preservatives), no colours, it's vegan, 100% natural and it isn't tested on animals (because animals

are awesome and we love them).

The ingredients work to soothe and smooth skin, and with ongoing use you'll find that your skin is better than ever. You won't look like a greased up body-builder, but people will definitely ask you what you're using to make your skin glow (and your tattoos pop)!
column2: >There's 3 parts to the range:

column1: <li>
<strong>Bare
Bones – an unscented version for those with extra sensitive skin
<li>
<strong>Mother’s
Ruin – a fresh scent containing eucalyptus and mint (yes, it works)
<li>
<strong>Fleet St
Barbershop – evokes an old fashioned shave with juniper berry and sweet
orange.
It's a product that lots of people will love if they get a
chance to try it.
<h2 style=""font-weight: bold
We've got some pretty great perks to help sweeten the pot. There are cool stickers
for your car/guitar/bike/walls, discounts for our web store, tote bags, limited edition (WRAP certified) campaign
t-shirts as well as the opportunity to join our High Rollers Club for exclusive
deals, sneak peeks and the possibility of being a tester for any new
products we develop. That’s the sort of experience that money can’t buy (except
that in this case it totally can!!!).
column2: >And of course you can <b>get your own bottle

column1: of Anchor &amp
column2: Bliss oil moisturiser (or more than one!). Your skin and your tattoos will

column1: thank you.
column2:
>

What we need and where the money will go

We’re keeping our initial goal low - $7500 will cover about half of our first production run and if we have to pony up the rest then we will, because we believe in putting our money where our mouth is.

We'll fulfil the perks and the rest will go into manufacturing and product insurance (which we have to have). There aren't any other business expenses that we can't cover ourselves, this is all about getting the product to market. 

Our manufacturer has minimum product runs of 500 units, with three variants that means we have to produce 1500 units initially and we have to make sure we have the right insurance in place. 

To put this campaign into perspective against our own investment, we've already spent well over $7500 in setting up the business (graphic design, formulation, accountants and lawyers ... the list goes on)!

by their bodies and their looks.

products differently for men and women. These identical products were then
priced according to what the manufacturer thinks the market will tolerate – the
net effect being that someone always ends up paying more for an equivalent
product.

the ground up. Anchor &amp

<h2 style=""font-weight: bold
Hi we’re Anchor &
Bliss, although in our everyday lives we just go by Andy and Bec.
Andy is a web designer

who’s currently also studying graphic design. Punk rock got him interested in politics, gender issues and DIY. He has duct-taped many things back together. He's run small businesses in the past so knows how important it is to keep an eye on the details.
Bec is a creative writing
major with a flair for self-expression, both in her writing and in her

personal style. She's passionate about finding ways to address inequality and make positive changes in the world. Bec has worked in admin for multi-million dollar agencies and coordinated communications campaigns for NGOs.
Together we like to walk our
dog, drink craft beer and cook tasty food. We're generally happiest with a
project and both dream of the day when we no longer have to answer to ‘the
man’.  We would both like more tattoos.
That’s why we started Anchor &
column2: Bliss - the idea that we needed a really great product for our skin and our ink. We've been working on this idea for nearly a year now – testing and refining our product, building our website, getting on

column1: with social media and looking into ethical and environmentally friendly ways to
run our business.
<h2 style=""font-weight: bold
Anchor &

opportunity for us to build a business from the ground up, the way a business should be built. We want to prove that you can make high quality products that don't exploit people, animals or the environment and at the same time keep those products available at a reasonable price. It's our way of saying ""Look, this is how it can be done"".
Thanks for

your support – it means the world and not just to us.

","Your support – it means the world and not just to us
Anchor & Bliss Oil
Moisturiser is a high-quality, all natural product which is great for
all skin (inked and un-inked alike) and also ticks all the environmental and ethical boxes! It contains no alcohol, no parabens
(preservatives), no colours, it's vegan, 100% natural and it isn't tested on animals (because animals

are awesome and we love them).The ingredients work to soothe and smooth skin, and with ongoing use you'll find that your skin is better than ever. You won't look like a greased up body-builder, but people will definitely ask you what you're using to make your skin glow (and your tattoos pop)!There's 3 parts to the range:
Bare
Bones – an unscented version for those with extra sensitive skin
Mother’s
Ruin – a fresh scent containing eucalyptus and mint (yes, it works)
Fleet St
Barbershop – evokes an old fashioned shave with juniper berry and sweet
orange.
It's a product that lots of people will love if they get a
chance to try it.
What you get
We've got some pretty great perks to help sweeten the pot. There are cool stickers
for your car/guitar/bike/walls, discounts for our web store, tote bags, limited edition (WRAP certified) campaign
t-shirts as well as the opportunity to join our High Rollers Club for exclusive
deals, sneak peeks and the possibility of being a tester for any new
products we develop. That’s the sort of experience that money can’t buy (except
that in this case it totally can!!!). And of course you can get your own bottle
of Anchor & Bliss oil moisturiser (or more than one!). Your skin and your tattoos will

thank you. What we need and where the money will goWe’re keeping our initial goal low - $7500 will cover about half of our first production run and if we have to pony up the rest then we will, because we believe in putting our money where our mouth is.We'll fulfil the perks and the rest will go into manufacturing and product insurance (which we have to have). There aren't any other business expenses that we can't cover ourselves, this is all about getting the product to market. Our manufacturer has minimum product runs of 500 units, with three variants that means we have to produce 1500 units initially and we have to make sure we have the right insurance in place. To put this campaign into perspective against our own investment, we've already spent well over $7500 in setting up the business (graphic design, formulation, accountants and lawyers ... the list goes on)!
The impact

It is important for Anchor & Bliss to be part of a movement that equalises men and women rather than playing them off against each other for the most profit – your contribution can be your way of saying that you believe things can be done better.Let’s face it, tattooing and alternative culture can be a bit
of a boys club. We felt while looking at tattoo websites and at existing
after-care products that women (tattooed and otherwise) are portrayed in an
overly sexualised way – reinforcing a wider stereotype that women are only defined
by their bodies and their looks.
We also noticed a trend of packaging essentially identical
products differently for men and women. These identical products were then
priced according to what the manufacturer thinks the market will tolerate – the
net effect being that someone always ends up paying more for an equivalent
product.
We're doing this thing right, from
the ground up. Anchor & Bliss is:
vegan, and 100% natural
paraben and parfum-free
run on 100% green power,
using recycled and recyclable materials,
only selling sweatshop-free clothing and merch
That's just our starting position.
By supporting our

campaign you’re saying ‘hey, this tattoo was freaking expensive, I better take care of it if I want it to look good when I'm 80’ but you're also standing up for environmental and human rights. All by making your skin nice and your tattoos pop. Wow! Risks & challenges
We've learned
while working on Anchor & Bliss that there are always unexpected
challenges but we've met each challenge by putting our heads down and working until we've overcome it.
We have the business experience and support structures in place to make this happen. Other ways you can help
If you
can't contribute financially to our campaign, we totally understand. But if you
think that what we’re doing here is worthwhile there’s still plenty you can do
to help us out! Please, share this campaign – people value the endorsement of a friend, so by telling your friends about our
campaign you’re doing us a massive favour! Indiegogo even provides handy share tools to
make it super easy for you to spread the word.

Andy is a web designer

who’s currently also studying graphic design. Punk rock got him interested in politics, gender issues and DIY. He has duct-taped many things back together. He's run small businesses in the past so knows how important it is to keep an eye on the details.
Bec is a creative writing
major with a flair for self-expression, both in her writing and in her

personal style. She's passionate about finding ways to address inequality and make positive changes in the world. Bec has worked in admin for multi-million dollar agencies and coordinated communications campaigns for NGOs.
Together we like to walk our

That’s why we started Anchor & Bliss - the idea that we needed a really great product for our skin and our ink. We've been working on this idea for nearly a year now – testing and refining our product, building our website, getting on
with social media and looking into ethical and environmentally friendly ways to
run our business.
What this means to us
Anchor & Bliss is an

It's our way of saying ""Look, this is how it can be done"".

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3> My name is Barry Kresge, Jr.  My ambition is to become one of the five
commissioners this coming November.  Like you, I care about where I live and I
would like to play an integral part in helping our community grow stronger and
brighter for all residents of today and tomorrow.  Below, I would like to
address a few issues that I would fiercely attempt to accomplish with the
support of the township residents.
FIRST:  I propose we put aside a percentage of
the income we receive from the casino to start a ""Rainy Day Fund.""  The current
board of commissioners bought new DPW equipment, trucks, police cars and other
items that the township needed.  But in turn, cost the township a significant
amount of dollars.  We as a township receive a formidable amount of dollars each
year from the casino.  I would like to put those dollars toward projects that
may prove to be beneficial to residents.  The township made ends meet before the
casino.  The extra cash flow should be used to improve our community, make it
safer and a more desirable place to live.
Second:  I propose we revise and potentially
change out recycling program.  Right now, Plains offers curb side pickup only
once a month.  Or, we can drop off recycling at the DPW, yet this is
inconvenient for many of us.  As such, even Saturday hours are difficult to make
when we lead such hectic lives.  Many households try to recycle as much as
possible.  But we find some months we don't have enough space to store all of
the recyclables.  I would like to convert to two recycling pickups a month
(every other week), and switch to single stream recycling.  This would allow
residents to put everything in one container and have it picked all at the same
time.  This plan has the potential to save the Township money relative to
manpower hours and fule making our recycling greener simultaneously.  Also, the more recycling the township takes in and takes to get recycled.  The more money it brings in.
Third:  I want to spruce up our neighborhoods
throughout the Township, by giving our roads more attention and potentially
adding sidewalks where that improvement is needed.  Along with other measures,
the ""Rainy Day Fund"" would play a key roll in financing these and other long and
short term projects.
I would like to thank you very much for your time.  I thank you in
advance for your support in this upcoming election day.  Without your vote I
can't proceed to make proposals related to making changes for the better.
Help make these ideas a reality and help take back the Township from
one party rule!!!  Financial support is greatly appreciated as your budget
allows!!  Every dime will be invested to achieve short, intermediate and long
term goals.  I kindly request your support to begin to enact positive changes.
Support can be mailed to:
I look forward to seeing you around town, chat with me Talk.Engage to
change!  Let me know your thoughts.
Warm
regards,
Barry Kresge, Jr.
Paid for by the Candidate

Hitch Hiking is Dangerous-even if you use an app!

Illegal app base companies have started operating in Florida. These drivers do not get a fingerprint background check like real taxi and limo drivers do. They use their personal car insurance, and their commercial insurance is only in effect when their app is on:

  • The Florida Limousine Association supports legitimate companies &
column2:
drivers
  • They are valued at $40 Billion and they operate here illegally.
  • We need your contribution to Stop Unlicensed Activities

    • With $40 Billion you they should play by the rules. South Carolina , Nevada, Oregon, Thailand, China,and Spain have banned them while professional drivers are being force out of business by part time amateur drivers, Story's about
column5: background-color: initial
column6:
>sexual abuse and assaults against their passengers gets worse every day. 

We need your monetary support to stop them.

We are a non profit pro business association:

  • We have hired lobbyists and attorneys as well as a PR company. We are working with every local taxi and limousine association in our state, as well as all of the National Associations. Our goal is to educate lawmakers about their destructive technology, and substandard insurance.
  • Our companies have apps too and 24/7 REAL COMMERCIAL INSURANCE.
  • Not some Peek-a-Boo insurance that's only there when the apps on!

The Impact

We are working at the City, County and State level, to make the truth known. Your contribution will go along way toward protecting the riding public from these e-gypsies.:

  • Don't let them steal your customers and your business!!  Fight back now.
  • Cease &
column7: Desist order in Palm Beach,Orlando Airport &amp
column8:
Broward Counties.
  • Your livelihood is at stake. How much is your business worth?

    • Risks &
column9:
Challenges

We are out numbered, and out gunned. They have more money then we will see in ten lifetimes. But we can win this battle if we stick together and if everyone chips in.  We can and will achieve our goal.

  • This is just another dot on the map to them, but this is our home.
  • Join us in the fight!! Together we will make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Call you elected officials and tell them you want a level playing field!

And that's all there is to it.

Salutations fellow Steampunk enthusiasts!

We're a small band of ladies in the great state of Alaska who wanted someplace to show off our bustles, and rub elbows with well dressed ladies and gents.  We come from various backgrounds with a love of all things Steampunk!  What better criteria for putting together Alaska's first Steampunk convention. With your help, we can expand our repertoire of panels, vendors, and activities.

Most of our con com have worked at other conventions in the past.  We each have a unique area of expertise to bring to the table, which makes this project a sure success!

We need $2,000.00 to secure the venue, which will allow us the space we need to run dirigible races, tea duelling, mustache contests, and a Grand Promenade. 

100% of the funds we raise will be used to pay for this year's
convention expenses.  Because this is our first year, members of the convention committee have paid
for expenses, so far, out of pocket.  Funds will be used to reimburse
them, then we'll continue paying for convention necessities directly out
of donations.  The convention committee is strictly volunteer and no
one receives a paycheck, or extra reimbursements.  Any additional funds
we raise will be placed in the coffers for next year's convention

expenses. 

In return for your generosity we've got some lovely, one of a kind, hand crafted incentives up our sleeves. There are a limited number of these gifts available, so you're encouraged to donate early!

Can't donate as much as you'd like?  We've all been there. We appreciate anything you can do to help us out. 

We could use your help to spread the word!  Like your Facebook page... https://www.facebook.com/AlaskaSteamposiumPage
Mention us on Twitter. 
Pin our website on Pinterest. www.alaskateamposium.com
Make your way to this year's convention.
Make plans to visit the Last Frontier for next year's convention!
And don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tools.

Thank you so much for everything!!

Warmest Regards,
Alaska Steamposium ConCom:
Tess Purvis, Beatrix McCormick, Darlene Heisserer, December Fields-Bryant, Akira Merrick, and Kelly Bailey
