Rod &
column2: Lorraine are both entrepreneurs.  We are both passionate about our community and the love of craft beer. We'd like to utilize Oregonian's love of craft beer to give back to our community in the form of ""Keg for a Cause"". We will donate a portion of our profits to local Columbia Gorge Non Profits on a rotating basis.  By contributing you will help a multitude of worthy non profits!

column1: We've leased a great spot in a historic building in downtown Hood River.  We will offer 30 taps of constantly rotating craft beer.  We'll serve pints in house and gladly fill a growler with any beer of your choice to go.
Our space is comfortable, yet industrial.  Enjoy a seat upstairs on our loft, at a large community table, the bar or at our windows watching our great community buzz by.

We are approximately 19% short of having enough cash to close our loan. Together we can help our local non profits and enjoy great craft beer from all over the country and world!!

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

The money you pledge will go toward the build out of our cooler and tap system. Our funds and the funds from  MCEDD (Mid Columbia Economic Development District) will be used for furniture and operating expenses.

column1: We need $20,000.00 to close our loan.  MCEDD has approved our loan as long as we meet our cash commitment of $40,000.00.  We are half way there.  We're looking forward to your pledges!!
Our perks include all include beer related items.
Custom T-Shirts, Hoody's, Stickers, Beer Pouches, Growlers, Pint Glasses, etc.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

If you can't contribute monitarily, you CAN still help:

  • Get the word out via social media and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

The intention
and the most important strategy of this project is based on the production, mainly
the production of the club managed varieties of apples.
We plan to implement the production
technology on the area of approximately 3 ha. It is a M9 (EMIX) ground base
(rootstock) – production technology and the working process on apple plantation
in a very dense framework.
The predicted varieties on prepared
ground give the fruit of consistent quality of taste, size and color and they
have the highest percentage of yield of the 1st class.
Planting material is of high quality and
it gives yields during the first year, it will be procured from established
companies.
Production features of the orchard on the
base M9:
Growing form:   slender spindle bush
Planting distance:   3,2x0,50m
Feeding area per tree:    2,8m2
Base (rootstock) of fruit seedlings:    M9
Number od seedlings per ha:    6250
To achieve
optimal quality and finally the ultimate cost of the final product in the
production, we will be able to produce apples of the following characteristics:
-  optimal
layout
-  excellent
internal values
-  balanced
relationship between sweetness and acidity
-  optimal
production for long term storage
Technology investments per hectare, which
consist of planting materials, irrigation system (drop by drop) with specially

Am I The Only One...
who hates it when the party is crackin' and they hear those 7 awful words ""Who can drive? We are out of beer?"" Obviously I can't, I can't even count the number of words in that sentence.
Am I the only one who hates it when the kids are asleep and can't bring themselves to sink to the level it would take to wake them up at 12:30 am and go to the liquor store?
Am I the only one who hates it when they get home from work, takes their pants off THEN realize they're out of whiskey?

Well, those frustrations (and many others) led to the idea of The Booze Runner. Why can't I just open up an app and order a 12 pack, handle of Jack and a pack of smokes? That's what The Booze Runner will do. We will be the best app in the on-demand liquor delivery business.
The Booze Runner exists for the purpose of:
Providing the fastest liquor delivery service,
for a profit, whereby the customer is our most valued asset.
Assisting the communities in our market place
by offering an alternative to drunk driving.

In addition to providing a delivery service, The Booze Runner will donate a portion of our profits to charities that help victims of alcohol abuse.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Breaking it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking to raise $15,000 in this round of funding. As part of our process to get started we need to pay for some legal council and  start the design of our app.

column1: • Do you have enough tee shirts? Me neither. As a perk for donations of $100 or more we will send you a limited edition tee shirt for The Booze Runner in the size you request! For a $50 contribution you will get a mid-weight plastic 16oz cup with The Booze Runner printed on it! Got a bunch of money to invest? We set up perks in this round of funding to offer equity in the company! You can actually join The Booze Runner team and make this dream part of your reality!

• If we don't reach our full goal, we will use the money first for the design of the app. If we aren't at least 60% of the way to the legal fees, the remaining money we raise will be donated to a charity that helps the victims of alcohol abuse. If we are close to the goal for the legal fees we will hold that money until we can make up the difference.

The Impact

The guys behind The Booze Runner can't raise the total capital we need unless we can show investors that we already have something.

  • Getting the design of the app done helps us narrow down our start up capital because then we will know exactly how much the app will cost.
• Forming a legal entity will also help legitimize us in the eyes of our future investors.

• The bottom line is, if you contribute to this campaign you'll be helping us achieve our dreams. We are both husbands and fathers and we want to be able to provide as much as possible for each of our families. Everyone who contributes to this campaign will forever have a place in our hearts.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

This campaign is just the start for The Booze Runner. We have several more steps, and more money to raise to turn this dream into a reality.

  • The two partners behind The Booze Runner have an action plan to raise the rest of the capital The Booze Runner will need to launch.

column1: • We have meetings set up with small independent investors.  Good thing we have lots of gift cards to outback so we can afford to wine and dine all these people!
• We have a very detailed business plan and a clear plan of action once we raise the funding we need. Your help is very much appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please share the link on your social media account, and tell your friends!

• Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    • From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for taking the time to read this!

Dear Visitors and Friends!

Thank you for visiting my project page. I ask only a few minutes of your time. I have 3 main ideas. For each of them I tried to raise money. Attempts ended in failure.
Maybe because of my bad English, maybe for other reasons.

My ideas are:
- Crowdtroubleshooter - site-platform, where some people would help solve the problems of others
column2: - Network of Our Souls - future bestseller - book about the spiritual network of people and the ability to communicate without technical facilities
column3:
- ""The Heart of the World"" International Center - the creation of large international spiritual and business center.

This time I decided to create a page where I want to raise funds for all three projects. Details of each of them you can read by following links. I will not describe again. I know that each of you is a wise person and see the appeal of these ideas.

I want to emphasize only the reasons that may encourage you to support my ideas.

1. Each donor will participate in the distribution of profits from projects.

2. Each donor can join the team and influence the decision on the projects.

3. Does not matter - you donate $ 1 or 1000 dollars. Of every donor we will contact and consult.

4. Implementing ideas should benefit a huge number of people around the world.

This time, I'm sure - projects will be supported. So I thank in advance all donors.
You are wonderful. Suppose you work principle - who gives - they get!

The money raised for KidStrongNC will be used to pay for children who can't afford the program or 5K's, for outdoor and indoor equipment, tower gardens, children's books focused on health, healthy snacks that are provided for every session, print outs and paper cost, props for demonstrations, Family Fun Days, crafts and more! 
I am so excited and believe in this program wholeheartedly! Thank you for wanting to create a healthy and active upcoming generation! Every child deserves the chance to lead a healthy and active life!

I have started my business, KidStrongNC, with the hopes to reach all children and families in my community and educate them on a healthy lifestyle. Childhood obesity is at a rise, and if we do not start teaching children about the importance of exercise and healthy eating now, then they are at risk to becoming overweight as young as two! Right now, one out of five preschool aged children are considered obese. Seventy percent of these children continue to have weight issues throughout adulthood.

I have been in schools for over twelve years, six years in pre-school and six years in public schools (kindergarten through second grade), and I see how childhood obesity affects children daily. I'm ready to change this with KidStrongNC!
KidStrongNC will collaborate with schools in our
column2: >community and set up days and times for me to come and teach the children.
column3:
> My program is mapped out into 3 twelve week periods. Every session includes at least 30 minutes of fitness/exercise while the other 30 minutes will include a hands-on lesson in hygiene, health, a farm-to-table project, rewards for positive character traits and more!

Chauncey Gardens needs your support!
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2:
>As you know by now, last week we had our new van and all our new tools stolen. Hopefully the van insurance will be enough to buy a new van but the tools were not yet insured - it is costing £3500 to replace them, and I doubt the insurance company will give us what we paid for the van.

We will also be buying insurance for the new tools, and a top-of-the-range steeringwheel lock for the replacement van!

column1: What We Need &
• We think the theft will leave us about £5k down, nearly all the company profits for the year so far.
• Friends and family have suggested we do this crowd-funder to help ease the blow a little. Help right a wrong!
• Whatever you can give will be much appreciated. (there is a PayPal option) The many kind people can outdo the few evil people who stole our van.
<li>

As the recipients of charity we pledge to do one charitable job per year going forward. Please let us know if there are any worthy causes, maybe a pre-school or hospice that needs help with their garden?
column5: height: 217px
column8: >(Ben doing his bit for charity with the ice bucket challenge)

column1:
The Impact

  • It was very painful to have the fruit of our hard work and graft taken from us. In the game of snakes and ladders that is life, we hit a long snake - and someone literaly stole our ladders.
• We were just getting ahead, we had invested all our profits into the equipment we need to forge a prosperous future, and it was all taken away in one foul swoop.

• Friends and family have been super supportive, offering loans of tools and vans (Skippy, Nick, thanks guys!), and giving moral support at what was already a dificult time for me emotionally. Some cash too sure whould help ease the pain and help us build a bright future.
• No matter what we will pick oursevlves up and soldier on, but a little help would be great!
• Our new tools will be insured and marked with our company name, they will have SmartWater tags to make re-selling harder and recovery easier.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there are more deserving and needy causes than ours, but we are a good bunch just trying to do our best and we've had a big set-back, if you want to help a little that's wonderful.

  • Please let your friends know about us and share our web site www.chaunceygardens.co.uk
• You can like our facebook page -  I'm going to be posting regularly with fun and interesting horticultural/environmental stuff as well as Chauncey pics and projects.
We are great at what we do! We provide skilled garden maintenance and lanscaping with innovative design at affordable rates, all with environmental conscientiousness at the forefront.
<li>
PS I'm not joking about the calendar: (check out the Gallery link at the top see the hunks we are.)
<li>

Short Summary

Throughout my life, I've learned that everyone has everyone has a need to express themselves.  As much as the public loves music, you would expect a music would not have any issues finding a place to practice but this is often not the case. In some cases, this has built a ""routine"" where musicians move frequently, play for shorter lengths of time, and some go as far as to ""Quit"" all entirely. This to me and many in the community is unacceptable.

The Expression Lounge is a one of a kind music community center for all musicians without age restriction. It will be a DRUG FREE, ALCOHOL FREE, environment with supervision. (Staff on site) We are not a school, but will will have an after school program. Our goal is to fill the gap left from the removal of music programs and lack of city funded music community centers. The city is not against the program, but will not fund it. That's where you come in!
Our Goal

To create a place to Allow musicians to ""fellowship"", ""perform"", ""practice"" and ""record""The Expression Lounge will provide a safe clean environment for artist and musicians both young and old.  Our passion is music, and this is our place to express ourselves.
column5: >

column1: With The Expression Lounge, we will now have a place to go practice, jam with friends as well as record and meet other musicians
Just like a library, or skate parks for the skaters, The Expression Lounge is for the musicians. We can't do this without your help!

The Impact

Music is often considered ""its own language"" . Research shows that music is to the brain, as physical exercise is to the human body.  Music is proven to lower stress levels. 9 out of 10 agree that making music helps children make friends, develop creativity, enhance intellectual development, and builds teamwork skills. All these things strengthen a community, and providing a place where this is possible is within our grasp.
column5: >

column1: Goal
Goal: Raise $176,000
Where does the money go?
Location- The building purchase
Shuttle- Van for after school programs
building materials-Practice Rooms, Stage

Labor of creation

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but would like to help? Spread the word. Share the link and page with as many people as you can. Contact us for other ways you can help. We are always welcome to assistance!
THANK YOU
Whatever you do, THANK YOU for being part of a movement that can really make a huge difference for the future of musicians everywhere!

Hi There!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. We hope that you find it both interesting and inspiring. Sap House Meadery would not be where it is now without your support, you rock.

     - Ash &

Okay folks, here's the deal. We started a huge renovation project in December of 2014 to take over a building next door, connect it to ours and completely overhaul the whole place. In the process we would add both more room for fermenting but also converting our tasting room into a Mead Pub with food, drink etc.

We worked with local community loan organizations to borrow money to make the project happen and hired a local contractor to do the work. Unfortunately we realized, late in the project, that the builder was trying to take us for a ride. The work was shoddy and the accounting was questionable. After a lot of battling, the situation became clear, We had to fire the contractors.

The biggest issue is the truss system of the new building. The rehab work they did to the framing actually rendered the trusses completely useless. After an engineer's analysis it was determined that the trusses needed to be replaced before snowfall.
So now we had a half finished project, no contractors and the truss work that had been done and paid for had to be redone.
<div>

We did what we had to, put our heads down and got to work. We had to do the rest of the renovation work ourselves. We're coming out on the other side now, a good four months later than anticipated. We still need to rework the trusses but our budget from the load has been depleted. We are asking for your help to finish off our new space.
Who, What, Where and Why?
column2: >We started Sap House Meadery in 2009 on a few basic principles. W
column5: background-color: initial

column1: <li>
<b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Source as much of our ingredients locally as we could.

column1: <li>
<b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Carve out a niche and prove that mead could be much more than a novelty.

column1: <li>
<b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Most importantly, however, we wanted to revitalize our hometown of Center Ossipee.

column1: <div>

We started by renovating an old storefront in the village of Center Ossipee using reclaimed materials. Once we had their building and licensing, we developed networks of relationships with local and regional farmers and began producing.

The process of making mead is not a quick one and the first batches were not ready for six months. We officially opened to the public on February 11th of 2011. We then promptly sold out of our supply, which was meant to last the year, in eight weeks.
We have grown every year since and have not looked back.

column5: />
>Sap House Meadery is now distributed across New Hampshire and into seven states and thousands of people visit the tasting room every year.

>One of our proudest accomplishments and most enjoyable tasks is getting a visitor to the area to come to the Meadery, discover Center Ossipee and give them tips and recommendations on what to do and see next.

column1: This campaign is the finishing touch on a renovation project that will see Sap House Meadery's capacity to be a catalyst for revitalization in Center Ossipee increase by an order of magnitude.
The increase in production space is a small part of the vision for the community space that we envision.
The Nitty Gritty... What We Need and Why.
We launched this campaign for two reasons:
One, we have huge dreams and visions for Sap House and Center Ossipee as a community.
Two, as with all renovation and expansion projects, things never go exactly according to plan.

Our renovation project that began in December of 2014 has seen our Meadery increase in size four-fold, add a new tasting room and the addition of an experimental Mead Pub with food, beer, wine, mead-cocktails and all kinds of other cool stuff.
It has also seen it's timeframe more than double and the initial contractors be dismissed in March for quality of work. Ash and his father have completed the remainder of the renovations themselves.

The initial contractors underestimated the project and a great deal of their work was less than satisfactory. However, the single biggest issue that we face is the truss system of the new production area.

The building is quite old  but well built and framed. The truss system had stood for many decades but needed to be upgraded to bear the weight of new insulation, roof and a suspended ceiling. The work done by the initial contractors rendered the truss system completely unusable. They were in worse condition than before the renovation. After an engineer examined them, the situation became clear -- Completely rework the truss system before snow-fall or risk losing the building.
This is a massive undertaking, requiring the re-working of more than thirty trusses in a 2800 square foot building that cannot stop operating.

We have a complete plan in place after working with structural engineers and new contractors to bring everything up to safe standards in a short period of time without disrupting the flow of work at the Meadery.
We just need your help to implement the plan. The lengthened time-frame has bled the remainder of the construction budget and hampered business for the past eight months.
The Plan
If we are funded, the money will go to two specific areas.
<ol>
<li>
<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column5: >Paying to repair the truss system of the new production space.

column1: <li><b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column5: >Working capital for new tanks, ingredients to fill them and the finishing touches on the 'Mead Pub' concept.

column1:
In order to repair the trusses without disrupting the operations of the Meadery, a hole will be cut into the rear, gable-end of the attic to bring in new timber. The existing trusses will be either cut out or repaired depending on their condition. Each truss will then be bolstered by either sistering, adding new collar-ties or both. The attic will be then resealed and new insulation blown in. This will leave the downstairs production area untouched and free of debris.

If we are funded the full amount and the truss repair cost stays within the range we expect, we will also use a portion of the money to put in a draught system so we can serve local beer at the Pub (Aw Yeah!). We will also be purchasing some additional kitchen equipment to increase the variety of food we can serve.
Any remaining money will be used to purchase new tanks and the honey, berries, maple syrup and other ingredients to fill them. We have endless crazy ideas for new meads we think you will love.

We do have additional funds available to us from both the Mt. Washington Valley Economic Council and the Wentworth Economic Development Corporation, who funded the project initially. In the event that something goes awry with the repair or we do not raise sufficient funds from this campaign, we will be able to at least make the minimum repairs to ensure the building is safe and sound.
The Impact of Sap House Meadery

column1: <div><span style=""background-color: initial
Though we certainly do not take credit for all that has happened, we do believe we have a part in it.

Taking these next steps with the Meadery will give us and Center Ossipee more visibility. With the Mead Pub we will have another community space for events, music, presentations, lectures as well as simply gathering with friends for a drink or some food.

In a time where everyone is getting more and more busy and feeling less connected, it's more important to have places to gather, learn, talk and relax. Here's to hoping our contribution to the Center Ossipee community provides a little slice of that for ya'll.
<div>

Thank you again,

Matt &

","Hi There!Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. We hope that you find it both interesting and inspiring. Sap House Meadery would not be where it is now without your support, you rock.     - Ash & MattSummary

Okay folks, here's the deal. We started a huge renovation project in December of 2014 to take over a building next door, connect it to ours and completely overhaul the whole place. In the process we would add both more room for fermenting but also converting our tasting room into a Mead Pub with food, drink etc.

We worked with local community loan organizations to borrow money to make the project happen and hired a local contractor to do the work. Unfortunately we realized, late in the project, that the builder was trying to take us for a ride. The work was shoddy and the accounting was questionable. After a lot of battling, the situation became clear, We had to fire the contractors.

The biggest issue is the truss system of the new building. The rehab work they did to the framing actually rendered the trusses completely useless. After an engineer's analysis it was determined that the trusses needed to be replaced before snowfall.
So now we had a half finished project, no contractors and the truss work that had been done and paid for had to be redone.

We did what we had to, put our heads down and got to work. We had to do the rest of the renovation work ourselves. We're coming out on the other side now, a good four months later than anticipated. We still need to rework the trusses but our budget from the load has been depleted. We are asking for your help to finish off our new space.
Who, What, Where and Why?We started Sap House Meadery in 2009 on a few basic principles. We wanted to:
Source as much of our ingredients locally as we could.
Carve out a niche and prove that mead could be much more than a novelty.
Most importantly, however, we wanted to revitalize our hometown of Center Ossipee.

We started by renovating an old storefront in the village of Center Ossipee using reclaimed materials. Once we had their building and licensing, we developed networks of relationships with local and regional farmers and began producing.

The process of making mead is not a quick one and the first batches were not ready for six months. We officially opened to the public on February 11th of 2011. We then promptly sold out of our supply, which was meant to last the year, in eight weeks.
We have grown every year since and have not looked back.
Sap House Meadery is now distributed across New Hampshire and into seven states and thousands of people visit the tasting room every year.

One of our proudest accomplishments and most enjoyable tasks is getting a visitor to the area to come to the Meadery, discover Center Ossipee and give them tips and recommendations on what to do and see next.
A synergy has formed between the Meadery, and other small businesses in the renaissance that is taking place in the Village
column2: namely Mountainview Station, Lillybugs and Mountain Girl Bakery. We bounce customers between the businesses who see the town, enjoy the park, the farmers market and concerts at the Town Hall.

This is a massive undertaking, requiring the re-working of more than thirty trusses in a 2800 square foot building that cannot stop operating.

The Plan
If we are funded, the money will go to two specific areas.
Paying to repair the truss system of the new production space.
Working capital for new tanks, ingredients to fill them and the finishing touches on the 'Mead Pub' concept.

In order to repair the trusses without disrupting the operations of the Meadery, a hole will be cut into the rear, gable-end of the attic to bring in new timber. The existing trusses will be either cut out or repaired depending on their condition. Each truss will then be bolstered by either sistering, adding new collar-ties or both. The attic will be then resealed and new insulation blown in. This will leave the downstairs production area untouched and free of debris.If we are funded the full amount and the truss repair cost stays within the range we expect, we will also use a portion of the money to put in a draught system so we can serve local beer at the Pub (Aw Yeah!). We will also be purchasing some additional kitchen equipment to increase the variety of food we can serve.
Any remaining money will be used to purchase new tanks and the honey, berries, maple syrup and other ingredients to fill them. We have endless crazy ideas for new meads we think you will love.

We do have additional funds available to us from both the Mt. Washington Valley Economic Council and the Wentworth Economic Development Corporation, who funded the project initially. In the event that something goes awry with the repair or we do not raise sufficient funds from this campaign, we will be able to at least make the minimum repairs to ensure the building is safe and sound.
The Impact of Sap House Meadery
Seeing Center Ossipee grow as we have grown has been one of our great pleasures. There are new businesses popping up in town and there seems to be a palpable energy to the community.
Since we started the Mountainview Station has re-opened and has become very successful.
The Mountain Girl Bakery has taken over both the old PB&J's location and local's waistlines.
Lillybugs now occupies the newly renovated Iron Kettle space and is keeping Ash and I well fed with omelettes and bacon.
The topic of conversation in town has shifted from ""What's wrong with town?"" to ""What can be done for a new business in this building or that building.?""
Though we certainly do not take credit for all that has happened, we do believe we have a part in it.

Taking these next steps with the Meadery will give us and Center Ossipee more visibility. With the Mead Pub we will have another community space for events, music, presentations, lectures as well as simply gathering with friends for a drink or some food.

In a time where everyone is getting more and more busy and feeling less connected, it's more important to have places to gather, learn, talk and relax. Here's to hoping our contribution to the Center Ossipee community provides a little slice of that for ya'll.
Thank you again,Matt & Ash",8.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Who can join?

Anyone! HEALTH CLUB is intended for anyone who has felt uncomfortable, excluded, or othered in a traditional workout setting
column2: we think that demographic includes all types of folks.

column1:
Why do you plan to only offer barbells, and not other types of exercise equipment?

From our personal experience, we feel strongly that lifting barbells is one of the most fun, simple, effective, and affordable ways for people to meet a pretty wide variety of health goals. We’re also into lots of other movement techniques that mix well with lifting barbells, and we hope to expand our scope in the future!

Is lifting barbells dangerous?

Many people have safety concerns when they picture strength training with barbells. We believe that when using proper form and common sense, the benefits of weightlifting far outweigh any risk of injury.

What are you doing to make the gym affordable for everyone?

In addition to our monthly price, we offer a flexible work-trade option that is designed to be able to fit most budgets. We are really committed to making sure cost doesn’t exclude anyone from this community and are looking into ways to subsidize our costs with outside funding as we move forward.

Where is my contribution going?

Here's the breakdown of where your contribution will go: move in costs + rent (40%), equipment (35%), miscellaneous business expenses (20%), and Indiegogo merchandise (5%). A stretch goal of $10,000 will allow us to purchase more and higher quality equipment, rent a larger space, or get certified as strength coaches (we will choose one based on contributor feedback).

THANK YOU!

Don’t forget to share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family and follow us on social media! Even if you can’t contribute any funds, getting the word out is still a HUGE help <

People of all shapes, sizes and identities will have the opportunity to practice transformative movement techniques in a welcoming and non-judgmental environment. Services, pricing, scheduling, and payment options will be flexible in meeting folks wherever they are.

+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+HOT NEW PERKS ADDED AND ONLY A FEW DAYS LEFT TO GRAB THEM!Also, check out the new REFERRAL BONUS below (win stuff just for sharing the campaign with friends!)+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+See what Portland Monthly Magazine has to say about us here and here, as well as our very flattering coverage on Bustle.com!+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
Although our plans are evolving every day, these seem to be the features that’ll stick around when we open:
Access to equipment focused on strength training with barbells
Affordable memberships with a flexible work-trade program
A body-positive microlibrary & a freestore for size-friendly activewear
Website & mobile app to book classes or open gym and pay securely and easily
...And these features are scheduled to be under way within 6 months of opening:
Small group classes & courses included in membership, like Lifting Basics
Size-friendly activewear, simple swag, and snacks available for purchase
Organized group activities like, lawn games, hikes, and scavenger hunts!
OUR PHILOSOPHY
Bodies are inherently diverse in shape, size, and everything else
Every single person’s body deserves to be celebrated and nourished
All of our identities impact the way we experience physical activity & weight stigma
Community & relationships are central to healing from weight discrimination
We encourage & try to cultivate:
Physical activities that allow people of all sizes, abilities, and interests to engage in enjoyable movement, to whatever extent they choose
Self-care practices geared toward individual physical, economic, social, spiritual, emotional, and other needs
Access to culturally-appropriate / trauma-informed services and information related to health
An environment that addresses our privilege and biases in the sharing of information and services
Intuitive, individualized eating based on satiety, nutritional needs, pleasure, and more
We reject:
The idealizing or pathologizing of specific weights, leading to weight discrimination, weight stigma, and weight bias
Externally regulated eating plans focused on weight control (aka “diets”)
Lifting weights can help people:
Improve balance & coordination by strengthening muscles, bones, and joints
Lower the risk of cardiovascular and metabolic problems
Stay positive, sleep better, and respond more adaptively to stress
THE PERKS
ALL perks come with a VIP invitation to our launch party, a social media shout out, and project updates:
BUTTON PACK ($10): A set of three 2.25"" buttons, handmade by us and adorned with body-positive images and slogans.

BAR STAR ($25): A discounted 1-month membership - nearly 50% off! (Memberships will be $45/month after opening). Redeemable for any 1-month period, starting at any time after opening (exact date TBA).
WATER BOTTLE ($25): A 17-oz. stainless steel water bottle with the HEALTH CLUB logo on one side and ""LOVE YOUR BODY"" on the other. Screw-top, BPA-free.
I TOTES LOVE MYSELF ($35): 100% cotton, long-handled, canvas tote bag with HEALTH CLUB logo on one side and ""LOVE YOUR BODY"" on the other.

LEGGINGS BY PERSONAL RECORD ($50): 30% OFF RETAIL! You'll get a gift certificate redeemable for ONE PAIR of performance workout leggings by Personal Record, available in sizes L-3XL and in four fabulous prints.   Personal Record is a bold, new activewear brand designed for curvy women by a curvy designer. The leggings have a high waist fit to reduce rolling and flat seams to reduce chafing. Visit the website to learn more!

HEALTH AT EVERY SIZE ($75): THREE body-positive books, including Health At Every Size by Linda Bacon, Body Respect by Linda Bacon and Lucy Aphramor, and Body of Truth by Harriet Brown. You also get a full merch pack, which includes the canvas tote, water bottle, and button pack (above).

#1 FAN ($100): A limited-edition ""LOVE YOUR BODY"" screenprint, 11"" x 17"", by our designer Hilary Ament, PLUS a rest-of-the-year membership that includes pre-launch access to our equipment. You also get the button pack: a set of three 2.25"" buttons, handmade by us and adorned with body-positive images and slogans.

SPONSOR A RACK ($250): A custom-engraved plaque with the text of your choice will be placed on one of our weightlifting racks. You also get the full HEALTH CLUB merch pack, including a canvas tote, water bottle, and button pack (above).

REFERRAL BONUS! You don't need to contribute any money to participate in the referral bonus. If you don't live in Portland, the first two are for you! Whoever refers the most friends will choose from:

A Personalized Mini Workout session Gillian Byers of Mindfully Active (30 minutes via video chat, PLUS a customized 15-minute workout plan OR a plan for fitting in exercises throughout the day - whatever works best for you). Gillian focuses on helping people use exercise in a way that feels good right now, right where you are.
A copy of Hot & Heavy: Fierce Fat Girls on Life, Love & Fashion by Virgie Tovar, author, activist, and leading expert on fat discrimination, body image and sexuality.

A coupon for 20% off an initial naturopathic visit with Dr. DeAun Nelson at Watershed Wellness.  DeAun is a Naturopathic Doctor and Licensed Massage Therapist who specializes in Health At Every Size®.
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Who can join?Anyone! HEALTH CLUB is intended for anyone who has felt uncomfortable, excluded, or othered in a traditional workout setting

column6:
>THE THONGARANG!

In Australia (not Austria) Flip Flops are called Thongs.

column1: You've no doubt heard of the Boomerang, well this is the THONGARANG!

The added benefits of this Aussie high tech modern innovation is that you can wear these ultimate statements of high fashion and good taste, and then very quickly transform your footwear into a flying machine.
We are a couple of aged students, who in their dotty vintage, may be suffering a little post traumatic stress from excessive examinations.
However, we are thrilled, and have great joy at sharing the peak, the summit, ney, the world's best technological innovation with you.
If our funding goal is reached, we don't plan on anything too altruistic, but may drink some beer or three, and may get some stress relieving acupuncture.

If we vastly exceed our target, we will fly into Dallas, suitcases filled with Thongarangs, and post them from there! (We would love to go to one of your baseball ball shooting thingamajig machines, and knock the covers off a few 100mph balls.)

With each purchase of a Thongarang, we provide you with the appropriate specially designed screws (in clockwise) and detailed throwing instructions (in pictures too, for those more challenged by writing).
A few notes for you to consider, when torn between these three great Thongarang choices.
THE BIG DAZZA : takes a stronger arm to throw, and in flight sounds like a Chinook - about as slow too! What it lacks in speed, it makes up in the thud on the receiving end!
<div>
THE SHAZZA : looks more petite, but make no mistake, in flight she screams like a raving banshee, with mega velocity. Your catching skills will be severely tested!
<div>
THE LITTLE TAKKA : almost silent in flight, very very quick, but stings like a diminutive bee. Very hard to catch!
The THONGARANG in all its glory!!

column5: schema=youtube"" width=""580"">
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

column1: RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
May not return when thrown due to dodgy technique.
May be worn for long time, however excessive accumulated dirt may alter optimal flight characteristics.
May cause hysterical laughter - see your physician if this continues for a prolonged period of time.
May be hung over fireplace or door, as a message!
","THE THONGARANG! In Australia (not Austria) Flip Flops are called Thongs.
You've no doubt heard of the Boomerang, well this is the THONGARANG!

The added benefits of this Aussie high tech modern innovation is that you can wear these ultimate statements of high fashion and good taste, and then very quickly transform your footwear into a flying machine.
We are a couple of aged students, who in their dotty vintage, may be suffering a little post traumatic stress from excessive examinations.
However, we are thrilled, and have great joy at sharing the peak, the summit, ney, the world's best technological innovation with you.
If our funding goal is reached, we don't plan on anything too altruistic, but may drink some beer or three, and may get some stress relieving acupuncture.

If we vastly exceed our target, we will fly into Dallas, suitcases filled with Thongarangs, and post them from there! (We would love to go to one of your baseball ball shooting thingamajig machines, and knock the covers off a few 100mph balls.)

With each purchase of a Thongarang, we provide you with the appropriate specially designed screws (in clockwise) and detailed throwing instructions (in pictures too, for those more challenged by writing).
A few notes for you to consider, when torn between these three great Thongarang choices.
THE BIG DAZZA : takes a stronger arm to throw, and in flight sounds like a Chinook - about as slow too! What it lacks in speed, it makes up in the thud on the receiving end!
THE SHAZZA : looks more petite, but make no mistake, in flight she screams like a raving banshee, with mega velocity. Your catching skills will be severely tested!
THE LITTLE TAKKA : almost silent in flight, very very quick, but stings like a diminutive bee. Very hard to catch!
The THONGARANG in all its glory!!
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
May not return when thrown due to dodgy technique.
May be worn for long time, however excessive accumulated dirt may alter optimal flight characteristics.
May cause hysterical laughter - see your physician if this continues for a prolonged period of time.
May be hung over fireplace or door, as a message!",3.0,2,"1 Campaign
|","Sydney, Australia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/thongarang-it-s-a-boomerang-made-from-thongs/pica

Who We Are?

Jenny Rodriguez, founder of Bloom Behavioral Consulting, a start-up dedicated to molding superior leadership and organizational cultures through a firm understanding of motivation through behavioral science. 

Website: behaviorlikeaboss.com

Elizabeth Ferrao, co-founder of Women Who Code NYC, a network of Women Who Code a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that started 4 years ago in San Francisco.  In the past year, it has grown to 3,000+ female techies and helps ~400 women/month obtain technical jobs, skills, mentors, and a community of ambitious like-minded women. 

Website: meetup.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC 

Together these two groups will create an empowering day focused on the sustainability of women in the tech world.

What We Will Do

The Sally Conference is a one-day event being held in the NYC area.  Its goal is to give women in technology the tools to last beyond mid-career, the vital point at which 57% (Blithe,S., Ashcraft,C., 2009. Women In It: Facts, National Center for Women &
column2:
Information Technology) women leave the industry. 

It will bring together early-career, high-potential women with successful women in leadership in the tech industry and provide behavior-based tools and advice for planning a long-term career in this field.   

Example ""Day Jobs"" of high-potential women: 

Software Engineer    ||     Project Manager    ||     Product Designer

Because of those low statistics, this #Sally Slogan is what we BELIEVE: 

Why Is Our Conference Significant

The Sally Conference will provide women several benefits to not becoming part of this staggering statistic.

Firstly, it will enable them to benefit from several of the tenants of Behavioral Skills Training (Miltenberger, 2008) for instilling in them the skills to succeed in a long-term career in tech, including: Instruction and Modeling.

Secondly, it will allow them to gain skills beyond their technical abilities. It will give them a starter set of leadership and influence skills that will knock down the absence of this skill set as barriers to advanced careers.

Finally, it provides them with an opportunity for planning and forward thinking towards their future. The Sally Conference will provide goal-setting and behavior-based planning workshops to allow women to think and plan towards sustained careers in technology.

Research by Blithe and Ashcraft 2009 observed that 69% of women benefited from having clear and balanced promotion criteria as an important strategy for retaining their positions in the field.  These percentages are higher for women than men, alluding to the power and necessity of the Sally Conference for promoting high-potential women to reach their greatest potential.

*(Blithe,S., Ashcraft,C., 2009. Women In It: Facts, National Center for Women &
column3:
Information Technology)

Results of Conference

With your support and donations, we will be able to provide scholarships for female candidates who demonstrate commitment to the tech field. We will also be able to ensure that logistics of the day are taken care of including teaching and training materials. These together will ensure that we provide a high-quality experience for women in tech to develop the skills needed to ensure they are on track to meet their careers goals. 

Rewards For Donating

Your generous support and sponsorship demonstrates a partnership with Sally and the values of the conference.  As allies, you take on an active role in the community where your contribution marks continued community collaboration in elevating women as leaders.  

Since we strongly believe in the power of positive reinforcement as a tool to encourage behaviors, we are going to show you how much we care about your donations with “thank you” shout outs sent to you in various social media platforms, in addition to discounts off future Bloom Behavioral Consulting events.  

Pass the positivity forward and share our campaign. We can break the glass ceiling together! 

Sponsored By:





Follow @Bloom_Behavior + @WomenWhoCodeNYC  for updates on #Sally!

<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >THE STORY

column1: Welcome to our crowdfunding page! We are Thomas,
Lars and PieterJan aka TLP. A few months ago we somehow came to the ridiculous
decision to embark on a journey towards Mongolia in a car fit to do Sunday's
groceries at best: The legendary Opel Agila. 12000 kilometers of hot deserts,
dusty steppes and rough roads are on the menu starting from the London Goodwood
Track all the way to Ulan Bataar. They say the journey is more important

than the destination... We might have taken that expression a tiny bit too literal.

But WHY? We hear you ask

First off, we would like to give something back to our planet and the community. We're supporting 2 very solid charities in the course of our adventure and really hope to get enough funding to make a REAL difference!

Secondly we're not the kind of people that like to spend our holidays lying around a hotel pool marinating in our own laziness. No, we'd rather go out there, get our hands dirty and come back with an incredible story!
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >THE MONGOL RALLYThe Mongol Rally is a yearly organized event by a sinister group of people from the UK that call themselves ""The Adventurists"" www.theadventurists.com/mongol-rally They are not a travel agency but rather a bunch of shamelessly irresponsible travelers that started this tradition of going to Mongolia by car some 10 years ago. There's no back-up, no plan of attack, just these three conditions:

column1: 1) Support at least 1 charity organization with £1000 (€1350), with your help we want to make an even bigger difference and go for £2000 (€2700)!
2) Your car cannot have a capacity over 1.2liter. For those who don't really know how big that is, it's Fiat Panda small.
3) No rescue teams or followcars - you're completely on your own
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >HOW CAN YOU HELP?

column1: We hope reading through all of this you realize we're in great need of help. Mentally, physically but not in the least financially. Here's a little breakdown of the bare minimum costs we're facing in this adventure:
The Car: €1650 (We bought our Ultraturbo Agila second hand for €1100 + €550 enrolement &
column2:
insurance)
Team enrollment with Mongol Rally: €750 
The Charity: €2700 (£2000 = double the minimum £1000)
The Visas: €2250 (around €750 per person)
Carnet de Passage: €235 (You need it to enter Iran by car)
Vehicle transport: €1250 (Rules state you can't leave your car in Mongolia)
Transport: €1200(Flights back = €350/pp. Ferry to Londen kick-off = €150)
Insurance: €300 (€100/pp)
Spare parts for our Agila: Off road suspensions, spare tires, air filters, cooling systems, ... we estimate around €1000

column1: These bare necessities, excluding accomodation, food and drinks already bring us to a grand total of €11335!

To help us raise money for charity and realize our goal you can pick one of the perks to support us in our cause to pursue Mongolian happiness across one third of the globe. They range from silly to dead serious but every single donation is greatly appreciated!
This is how we plan to allocate the money we raise:
1) We spend €2700 on our two good causes first (check the charities we support here below)

2) After we've covered the charity causes we start covering the bare minimum expenses required to bring the journey to a good end. We will spend money on the above list of expenses. We will not spend money on food, drinks, accommodation and other luxury expenses.
3) Everything that we raise on top of this, will be spent incremental to the €2700 on our good causes. We will never keep a single USD for ourselves

column5: >Note: You don't háve to donate money if you really can't (e.g. you're a student and need the money to buy books, condoms &amp
column6: beer pong balls). Maybe you have a cousin in Kazachstan we can stay with or you've got an Iranian lonely planet lying around? Anything that can help us survive our crazy journey is welcome.

column1: <h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >THE CHARITIES

column1: Cool Earth
Cool Earth is a non profit organization who is
engaged worldwide to protect rain forests. By educating and providing in their
basic needs they help local communities make a better chance against the
great deforestation firms. Cool Earth makes sure they are able to sustain their
century old way of life.
African Drive
In many African countries, transport is a serious
problem. Many regions are difficult to reach and this causes difficulties
transporting goods and traveling from point A to point B, thereby hampering
economic development. The roads that are in use are crowded with vehicles that
are dangerous, not adapted to the roads, overloaded, fuel inefficient, and
polluting the environment.

The aim of African Drive is to improve mobility in Central Africa, starting with Benin where they have already successfully installed 14 bus lines providing reliable transportation that is otherwise not to be found. African Drive is a social business, demonstrating that entrepreneurship and a better ecosystem for mobility can be a motor for social progress and meaningful growth. In Bénin it is operational under the local name Baobab Express.
<div><div><span style=""font-weight: normal
column5: background-color: initial
column10: >THE CARAfter weeks of searching for a decent second hand car we came across the absolute worst choice of the bunch: The Opel Agila. It's the perfect car for when you're 65 and still like to go by the library from time to time.

column1: This beauty will need to be fully equiped with offroad suspension to make up for the ridiculously small tires, a roof rack to store the spare parts we'll inevitably need and many, many spare tires. AIRCO is for sissies and CASETTES are totally back! Seriously, if you have some old casettes, we're taking.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FQBq5BflVsac%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
column5: type=text%2Fhtml&amp

column1: <b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >THE UN-ROUTE

column1: <span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >We decided to take the Southern Route, driving through Eastern Europe into Turkey hoping to bribe our way through to Iran. Of course we have a back-up plan if this fails, that goes through Armenia and Azerbeidjan taking the ferry to Turkmenistan. Then, without much further foreseeable problems we merrily drive through Uzbekistan and Kazachstan both known for it's hospitable countrymen and welcoming cities. Or was it dictatorship? After that we do a quick border check with Russia, staying in this really cosy shack Lars booked:
column4:
/>

To finally arrive in Mongolia after 5 weeks of getting acquainted with each other's body smell and playing the same mix tape casette over and over again

column2: >Here's a small overview of the scheduled timing of our trip:

column1: We sincerely hope that, reading through all this nonesense, you do understand how we will first focus on delivering a REAL contribution to our charities before we focus on softening the financial blow for ourselves. Though the outset of our journey may seem somewhat ridiculous, the cause is most definitely a noble one.
","THE STORY
Welcome to our crowdfunding page! We are Thomas,
Lars and PieterJan aka TLP. A few months ago we somehow came to the ridiculous
decision to embark on a journey towards Mongolia in a car fit to do Sunday's
groceries at best: The legendary Opel Agila. 12000 kilometers of hot deserts,
dusty steppes and rough roads are on the menu starting from the London Goodwood
Track all the way to Ulan Bataar. They say the journey is more important
than the destination... We might have taken that expression a tiny bit too literal.But WHY? We hear you ask

First off, we would like to give something back to our planet and the community. We're supporting 2 very solid charities in the course of our adventure and really hope to get enough funding to make a REAL difference!

Secondly we're not the kind of people that like to spend our holidays lying around a hotel pool marinating in our own laziness. No, we'd rather go out there, get our hands dirty and come back with an incredible story!

THE MONGOL RALLYThe Mongol Rally is a yearly organized event by a sinister group of people from the UK that call themselves ""The Adventurists"" www.theadventurists.com/mongol-rally They are not a travel agency but rather a bunch of shamelessly irresponsible travelers that started this tradition of going to Mongolia by car some 10 years ago. There's no back-up, no plan of attack, just these three conditions:
1) Support at least 1 charity organization with £1000 (€1350), with your help we want to make an even bigger difference and go for £2000 (€2700)!
2) Your car cannot have a capacity over 1.2liter. For those who don't really know how big that is, it's Fiat Panda small.
3) No rescue teams or followcars - you're completely on your own
HOW CAN YOU HELP?

We hope reading through all of this you realize we're in great need of help. Mentally, physically but not in the least financially. Here's a little breakdown of the bare minimum costs we're facing in this adventure:

The Car: €1650 (We bought our Ultraturbo Agila second hand for €1100 + €550 enrolement & insurance)Team enrollment with Mongol Rally: €750 The Charity: €2700 (£2000 = double the minimum £1000)The Visas: €2250 (around €750 per person)Carnet de Passage: €235 (You need it to enter Iran by car)Vehicle transport: €1250 (Rules state you can't leave your car in Mongolia)Transport: €1200(Flights back = €350/pp. Ferry to Londen kick-off = €150)Insurance: €300 (€100/pp)Spare parts for our Agila: Off road suspensions, spare tires, air filters, cooling systems, ... we estimate around €1000
These bare necessities, excluding accomodation, food and drinks already bring us to a grand total of €11335!

To help us raise money for charity and realize our goal you can pick one of the perks to support us in our cause to pursue Mongolian happiness across one third of the globe. They range from silly to dead serious but every single donation is greatly appreciated!
This is how we plan to allocate the money we raise:
1) We spend €2700 on our two good causes first (check the charities we support here below)

2) After we've covered the charity causes we start covering the bare minimum expenses required to bring the journey to a good end. We will spend money on the above list of expenses. We will not spend money on food, drinks, accommodation and other luxury expenses.
3) Everything that we raise on top of this, will be spent incremental to the €2700 on our good causes. We will never keep a single USD for ourselves

Note: You don't háve to donate money if you really can't (e.g. you're a student and need the money to buy books, condoms & beer pong balls). Maybe you have a cousin in Kazachstan we can stay with or you've got an Iranian lonely planet lying around? Anything that can help us survive our crazy journey is welcome.
THE CHARITIES
Cool Earth
Cool Earth is a non profit organization who is
engaged worldwide to protect rain forests. By educating and providing in their
basic needs they help local communities make a better chance against the
great deforestation firms. Cool Earth makes sure they are able to sustain their
century old way of life.
African Drive
In many African countries, transport is a serious
problem. Many regions are difficult to reach and this causes difficulties
transporting goods and traveling from point A to point B, thereby hampering
economic development. The roads that are in use are crowded with vehicles that
are dangerous, not adapted to the roads, overloaded, fuel inefficient, and
polluting the environment.

The aim of African Drive is to improve mobility in Central Africa, starting with Benin where they have already successfully installed 14 bus lines providing reliable transportation that is otherwise not to be found. African Drive is a social business, demonstrating that entrepreneurship and a better ecosystem for mobility can be a motor for social progress and meaningful growth. In Bénin it is operational under the local name Baobab Express.

THE CARAfter weeks of searching for a decent second hand car we came across the absolute worst choice of the bunch: The Opel Agila. It's the perfect car for when you're 65 and still like to go by the library from time to time.

This beauty will need to be fully equiped with offroad suspension to make up for the ridiculously small tires, a roof rack to store the spare parts we'll inevitably need and many, many spare tires. AIRCO is for sissies and CASETTES are totally back! Seriously, if you have some old casettes, we're taking.
THE UN-ROUTE

We decided to take the Southern Route, driving through Eastern Europe into Turkey hoping to bribe our way through to Iran. Of course we have a back-up plan if this fails, that goes through Armenia and Azerbeidjan taking the ferry to Turkmenistan. Then, without much further foreseeable problems we merrily drive through Uzbekistan and Kazachstan both known for it's hospitable countrymen and welcoming cities. Or was it dictatorship? After that we do a quick border check with Russia, staying in this really cosy shack Lars booked:To finally arrive in Mongolia after 5 weeks of getting acquainted with each other's body smell and playing the same mix tape casette over and over again
Here's a small overview of the scheduled timing of our trip:

We sincerely hope that, reading through all this nonesense, you do understand how we will first focus on delivering a REAL contribution to our charities before we focus on softening the financial blow for ourselves. Though the outset of our journey may seem somewhat ridiculous, the cause is most definitely a noble one.",4.0,1,"1 Campaign

Who We Are
We are the
Connollys – Mike, Natalie, Bridget, Austin, Brian &amp
Irish-American family with a strong sense of heritage and a work-ethic to match.  With our love for life and a collective sense
of humor that will keep you on your toes, we are dedicated to the family unit
and we hope to embody the traditions of Ireland and the versatility of our rich
American culture into Connolly’s Public House.
Our Vision
We are in the
final stages of launching a genuine, fun, family-owned Irish Pub that combines
two elements we feel strongly about:
<ol>
<li>Embracing the classic traditions and cultural
elements found in Irish pubs both in America
and in Ireland
<li>Catering to a vibrant, dynamic American market
with a menu that brings Irish food into the new millennium—a careful blend
of feeling good and eating well.
As part of
feeling good, Connolly’s will offer the congenial atmosphere of a true Public House
- an extension of the proprietor’s living room. It will be a place where the neighborhood
can congregate, celebrate and enjoy good company and great “craic"" (<span>an Irish term for fun,
entertainment, and enjoyable conversation). Everybody needs a place to just
chill and socialize – and if your definition of socialize means stopping in for
a beer and free WiFi to check Facebook, that’s fine too!
We anticipate families and patrons of all ages will visit
and be comfortable enjoying a meal, a drink, and the camaraderie of a
neighborhood gathering place. Our belief is that the lively culture of the
Irish extends to all through an eclectic selection of music, dancing,
story-telling, and celebration. Join us for a game of pool or darts, a
televised sporting event, world news on the TV, or maybe an evening of karaoke.
The fun just never ends with the Connollys!
Since we want to feed and nourish the community with quality
dishes, our belief is that Irish food can be both traditional <u>and</u>
flavorful, if not a bit whimsical. Choices will include standard Irish Pub
fare, family-dinner specials, and dishes that appeal to the more adventurous. The
menu will allow for fresh, healthy choices and accommodate dietary needs with  gluten free,
vegetarian, and lower fat options. We believe that Irish Pub food doesn’t need
to be boring and that a menu can be done well without approaching the “fine
dining” end of the price spectrum. Most menu items will fall in the $8-18 range.
We anticipate the use of local suppliers and farm-to-table food sources when
available.  This will allow us to support local farming, reduce packaging, lower transportation costs, and the ability to compost a large
portion of our garbage thus helping to reduce our carbon footprint.
What We Need &
This campaign
will be the final push we need to complete our concept and continue renovating the
space.  We are in the home stretch and your essential contribution will
help this concept become a reality. The anticipated total cost of our project is almost $100,000 and this campaign represents the final $30,000 needed.
Your
contributions will help us convert a tired, 20-year old restaurant into Connolly’s
Public House. We will create a classic pub façade, construct and equip a
comfortable and welcoming bar area (including a 12-tap beer system), modernize
the older kitchen and equipment, and provide for traffic flow enhancements throughout
the space (including ADA accessibility). The 4,500 square foot location is
directly across the street from the Metra and CTA Harlem Green Line train

stations in Oak Park, IL and enjoys a plethora of foot traffic.  The Carleton Hotel is around the corner, and many other restaurants and shops make up this exciting area. Approximately 800 new housing units will be
joining this immediate neighborhood over the next three years.  We’d like all of them to call Connolly’s
home!
Any and all
contributions are greatly appreciated. We have some wonderful perks to help
guide you in deciding how much to contribute.
To the extent we
exceed our funding goal, we will earmark those funds to eventually lease the 2<sup>nd</sup>
floor space as a banquet facility. In addition, our long-term goal is to
purchase the building as we have an option to do so in our lease.
What
Impact Will Your Contributions Make?
On a micro level, your contribution will allow us to
open our doors, promote a sense of family, and give back to a community that
has given us tremendous support over the years. We raised our children and made
our home in Oak Park, cultivated a number of good friends, and cherish many fond memories. We want to bring
that community (and you) into our family – an adoption of sorts – by proudly
serving them our food and spirits in a warm, inviting setting with a family
feel. Your contribution will also help bring jobs to the area and support other local entrepreneurs and businesses from the day we open and while we grow and thrive.
Your contribution will make an impact on
a macro level as well. Like many others, our family has been hit hard by the recent
Recession. After many years of dedication to the success of corporate America, Natalie
and Mike find themselves with little reward and much less hair - Mike that is!  As our kids begin to graduate college and
enter the work-force, they are feeling a disconnection to the world of big
business and are more attracted to entrepreneurial life as well. The collective feeling
among us is that the world is best served by the efforts of small businesses
and individuals who put their heart and soul into making their mark. Your
contribution will help us get back to basics and go to bat for small business
and family farms. We plan to be a beacon of support for these causes and
ultimately pay it forward by earmarking some of our profits to help fund other IndieGoGo campaigns.
Risks &
We have been around the block enough to know that nothing in
life or in business is without risk. While the construction required in this
space is minimal, there still exists the risk of cost or time overruns. In
addition, our revenue targets may take longer to achieve than expected. We have
accounted for these contingencies in our start-up budget.
With more than 40 years of combined business, finance, and
operations experience, we feel equipped to face the challenges ahead.  And like all good business persons, we know when
to enlist the expertise of others.  We
have assembled a team of family, friends, and business associates to give us guidance and we will
hire experienced hospitality professionals to help meet the day to day demands
of the Pub.
We also feel strongly in the flexibility of being a family
owned and operated business. This allows us to contribute extreme amounts of sweat
equity directly to the business while remaining together as we do so.
How Else Can You Help?
Regardless of
your level of assistance, we also ask for your support by forwarding our cause
to your friends and family via email, word of mouth, and social media. And by “family
and friends”, we mean, EVERYBODY…your mail carrier…your dentist…your dry
cleaner…everybody! It takes a village. Thanks for your support!

neighborhood gathering place. Our belief is that the lively culture of the
Irish extends to all through an eclectic selection of music, dancing,
story-telling, and celebration. Join us for a game of pool or darts, a
televised sporting event, world news on the TV, or maybe an evening of karaoke.
The fun just never ends with the Connollys!
Since we want to feed and nourish the community with quality
dishes, our belief is that Irish food can be both traditional and
flavorful, if not a bit whimsical. Choices will include standard Irish Pub
fare, family-dinner specials, and dishes that appeal to the more adventurous. The
menu will allow for fresh, healthy choices and accommodate dietary needs with  gluten free,
vegetarian, and lower fat options. We believe that Irish Pub food doesn’t need
to be boring and that a menu can be done well without approaching the “fine
dining” end of the price spectrum. Most menu items will fall in the $8-18 range.
We anticipate the use of local suppliers and farm-to-table food sources when
available.  This will allow us to support local farming, reduce packaging, lower transportation costs, and the ability to compost a large
portion of our garbage thus helping to reduce our carbon footprint.
What We Need & What You Get
This campaign
will be the final push we need to complete our concept and continue renovating the
space.  We are in the home stretch and your essential contribution will
help this concept become a reality. The anticipated total cost of our project is almost $100,000 and this campaign represents the final $30,000 needed.
Your
contributions will help us convert a tired, 20-year old restaurant into Connolly’s
Public House. We will create a classic pub façade, construct and equip a
comfortable and welcoming bar area (including a 12-tap beer system), modernize
the older kitchen and equipment, and provide for traffic flow enhancements throughout
the space (including ADA accessibility). The 4,500 square foot location is
directly across the street from the Metra and CTA Harlem Green Line train

stations in Oak Park, IL and enjoys a plethora of foot traffic.  The Carleton Hotel is around the corner, and many other restaurants and shops make up this exciting area. Approximately 800 new housing units will be
joining this immediate neighborhood over the next three years.  We’d like all of them to call Connolly’s
home!
Any and all
contributions are greatly appreciated. We have some wonderful perks to help
guide you in deciding how much to contribute.
To the extent we
exceed our funding goal, we will earmark those funds to eventually lease the 2nd
floor space as a banquet facility. In addition, our long-term goal is to
purchase the building as we have an option to do so in our lease.
What
Impact Will Your Contributions Make?
On a micro level, your contribution will allow us to
open our doors, promote a sense of family, and give back to a community that
has given us tremendous support over the years. We raised our children and made
our home in Oak Park, cultivated a number of good friends, and cherish many fond memories. We want to bring
that community (and you) into our family – an adoption of sorts – by proudly
serving them our food and spirits in a warm, inviting setting with a family
feel. Your contribution will also help bring jobs to the area and support other local entrepreneurs and businesses from the day we open and while we grow and thrive.
Your contribution will make an impact on
a macro level as well. Like many others, our family has been hit hard by the recent
Recession. After many years of dedication to the success of corporate America, Natalie
and Mike find themselves with little reward and much less hair - Mike that is!  As our kids begin to graduate college and
enter the work-force, they are feeling a disconnection to the world of big
business and are more attracted to entrepreneurial life as well. The collective feeling
among us is that the world is best served by the efforts of small businesses
and individuals who put their heart and soul into making their mark. Your
contribution will help us get back to basics and go to bat for small business
and family farms. We plan to be a beacon of support for these causes and
ultimately pay it forward by earmarking some of our profits to help fund other IndieGoGo campaigns.
Risks & Challenges
We have been around the block enough to know that nothing in
life or in business is without risk. While the construction required in this
space is minimal, there still exists the risk of cost or time overruns. In
addition, our revenue targets may take longer to achieve than expected. We have
accounted for these contingencies in our start-up budget.
With more than 40 years of combined business, finance, and
operations experience, we feel equipped to face the challenges ahead.  And like all good business persons, we know when
to enlist the expertise of others.  We
have assembled a team of family, friends, and business associates to give us guidance and we will
hire experienced hospitality professionals to help meet the day to day demands
of the Pub.
We also feel strongly in the flexibility of being a family
owned and operated business. This allows us to contribute extreme amounts of sweat
equity directly to the business while remaining together as we do so.
How Else Can You Help?
Regardless of
your level of assistance, we also ask for your support by forwarding our cause
to your friends and family via email, word of mouth, and social media. And by “family
and friends”, we mean, EVERYBODY…your mail carrier…your dentist…your dry
cleaner…everybody! It takes a village. Thanks for your support!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Oak Park, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/connolly-s-an-irish-pub-for-the-new-millennium/pica

Who We Are

Future Promises is just that: a promise to myself that I will continue to support myself and others through what I'm truly passionate about. That is what I would like this brand to represent: the passion that keeps each of us on this earth. Whether it's for other people, your job, a hobby, or even yourself, Future Promises is what you will promise to yourself when you get out of bed tomorrow to succeed.

What We Need To Get There

To successfully launch we will need several materials to provide a quality product:
<ul>
• A screen printing press and supplies for printing
<li>Additional inks &amp
• Shirts
• Design materials such as software and print supplies
• Promotional materials such as flyers, a photographer for product shots/promo, etc.
• Business materials

All together without tax, shipping costs, or fees, these will cost approximately $2,200 . Remaining money earned past this will apply towards  fees/taxes/shipping costs (to us and to those who purchase perks). Additional money raised will go towards creating a more diverse line and incorporating new products such as flannels, posters, sweatshirts, leggings, and beanies.
Challenges &
column2:
Goals

Future Promises aims to become a staple in every Warped Tour and music-oriented person's wardrobe. Of course big dreams have to start small and your support will get us a lot further than if we were doing this on our own.

column1: To start out, we are planning on maintaining our store using Etsy to wholly focus on the products we are able to produce. One of our main goals is to open our own website. Exposure is going to be very important to eventually upgrade to our own domain. Your involvement will be as important in this as ours is (see below on how to help!)If we raise over $4,500 we will be able to launch Future Promises on our own domain.

How You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay, too! The best ways you can help for no money are
<ul>
• Share this campaign! Post it to your Facebook, share it on Tumblr, Tweet about it! The more attention this gets the more chances Future Promises will get funded!
• Follow our social media pages. We'll be updating how the campaign is going as well as other behind the scenes goodies!

column4: >Join us in revolutionizing that way you think of your next meal. Localtarian empowers the community! Through Locatlarian, everyone has access to selling their local product, allowing the members of the community to participate in the economic growth that Harlem and other communities are experiencing.

column1: <b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Top Three Reasons to Donate

column1:
1. Localtarian empowers the community! Through Locatlarian, everyone has access to selling their local product, allowing the members of the community to participate in the economic growth that Harlem and other communities are experiencing.

2. Localtarian provides home-cooked meals, straight to your door. Our food is curated, but made with love from food aficionados!

3. Localtairan is building relationships through food. You'll know the face of the neighbor who creates your perfect meal, generating a tighter and more caring community.
column5: >Check out our site

column1: In December of 2014, I, Daniel ( guy on the right in top picture), craved an
authentic, Colombian, home-cooked meal. I wanted something fresh
that felt like home. But that meant that I would have to try to cook, and like
many people, I just didn’t have time. My partner-in-crime and co-founder, Kevin
(guy on left of top photo), would always come to work with containers filled
with Ecuadorian food that his mother had cooked. That was the kind of food I
wanted! I asked Kevin’s mother if she could make an extra serving for me that I
could pay her for. Then it hit us!
How many people out there love to cook and would
benefit from selling their awesome food?! How awesome would it be if there was
an online marketplace where you can see what your neighbors are cooking, order
it if it looks good, and have it delivered to your doorstep?! With these ideas,

Localtarian was born.

We are on a mission to strengthen community ties, one home-cooked meal at a time and we are excited to have you be part of the journey.
column5: auto=format&amp
column9:
/>

      What We Have Been Up To

We launched our pilot for 7 weeks  in West Harlem with paper menus and 3 cooks. We have sold over 250 plates of food! We've also teamed up a delivery company called  Baagd who will be doing our future deliveries. We have also been spreading the word all over New York City about what Localtarian is up to and we've been getting great feedback!
column18:
>What We Will Do With Your Support

We plan on expanding to every neighborhood in NYC. But to expand to other neighborhoods we need some dinero. We need to buy thousands of supplies such as food containers, utensils, and cups for our cooks. Also expanding  to new neighborhoods also means cost of delivery will increase.

Areas we will expand to by October include:

Central Harlem

Upper West Side

East Harlem

Prospect Park

Astoria

Washington Heights

Flushing

Williamsburg

Bushwick

and many more!

The neighborhood we get the most support from will be the next area we expand to.
