Summary:
The people at St. John UCC, a small church with a big
heart, want to feed young stomachs so hungry minds can grow.
It is a shame that in a time of such abundance and plenty, nearly
half of the school children in our community come from families living at or
below the poverty line.  We all know, when your tummy is empty, it’s hard
to focus on learning.
Why the weekend? Most of these kids have subsidized meals
at school during the week. Often though, they come home to find empty cupboards
and emptier stomachs.
A contribution from you will go a long way toward improving our
kitchen and buying needed supplies for the upcoming school year.
We hope to raise $10,000 through your generosity in order to
upgrade our church kitchen. With these upgrades we can provide a hot breakfast
to needy children, beginning on weekends.
Much of Jesus’ ministry was shared over a meal, often with those
less fortunate.  One thing Jesus always said was, “Feed the children
first.”
Won’t you join with us in feeding children first?

What We Need:

$10,000 might seem like a lot of money. Here is what your donations will go toward:
column2: >$6,000 will go toward updating our kitchen. This will help us serve the children in the community with our program.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2:
>$4,000 will go toward buying nutritious food for the kids. It will also help cover the cost of bowls/plate, utensils, napkins, and cups, and provide a lending library to growing minds to read while they eat.
  • Even if we don't reach our desired goal, every penny will be used to help make our dream a reality.

column1:
Of course, there are perks that come along with donating to our cause.

The Impact:

It might not seem like feeding children one meal a week will do much. However, studies show that a good breakfast will help children learn and improve their grades. Better grades can afford more opportunities for the students and affect the outcome of their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Any way you can help is appreciated. Donate a dollar. Donate more. Even if you can't contribute monetarily, that doesn't mean you can't help. Get our message out there. Tell your family, tell your friends, share on Facebook, and Tweet to your followers. Just by spreading the word, you are making a difference in a child's life.

“Ciao! My name is Umberto. I work as an IT consultant and I enjoy a very active lifestyle. I was born in Torino (Italy) and still live here
column2: For me, Torino is like a hidden treasure
column3: unknown to the typical tourist, it is beautiful, historical, functional.”

column1: </tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“Hi, I am Iuliia. I was born and grew up in Eastern Europe, in Ukraine. At university I travelled a lot around Europe. Each trip was a milestone in my life experience. I met Umberto during a cultural exchange program in the last year of my education. With time we decided to start our life together and I moved to Torino, leaving my Ukrainian life behind”.
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
</tr>
</tbody>
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“When me and Iuliia started to plan our life together, I realized that my salary as IT consultant would not be enough for the both of us. Some months earlier, my father had retired, leaving his laboratory to collect dust. Pretty soon, we realized that that unused and dusty place represented a financial opportunity and we came up with the idea of starting a B&
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
“We are really enjoying this experience! To meet new people every day, help them discover the city and feel like at home give a lot of satisfaction. The B&
column2: B is very successful and so far we hosted more than 100 guests in just 6 months (If you want to check-out our listing on Airbnb, just check out the link in the project details). We are receiving more requests than we can satisfy, so we think it is now time to expand the activity!”

column1: <td style=""vertical-align: middle
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
“We recently found an apartment which would be the perfect opportunity to expand our B&
column2:
B business. It can be easily divided into two independent units which could host from 2 to 4 people each, plus one room for group activities. Every unit will consist of night and day zone, small kitchen and private bathroom. Also the apartment is very close to us, in a very popular area for young people, right next to the city center, train station and metro. So we don’t want to lose this opportunity to acquire it.
Crowdfunding is a wonderful way to turn ideas and motivation into reality. Besides the financial aspects, we would like to invite you to support us with feedback and ideas and help us perfect our project. We want you to travel to Torino and be our guests and feel that this B&
column3: B is what you have always been dreaming about”.

“In order to reach our fundraising goal, we designed perks to give back as much value as possible to our contributors. In fact, we are basically proposing you to spend your next vacation in our B&
column2: B in Torino (or to make a gift to a friend or a loved one)! After you contribute, we will get in contact with you to define details. When the campaign is over, we will update all contributors weekly with pictures and messages, to show our work progress and get feedback from the community”

column1: <td style=""vertical-align: middle
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“Torino is the main city of Piedmont region, in northwestern Italy. While it is not a famous tourist destination like Florence, or Rome, it has one of the most longstanding cultural and artistic history in the country. In fact, Torino was the first capital of Italy and the home of its royal family, the House of Savoy. Many consider it to be the European capital of Baroque, as most of the historical city center was built in this style under the influence of Savoy family. The 2006 Winter Olympics brought this half forgotten city under the spotlight and the whole world rediscovered its aristocratic atmosphere, the centre filled with ancient cafes, arcaded streets, restaurants and churches, its grand boulevards and palaces, parks, museums and art galleries. Since then, Torino became an increasingly popular touristic destination, something you really don’t want to miss!”
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“We believe that travelling is not just about reaching a destination, but more about having the possibility to dive into a new culture and see life from a new perspective. In all our travels, we always preferred hostels and B&
column2: Bs to hotels and not because of price convenience. Our goal is to give our guests some cultural influence of Italy and Torino. We will provide our guests with some knowledge of Italian language, food and traditions. Also, we want to promote sharing information between guests. For example, in our B&
column3: B we have a suggestion book, where our guests have possibility to write their comments about the places they visited and have been impressed by, which future guests can take ideas from. We are focused on creating the basis for a unique travel experience, with all the comforts of a hotel.

column1: Thanks to this fundraising, we will be able to create a common space to organize activities like Italian and cooking lessons and propose guided tours of Torino and nearby areas.”
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“Yeap. It is not just our enthusiasm and passion which brings us here today. Our experience in this business gives us the confidence that, no matter what, we will bring this project to the end. Our current B&
column2: B room was originally the laboratory of my father. After he retired, it started to collect dust and became a storage room where to hide useless objects. While the laboratory stopped to produce money, it was still producing expenses for my parents in the form of taxes and bills each month. As we were striving to make a budget for our life together, we realized the potential of this abandoned asset
column3: we proposed to my parents to take over all the expenses of the laboratory in change of the possibility to use it as we wanted.”

column1: </tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
column3: >“Leveraging my passion for interior design, and Umberto's and his father's manual ability, with a lot of imagination and energy we turned this space into a cozy apartment in which we are now hosting tourists coming to visit Torino. Now we have fresh ideas on how to design next rooms which will make our guests, who are travelers in their hearts, to travel even easier, lighter and bring home a remarkable experience!”

column1: <td style=""vertical-align: middle
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle
“In case the project is only partially funded, we have several backup plans:
• 90-99%: we will live on a very strict budget for some time, save the extra money and go from there :).
<li>60-89%: <span style=""font-size: 1em
column3: >we will downsize our project (look for a smaller apartment).

column1: <li><span style=""font-size: 1em
column3: >30-59%: we will look for an apartment on auction. This will greatly reduce acquisition costs but will significantly delay our project, as Italian bureaucracy can take up to 6-12 months before an apartment bought on auction is delivered to the buyer.

column1: <li><span style=""font-size: 1em
column3: >less than 30%: we will use the money to make improvements to our current B&

column1: In any case, we can assure you that all perks will be confirmed and we will be extremely happy to welcome in Torino our contributors!”
</tr>
</tbody>
<table cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""0"">
<tbody>
<tr style=""vertical-align: middle
<td style=""vertical-align: middle

“If you can’t give us any financial help, you can still share our story and this link with your friends, or support us with ideas and feedback. Whether you are an active traveler or you are working in the hosting business, or even if you just feel like you have something to say, we will appreciate your contribution very much!”

column2: For me, Torino is like a hidden treasure
column3: unknown to the typical tourist, it is beautiful, historical, functional.”

column1: “Hi, I am Iuliia. I was born and grew up in Eastern Europe, in Ukraine. At university I travelled a lot around Europe. Each trip was a milestone in my life experience. I met Umberto during a cultural exchange program in the last year of my education. With time we decided to start our life together and  I moved to Torino, leaving my Ukrainian life behind”.

“When me and Iuliia started to plan our life together, I realized that my salary as IT consultant would not be enough for the both of us. Some months earlier, my father had retired, leaving his laboratory to collect dust. Pretty soon, we realized that that unused and dusty place represented a financial opportunity and we came up with the idea of starting a B&B activity.”

“We are really enjoying this experience! To meet new people every day, help them discover the city and feel like at home give a lot of satisfaction. The B&B is very successful and so far we hosted more than 100 guests in just 6 months (If you want to check-out our listing on Airbnb, just check out the link in the project details). We are receiving more requests than we can satisfy, so we think it is now time to expand the activity!”

“We recently found an apartment which would be the perfect opportunity to expand our B&B business. It can be easily divided into two independent units which could host from 2 to 4 people each, plus one room for group activities. Every unit will consist of night and day zone, small kitchen and private bathroom. Also the apartment is very close to us, in a very popular area for young people, right next to the city center, train station and metro. So we don’t want to lose this opportunity to acquire it. Crowdfunding is a wonderful way to turn ideas and motivation into reality. Besides the financial aspects, we would like to invite you to support us with feedback and ideas and help us perfect our project. We want you to travel to Torino and be our guests and feel that this B&B is what you have always been dreaming about”.
“We estimated our project budget at 160 000€. In details:
Acquisition of apartment (125 000€)
Taxes and bureaucracy (15 000€)
Renovation and decoration (20 000€)
We currently have 30 000€ of personal savings.Moreover, we can open a mortgage for 100 000€. To complete our project we need to raise 30 000€"".

“In order to reach our fundraising goal, we designed perks to give back as much value as possible to our contributors. In fact, we are basically proposing you to spend your next vacation in our B&B in Torino (or to make a gift to a friend or a loved one)! After you contribute, we will get in contact with you to define details. When the campaign is over, we will update all contributors weekly with pictures and messages, to show our work progress and get feedback from the community”

“Torino is the main city of Piedmont region, in northwestern Italy. While it is not a famous tourist destination like Florence, or Rome, it has one of the most longstanding cultural and artistic history in the country. In fact, Torino was the first capital of Italy and the home of its royal family, the House of Savoy. Many consider it to be the European capital of Baroque, as most of the historical city center was built in this style under the influence of Savoy family. The 2006 Winter Olympics brought this half forgotten city under the spotlight and the whole world rediscovered its aristocratic atmosphere, the centre filled with ancient cafes, arcaded streets, restaurants and churches, its grand boulevards and palaces, parks, museums and art galleries. Since then, Torino became an increasingly popular touristic destination, something you really don’t want to miss!”

“We believe that travelling is not just about reaching a destination, but more about having the possibility to dive into a new culture and see life from a new perspective. In all our travels, we always preferred hostels and B&Bs to hotels and not because of price convenience. Our goal is to give our guests some cultural influence of Italy and Torino. We will provide our guests with some knowledge of Italian language, food and traditions. Also, we want to promote sharing information between guests. For example, in our B&B we have a suggestion book, where our guests have possibility to write their comments about the places they visited and have been impressed by, which future guests can take ideas from. We are focused on creating the basis for a unique travel experience, with all the comforts of a hotel.
Thanks to this fundraising, we will be able to create a common space to organize activities like Italian and cooking lessons and propose guided tours of Torino and nearby areas.”

“Yeap. It is not just our enthusiasm and passion which brings us here today. Our experience in this business gives us the confidence that, no matter what, we will bring this project to the end. Our current B&B room was originally the laboratory of my father. After he retired, it started to collect dust and became a storage room where to hide useless objects. While the laboratory stopped to produce money, it was still producing expenses for my parents in the form of taxes and bills each month. As we were striving to make a budget for our life together, we realized the potential of this abandoned asset
column2: we proposed to my parents to take over all the expenses of the laboratory in change of the possibility to use it as we wanted.”

column1: “Leveraging my passion for interior design, and Umberto's and his father's manual ability, with a lot of imagination and energy we turned this space into a cozy apartment in which we are now hosting tourists coming to visit Torino. Now we have fresh ideas on how to design next rooms which will make our guests, who are travelers in their hearts, to travel even easier, lighter and bring home a remarkable experience!”
“In case the project is only partially funded, we have several backup plans:
90-99%: we will live on a very strict budget for some time, save the extra money and go from there :).
60-89%: we will downsize our project (look for a smaller apartment).

30-59%: we will look for an apartment on auction. This will greatly reduce acquisition costs but will significantly delay our project, as Italian bureaucracy can take up to 6-12 months before an apartment bought on auction is delivered to the buyer.
less than 30%: we will use the money to make improvements to our current B&B room.
In any case, we can assure you that all perks will be confirmed and we will be extremely happy to welcome in Torino our contributors!”

“If you can’t give us any financial help, you can still share our story and this link with your friends, or support us with ideas and feedback. Whether you are an active traveler or you are working in the hosting business, or even if you just feel like you have something to say, we will appreciate your contribution very much!”",30.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Turin, Italy",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/b-b-torino-welcome-home/pica

column5: >This is a call for all the music lovers, all the dance groovers, all the people who loves people and all of you that loves life.

column1:
Our Funmaker enterprise needs your help. At the moment we lost our ability to drive the fun van and create the unique silent disco events we created in the past 2 years. 

Can't Help Financially? You can still help by sharing it on social media. Thanks

column5: type=text%2Fhtml&amp

column1: We want to build FUNMAKER 2. It's our well known silent disco party van and our plan is to make the second one heaps more fun but still keep it simple. Our crew is waiting for you to support us with what you can so we can give you something you have not experienced before. A total interactive machine that where ever it parks it opens up a silent party. But a really good one. Silent, Sufficient, full of lights, sound and sophistication but yet simple and friendly.
AS YOU GIVE MORE WE WILL BUILD A MUCH BETTER EXPERIENCE AND BELIEVE ME WE HAVE SOME EPIC IDEAS IN OUR SLEEVE.

What is IMPORTANT  to share is that we know how to do it just because we did it before. We know what works, what not, who likes what and what looks good. It is all a matter of financials to make it happen again and better.

I don't know if you ever experienced funmaker silent disco but it's a life changing one. You'll see when you will meet us face to face and in the mean time on the screen. Because we are expanding to the world and soon we will be everywhere.
How will you know about it?
Funmaker.com.au
Funmaker on facebook
column2:
> SILENT PARTY

It's a party where instead of loud speakers you have a number of people wearing headphones. There are more then 1dj playing at the same time so the user get to choose different type of music at any given time. Such a simple concept brings such a huge positive impact on people. The result – An unforgettable, revolutionary experience of dancing and interacting. Not only you get in your own zone, choose your own music and have the most private experience possible, you are sharing it with all the people around that have headphones too, all in a public space and nature.

Silent Disco is the perfect example to show how individual and collective are depended on each other. This concept is taking over the world and mainly designed for outdoors but also used a lot indoors. As we break the physical boundaries and change the use of public spaces we break the boundaries between us “strangers”.
column5: key=64da7ba9305b45b68029ce9f0c7e4d75&amp

column1: The connection between individuals &
column2: the collective has always fascinated me. My passion and reason for funmaker initially was how music and dancing connects people together. Today it's much more. When people are united by a positive cause, in this case happiness, all fears inhibitions &amp
column3: judgment fade away. With the right tools, people step into their unlimited awesomeness. Some of funmaker's tools are the headphones &amp
column4: the quality of experience we create.

column1: INTERACTION is the asphalt which we use to pave our trail and write our story. I chose to start Funmaker's journey with a platform that represent the great idea of dependency:

Since the first Funmaker party in Byron Bay (2013), I have witnessed an amazing type of communication – Happiness. It's infectious, It's collective and it's where we thrive as collective as in one. A second after they put the headphones on they choose to dance as wild as they can, they choose to stay in a group while they have miles of beach and park space to dance on, they choose to hold hands and get to know each other and they choose to expunge the distance and inhibitions and get together.
“And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.” Friedrich Nietzsche

Then, I thought to myself: “If it happens with such a simple technology we can easily invent more ways to interact and by that we steer technology back in the right direction. To unite the collective while making the individual happy.”

That's how I came up with the whole network idea and the term “Social Technology”. It's all about our present moments and we will achieve better ones together and alone. Going back to the roots of the ancient, eternal knowledge and all the simple things we love in life.

The Funmaker network is already alive. Organically funmaker attracted passionate people from all around. They were blown by the simplicity and also by the innovative thinking of setting up an 1981 van as a silent disco van. It inspired me to see how one's passionate action can affect another. It made sense to make it mobile. Life is a journey and changes all the time. Same way, I wanted to travel and change my views as I go, meet more people and learn more about myself and life through it. Symbolic and true to everything when living spontaneous and dynamic life. And there it was, traveling while enjoying giving some fun to others. We went to so many places, jumped under the hood of this van so many times to keep it running, Meeting and creating the next party with so many people that I couldn't ask for more. I got the biggest present of all. I got to make a dream, my dream come true...
HOW WE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN?

So after we get your support we go back to the drawing board and check lists.  We finalise the tiny small details according to the budget we have. Then time table to sync it with our deadline and your rewards. Also prepare the video team to follow the whole process which is a huge project by itself but it worth every moment to see your reaction when it's done.

column5: ><i>Then get materials &amp

column1: Inside structure
Solar system
Dj decks modularity
lights &
Charging station for headphones
Art work on the outside
Mechanic adaptation to it all.
Certification of the changes
Many more interactive add ons that only the ones who experienced it knows and i will keep as a later surprise.
After that is beginning of work
Weeks and weeks of building and weaving ALL the features into one. Our team is excited for this one.
Then a big test run for it all.
column5: >Fixing and tweaking
>And then...
>BIG LAUNCH PARTY. WITH ALL OF YOUR REWARDS AND THE VAN DONE AND DELIVERED WE WILL CREATE A BIG PARTY. STREAMED LIVE TO YOU ALL.
>WE WILL PROJECT A HUGE THANKS TO ALL OF YOU  ON THE NIGHT.

column1: When we designed the last van it was quick, simple and genius.

Now it is even better and we are adding more features to the van that we haven't tried before. I teamed up with a mechanical engineer and a well experienced crew to bring way more then the necessary knowledge and tools to complete the van.

We want to get it ready before the Australia summer  and that is a challenge we can face and complete.

But nothing that can fail in this one.

Can't Help Financially? You can still help by sharing it on social media. Thanks


Thank you to the edge of the universe and back. We will NEVER forget you.

lights & projection work

What is Night Ninja's?

Homelessness in QLD is on the rise with areas such as the Redlands Shire Council seeing spikes in those without accommodation or a place to lay their heads.  Imagine how you would feel if you, or someone close to you was in this situation and no-one was there to help them out.  That is exactly what Night Ninja's is all about.  We are not a religious organisation, this isn't about spiritual belief , it is simply about making a difference to those less fortunate and doing what we can, because we can.  We provide clothing, blankets and other necessary items so that those without can at least have some protection from the elements.  In addition to this we also offer food and referral to other programs that can assist in gaining temporary and permanent accommodation.

What is the Plan? 

Right now, we are a Facebook page that goes out on the streets a few times a month to help out in the local area.  What we want to be is a fully fledged, registered not-for-profit organisation that provides real support and makes real change.   A drop in centre in the area that provides necessities, referral services, access to basic facilities (showers, toilets, kitchen) as well as access to computers to look for accommodation and where appropriate, employment and other support services and somewhere that people can launder their clothes and sleeping items while utilising the facilities.

Registering as a not-for-profit is a laborious task and takes funding, likewise, being able to set up a drop in centre in the area also takes money.  Currently we do not receive any Government funding, however we will be actively petitioning Local, State and Federal Governments for financial contributions and support.  We will also seek out industry partners to assist with donating food, clothing and other necessary items to help make a difference.

The Impact

In today's society, it is all too easy to hit 'like' or 'follow', yet it takes real heart and compassion to actually donate, regardless of how small.  That small donation could mean the difference between a person sleeping on the streets with nothing, or a person sleeping in temporary accommodation with a warm meal and company.

With your help, we will be able to establish a dedicated facility that is accessible to those who need it.  Your donation, no matter how big or small, will contribute to the bigger picture and to making a real difference. A dedicated drop in centre with real facilities, real people who care and a team of volunteers going out at least twice a week to do what they can on the streets.
What we will Buy and How we will Spend the Funds
<ul>
• Register the Not For Profit and Charity Status.
• Lobby Government for financial support and contributions.
• Securing a facility - there is one we have found that is affordable and in the right spot, we just need the funds to secure it.
• Secure all necessary insurances.
• Secure a Van for Night Ninja Teams, Food Deliveries and Stock runs.
• Build a team of volunteers.
• Secure providers for partner and referral services, legal, counselling, accommodation, food suppliers, education, medical and all other associated referral programs.
• Link in with local businesses for additional donations and support.
• Create an environment that is supportive, nurturing and available when people need it most.
<div>

You CAN Make a Difference

A simple donation of money, time, service or product can help this get off the ground and become a reality.  You could personally impact the life of someone who needs your support and compassion by simply donating a few dollars.  If you are interested in giving your time and joining the volunteer army, please get in contact with us and we will keep you posted with opportunities to get involved.
Don't forget to like us on Facebook and sign up to our Newsletter to keep up to date with how you can be involved!
<div>
https://www.facebook.com/night.ninjas.australia

Bun Di Café Scuol
Ein einzigartiges Konzept in Engadin.

Unser Bistro soll mit Veranstaltungen vor Ort die Ortschaft Scuol wieder zum Leben erwachen lassen.
Unsere Paninoteca unter anderem Sandwiches mit Fleisch und Käse aus der Region. Das Bistro hat rund 100 Plätze und bietet am Samstagabend immer Livemusik an. Ob ein Panino zum take-Away, einen Rotwein zur italienischen Focaccia, ein Gelato für den Gluscht, die Bistro Köstlichkeiten wurden mit Sorgfalt zubereitet. Bun Di Café steht für authentische italienische Küche. Der Lokalauftritt innen wie aussen ist typisch italienisch und passt zu jeder Event Ambiente.

Unterstützer finanzieren Ideen, die ihnen gefallen und von Personen, denen sie vertrauen. Hier sind einige Punkte, die du in diesem Abschnitt beachten solltest:

  • Wir sind ein Junges Team und bringen viel Erfahrung in der Gastronomie mit.
  • Für uns ist dieses Projekt so wichtig, weil in der Region genau diese Ambiente fehlt, sei es für einheimische sowie auch Touristen.
• Helfen Sie uns beim letzten Endpsurt damit das Café auf den Sommer eröffnet wird.
Schon jetzt bedanken wir uns bei dir!

• Wir brauchen eine Restfinanzierung von 100.000.- CHF damit wir das Lokal definitiv eröffnen können. es wurden schon ca. 200.000.- CHF investiert und da wir ein junges Team sind, brauchen wir deine Unterstützung.

• Jeder der Mitmacht erhält von uns bei jedem Besuch in Scuol ein Essensgutschein und Gratiseintritt für verschiedene Events vor Ort ein Jahr lang! Sowie bei Erlaubnis würden wir gerne dich im Café als Sponsor erwähnen dürfen und dich verewigen mit Bild und Unterschrift.
• Sollten wir das Ziel der Finanzierung nicht erreichen, werden wir den Einsatz im Unterengadin für Gute Zwecke spenden. Jedoch ist unser Ziel ganz Klar gesetzt.
Was bewirken wir mit der Neueröffnung?

• Für die Region Scuol (Unterengadin) ist ein solches Projekt sehr wichtig, da die Region frischen Aufwind braucht. Sowie die Jungen durch den Mangel an Möglichkeiten sich auch dementsprechend von der Region distanzieren.
• Wir haben schon über 2/3 des Projektes finanziert. Daher ist das eingesetzte Kapital von dir eine Bereicherung für die Region, da wir es nicht sterben lassen möchten.
• Die komplette Installation ist sowie erstellt worden, es fehlt nur noch die Restfinanzierung für die Einrichtung welche auch schon inder Porduktion ist und zu 50% fertig gestellt wurde.
Risiken &
column2:
Herausforderungen

Sollten wir das Kapital aufbringen, werden wir das Bistro eröffnen können und durch unser einzigartiges Konzept in der Region ein Mehrwert gewinnen. Die Risiken bestehen nur, wnen die Restfinanzierung nicht zustande kommt.

    Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

    Du kannst dich auch an unserem Bistro beteiligen und dadurch verschaffen wir Transparenz sowie Vertrauen. Wir sind für alles offen, nur damit das Projekt jetzt umgesetzt wird.

    • Zudem würde es uns sehr helfen, wenn du dieses Vorhaben mit anderen Teilst und somit uns indirekt hilfst.

column1: • Du kannst hier auf dieser Seite die Kampagne über soziale Netzwerke teilen.

Unterstützer finanzieren Ideen, die ihnen gefallen und von Personen, denen sie vertrauen. Hier sind einige Punkte, die du in diesem Abschnitt beachten solltest:  Wir sind ein Junges Team und bringen viel Erfahrung in der Gastronomie mit. Für uns ist dieses Projekt so wichtig, weil in der Region genau diese Ambiente fehlt, sei es für einheimische sowie auch Touristen.
Helfen Sie uns beim letzten Endpsurt damit das Café auf den Sommer eröffnet wird.
Schon jetzt bedanken wir uns bei dir!

Wir brauchen eine Restfinanzierung von 100.000.- CHF damit wir das Lokal definitiv eröffnen können. es wurden schon ca. 200.000.- CHF investiert und da wir ein junges Team sind, brauchen wir deine Unterstützung.

Jeder der Mitmacht erhält von uns bei jedem Besuch in Scuol ein Essensgutschein und Gratiseintritt für verschiedene Events vor Ort ein Jahr lang! Sowie bei Erlaubnis würden wir gerne dich im Café als Sponsor erwähnen dürfen und dich verewigen mit Bild und Unterschrift.
Sollten wir das Ziel der Finanzierung nicht erreichen, werden wir den Einsatz im Unterengadin für Gute Zwecke spenden. Jedoch ist unser Ziel ganz Klar gesetzt.
Was bewirken wir mit der Neueröffnung?

Für die Region Scuol (Unterengadin) ist ein solches Projekt sehr wichtig, da die Region frischen Aufwind braucht. Sowie die Jungen durch den Mangel an Möglichkeiten sich auch dementsprechend von der Region distanzieren.
Wir haben schon über 2/3 des Projektes finanziert. Daher ist das eingesetzte Kapital von dir eine Bereicherung für die Region, da wir es nicht sterben lassen möchten.
Die komplette Installation ist sowie erstellt worden, es fehlt nur noch die Restfinanzierung für die Einrichtung welche auch schon inder Porduktion ist und zu 50% fertig gestellt wurde.

Risiken & Herausforderungen  Sollten wir das Kapital aufbringen, werden wir das Bistro eröffnen können und durch unser einzigartiges Konzept in der Region ein Mehrwert gewinnen. Die Risiken bestehen nur, wnen die Restfinanzierung nicht zustande kommt.    Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann Du kannst dich auch an unserem Bistro beteiligen und dadurch verschaffen wir Transparenz sowie Vertrauen. Wir sind für alles offen, nur damit das Projekt jetzt umgesetzt wird.  Zudem würde es uns sehr helfen, wenn du dieses Vorhaben mit anderen Teilst und somit uns indirekt hilfst.
Du kannst hier auf dieser Seite die Kampagne über soziale Netzwerke teilen.",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns
|","Scuol, Switzerland",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bun-di-cafe/pica

>Hello! 

We fall in love each other like a year before and now we are getting married at 18th July! It was a dream to get our lifes together at the beginning, and than I made my surprise proposal at 1st January! She said YES! :)

We started to plan for our dream come true. Now we need your help our Alice in Wonderland concept wedding to make it real .

There are too many expenses, like wedding place, organization, decoration, transport, photography, gathering our family in that day (they're living in other cities, far away from us..) etc. .

The Concept:

We want to make our wedding concept about Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland and Steampunk-Victorian. All the area will be full of accesories about this concept.

Who We Are and Why What We Do Is Important

Mutual Aid Networks build the local economy so it works both for people like you and for the larger goal of community wealth building. Collaborative economic strategies – timebanking, price-based mutual credit, shared resources, and cooperative savings and lending pools – are now being used successfully as separate strategies around the world. By bringing these forms of community sharing and exchange into a comprehensive, complementary system, we have created a scalable model that is being used by the economically disadvantaged to make their communities more economically and socially resilient.
column4:
>Our Immediate Goals and How You Can Help

We are seeking to raise $10,000 as part of the official launch of this potentially transformative project. Your contribution of $5, $10, $25, $50, $100 or more will be used to build the Mutual Aid Networks at this crucial stage in our development,. This includes creating a series of webinars to recruit, inform, and engage members. It will also finance an important gathering of our supporters and partners in late August of 2015 in Madison, Wisconsin.

Many of our internationally-acknowledged founding members and advisory board members will be in attendance. The training will feature workshops, collaborative development of our project sharing software, and in-person team-building that will provide the foundation for all that will follow. Your support will truly get you in on the ground floor of this bold international initiative.

Our Roots in Projects Modeling a Shared Economy

Mutual Aid Networks (MANs) are an outgrowth of the Dane County TimeBank, nationally and internationally respected as one of the largest and most successful organizations promoting the model of a shared economy. As part of the launch of the Mutual Aid Networks (the MANs), the TimeBank is serving as the fiscal sponsor of our crowdfunding campaign.

Crowdfunding and Collaboration

This crowdfunding campaign reflects the collaborative spirit that is the very foundation for our work. By investing in our efforts at this crucial early stage in our implementation, your support will help catalyze the involvement of others, and like many successful crowdfunding projects, we hope that enthusiasm and support for this project will grow organically in its scope and strength, spreading the abundance of knowledge and resources worldwide.
column5:
>


Partners and Pilot Sites Both Close to Home and Worldwide

We have assembled a team and are growing an amazing network of pilot sites and partners who are willing to share what is necessary to take your own work and the projects that embody the causes that you care about to the next level. Your investment in this work has the potential to pay social dividends of inestimable value. While competition and narrowness define all too much of the current multinational economy, the spirit of collaboration and resource sharing inherent to the Mutual Aid Network points the path to a more equitable way.

The Many Ways You Can Participate and Contribute

While your financial contribution toward this site - in whatever amount you can afford - is an essential component to our success, the project itself models the notion that there are many different ways that you can help. We have a wide variety of workgroups and projects that you can learn more about at our website: www.mutualaidnetwork.org.
column8:
/>


Please Help Us Spread the Word

Another important way you can help is to share this Indiegogo site with your family, friends, and colleagues via Facebook, Twitter, email, and other forms of social media. Please get out there and spread the word about our campaign! Again, please contact us if you'd like to help us in realizing any of these possibilities. Working together, we can spread the word about this amazing project to every corner of the country and the world!","Who We Are and Why What We Do Is ImportantMutual Aid Networks build the local economy so it works both for people like you and for the larger goal of community wealth building. Hey guys I'm Malachi, a quick update (if you don't follow me on Facebook). First off I want to thank you and everyone else who has supported me and William's Facebook pages until this point, but now we want to take what we have and use it for something really positive! Me and Willie have been making videos and pictures for Facebook for a little bit now and have been lucky enough to get the fan base we have. We sat and talked for awhile about what we could do to make a change and really take and advance of this opportunity. So we want to let you guys know that we are beginning the Malachi Clark and William Sewell Self Love Project. We are going to start making videos talking about why you and everyone else deserves the world regardless of their race, sexual orientation, gender, religion, anything! And we are going to need your help. We are going to be raising money to pay for a camera, shirts for you guys, meet and greets and any other cost that might pop up that we will need so in a short amount of time so to get those initial funds we made this. If you read all the way to the end I really mess with you, please share this and let your friends know!
